Reviews.Title: Worth one to buy
Reviews.Author: Satya
Reviews.Content: I bought this 2 weeks back and i am enjoying taking pics with this one. It gives value for the money.

Reviews.Title: Good pictures but a little slow
Reviews.Author: Michael J. Hendry
Reviews.Content: Takes good pictures and does everything you would want a camera of this type to do. Only complaints, the flash has to be lifted manually to use. It doesn't pop up automatically when needed. Saving the images to the memory card is a little slow.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SX130IS 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 12x Wide Angle Optical Image Stabilized Zoom with 3.0-Inch LCD
Reviews.Author: Busybee "always"
Reviews.Content: Very good product with intuitive controls.Pros:HD videoexcellent zoomgreat controlsgood picture saturation and colors12x optical zoomImage stabilizationpicture modesuses AA-size disposable or rechargeable batteriesTons of preset effectsCons:Fixed LCD screenUses only two AA batteries reducing the number of shotsAll in all an excellent camera to buy.

Reviews.Title: If you are looking for a new camera this is the one to buy!!!
Reviews.Author: epm0609
Reviews.Content: I recently got the Canon PowerShot SX130is and i love it already. I love that the camera has a top of 48x zoom! This camera also comes with great effects. In the SCN mode their are tons of options such as fireworks, color swap, fish eye, and my personal favorate color accent (you choose a color and everything els that isnt that color turns black and white). For the great effects, amazing zoom, and overall greatness of this camera it is one you should not hesitaate to buy. The price is alo great for the features.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera
Reviews.Author: FS
Reviews.Content: I've owned the SX100, SX110, SX120 and now the SX130.  I love them all and none have ever had a malfunction. They take great outdoor pics and the zoom is excellent.  The video quality is amazing. The Sanyo eneloop batteries work great with this camera, but I always carry spares.The only complaint I have is with all point and shoots, the low light pics (concerts especially) are blurry and the time between shots is too long.  I wish they would come out with a point and shoot that is good for concerts, which is the main reason I use.I also own Canon G11, S90, SX30, and a couple of Sony's and a Panasonic.

Reviews.Title: Quality is horrible
Reviews.Author: Angela M.
Reviews.Content: I had the Canon Powershot SX110IS which I loved.  This was the newer model and I had hoped to love it as much.  The camera feels and works like a cheap camera.  Not the quality I was expecting at all.  The biggest problem I had was the zoom.  The switch did not want to cooperate, and it would not display how far out you were zoomed.  My zoomed pictures looked awful and blurry, and I did not even have the camera zoomed out very far.  Having had such a winner with the 110, I am really disappointed and returning this one right away!

Reviews.Title: Not recommended for parents of small children
Reviews.Author: J A Cook
Reviews.Content: My old Canon Power Shot is acting up so we thought we'd get a new one. I was hoping for a little better zoom and above all for quicker turnover time between shots. Kids move fast and I was missing shots; the time between pictures was probably about 2 seconds.This one takes 2-3 seconds, and that's without the flash. With the flash (which is way too bright) you're probably looking at 5-7 seconds, which is an eternity in toddler time. The zoom is great, so I can get a fantastic shot from across the room, but it's of the kid who's gotten bored with smiling for the camera and turned away.The video is fantastic, but the auto-focus means that if you're watching one kid and another wanders through the shot, it can stay blurred for about 5 seconds while it tries to focus on them both. I can only imagine what it would be like if you're trying to get a video of your child on a crowded soccer field.Finally, the batteries are basically eaten alive. We had to change them after 3 or 4 days, and we weren't using it much.On the whole, I suspect this camera takes brilliant pictures for people who like dressy photography, but if you're trying to get some cute snaps and video of your small children, I would recommend you look elsewhere. Customer service, however, was helpful and our return was accepted.

Reviews.Title: Best point and shoot - do not get the newer model - insist on the 130!
Reviews.Author: Bec "bec16"
Reviews.Content: watch and read the reviews on the 130, and then the 140, 150, 160, and you'll note: they are not as glowing as the 130... the 130 has a tremendous lens, with supreme color for the price, and has the best stabilized low-light setting of any point and shoot I've found. This low-light setting allows you to capture natural-light photos indoors and out with fair to excellent clarity, in situations where you don't want to use the flash, or can't. Fantastic camera - there's a reason that this camera still retails for nearly the original retail price, while the newer models are $20-50 cheaper. I had to order this camera THREE TIMES, because the first two orders, they shipped me the newer model, even though they said on order they had the 130 in stock. I sent them back - they are NOT equivalent. No one can believe the great quality shots I get with this. NOTE: I recommend doing test shots with the "portrait" ("head" icon), landscape, and auto settings, as i find the Portrait setting is often the best speed and clarity for most shots, better than the Auto setting in many cases, and the Landscape ("mountain" icon) setting is great not only for actual landscapes, but when you are capturing pictures out of a moving train/plane/car to get a clear distance shot and avoid having only the window in focus! The "parrot" icon - color saturation - often gives a more realistic sunset color rendering than other settings, and the low-light setting ("candle" icon) not only does a good job in low light, it's also perfect for shots where you want a quick shutter speed but don't want to go manual, even in good light. Finally, manual controls are there for when you want to really get creative, and there are fun settings like "posterize", "miniaturize", and others.Please Canon - bring back the 130 tech specs in the newer versions... I've had 2 of them, and they're simply the best.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Keith Rademacher
Reviews.Content: Great camera, easy to use and produces high quality images.  This was a replacement for my work camera that had over 10,000 photos taken before I dropped it in water and sand and destroyed it.  There was no doubt that I wanted another one just like it.  The new camera now has over 1000 shots and is working perfectly!.

Reviews.Title: Great for lighted areas, but flash takes a long time to recharge
Reviews.Author: MJCJ
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for over a year.  It is wonderful and easily takes great pictures.  My only complaint is it takes a long time for the flash to recharge between pictures.  This is inconvenient when I am taking pictures of my kids and have to wait several seconds between shots.  I expected the camera to take pictures more quickly from one picture to the next, which it does when you are not using the flash.I would not consider this a compact camera.  I cannot put it in my back pocket and it is much thicker than my old PowerShot camera.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot SX130IS
Reviews.Author: Deborah Liguori
Reviews.Content: While there is a newer model out I couldn't pass up the great price. It still has great specifications for the price. It's small enough to fit in my fanny pack for those family vacation pictures. I can get plenty of pictures and video with the 32GB SIM card that I have installed. I can put the camera in auto mode and shoot just about any pictures from scenic to action pictures of my daughter playing softball. The only complaint I have is that it just eats batteries. But then it is a common issue with point and shoot cameras. Stay with the higher end batteries, they may cost more but they'll at least last longer than the cheaper ones.

Reviews.Title: Favorite Camera
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for myself to replace my aging 2006 Powershot. I wanted a camera that was portable enough to fit in a pocket for travel yet still allowed for shot customization. The manual modes were my favorite on my old Powershot and I was looking for something similar. The camera performs really well outside although it tends to have less detail indoors under low light conditions. It is great for a beginner because it allows you to slowly play around and learn aperture settings and exposure times. I have taken great shots of the Moon at night and even taken shots of Jupiter with Io, Ganymede, Europa, and Calisto with the TV settings and full zoom. My one recommendation if you take longer exposures would be to use only Lithium batteries or rechargeables. Both Duracell and Energizer gave me a good battery life. Regular alkalines were sometimes drained after 4 15 second shots so I quickly changed the types. I purchased the same model for a family member a few years later and she loved it.

Reviews.Title: Great Travel Camera
Reviews.Author: Sportsman
Reviews.Content: Bought this last year for a trip abroad. We try to "standardize" our gear on stuff that's either dual 110/220 volt compatible, OR can run on rechargable AA batteries. It's getting harder to find good cameras that run on AA's, so we were very happy to find this Canon (our second Canon, which is now my "go to" brand). Brought it, some Sony Eneloop batteries and a dual voltage charger. Very happy with the image and video quality as wel as battery life. We bought 8 Eneloops - 2 in the camera, always carried two spare with us, left 4 on the charger just in case, never ran out of power. We could have got by with just 4, but since we were travelling in an area with frequent power outages, wanted to make sure we could survive a day or two without recharging. Camera's a little bigger than our last, but still fits easily in a purse or (large) pocket.

Reviews.Title: Canon camera
Reviews.Author: Diane Heinrich
Reviews.Content: I really like this camera.  It takes nice pictures, but the batteries do not last too long.  I had read a review in Consumer Reports that it was a good camera for the price.

Reviews.Title: Great camera with RECHARGEABLE BATTERIES.
Reviews.Author: Thomas M. Meadows
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera since December and if it weren't for two issues, I'd give it 5 stars.First, the legendary problem with battery life. This camera is a well known battery vampire, but so long as you use decent quality rechargeable batteries, you are going to be fine. I carry two changes with me. I shot a couple hundred photos at a big monster truck rally in North Carolina on two sets of batteries (and a couple 30 second videos).Second, my camera seems to want to lock up upon turning it on if I have a memory card in it that has pics from my cell phone. If I move all the data from the memory card that the cell phone had(an LG Octane), so that the card is blank, it works fine. I can't really fault Canon for this, I suppose, but it is weird.For everyone screaming about battery problems, take a deep breath and buy some rechargeables. Life gets way easier then.EDIT, 7/31/2013After using this camera for 1.5 years, it's still going strong. I love the camera. Yes it still eats batteries but we just use rechargeables and carry extra.

Reviews.Title: CANON SX 130IS Camera Shut Down
Reviews.Author: Shaun Considine "Shaun Considine"
Reviews.Content: Had this camera for a year, it took some great photos, then last month itstarted missing pictures. Menu factors  (such as Set Time)  would appearwhen it was turned it on, and yesterday, when switched on, thegreen light blinked and and the lens appeared but the view screen stayed dark.and camera can no longer take photos.  It won't operate in any mode, includingretrieving recent photos. Tried everything  - new batteries, etc.  Canon advisedto send it to their service centre in Virginia, which we will do.PS.  Good news.  Canon replaced camera. New one works fine

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SX130IS
Reviews.Author: Carla973
Reviews.Content: Takes great photos. Still quite new for me but I love it so far. I'm used to the super compact models but wanted something with more options this go around and I'm not disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Useful, convenient
Reviews.Author: shopper123
Reviews.Content: It has good picture qualities and it's convenient. Being able to use two AA batteries instead of a rechargeable battery is a plus. Video eats up a lot of battery, though.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: AnnieB
Reviews.Content: This Canon camera is awesome!!!  Just took over 200 pics on a tour of NY in all types of light and every single picture turned out great!!!

Reviews.Title: Great camera, decent battery life with rechargeables
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Inga"
Reviews.Content: There are a lot of reviews here outlining the pros and cons, so I won't go into a lot of detail. I used this camera on a 5 month personal trip through SE Asia and got tons of great photos--I love the zoom. I wanted to comment on battery life, since that is a common thread in these reviews. You *must* use high-quality rechargeables, though I have to say, traveling through many different countries, it was critical that I have a camera that took commonly available batteries. The few times I was caught (through my own lack of foresight) without a charged battery I was always able to find AA batteries, even in the most remote village,  which got me through the day until I could charge my rechargeables. I always made sure I had a backup pair with me and never had a problem unless I forgot them, usually getting through 1-3 days of non-stop photos. I got a small travel-sized recharger in Vietnam that worked great. I'm a travel writer and photos are essential so I also took a smaller Canon point-and-shoot that I could have in my smallest purse, which was also my backup camera, and it was so convenient that they both took AAs. I was hesitant about the whole AA battery story at first, but I'll never go back due to the convenience and availability factor.I also wanted to say that Canon provides excellent customer service. They replaced my camera without any questions when I sent it in for service while it was under warranty. I'm not saying exactly what went wrong, but it was likely not a manufacturing defect, and the turnaround was quick. I was very impressed and it solidified my respect for this company. We have quite a stable of Canon products and I'm sure we'll be adding more in coming years.

Reviews.Title: Powerful and Robust Point-and-Shoot
Reviews.Author: J. House "Drink More Java"
Reviews.Content: I've owned this camera for a little over a year now. Upgraded from an older Sony Cybershot, and there's a night and day difference between the two. This is a great camera if you're looking for an inexpensive, simple to use, but robust point and shoot.The Things I liked:720p Video recordingDecent (stereo) audio recording quality12x Optical Zoom with Image stabilizingThings I didn't like:Use of AA batteries (unless you get a decent set of Li-ion rechargeable s, expect to burn through AA's like no tomorrow)Noise caused by lens when recording and zooming in/out (it's fairly loud on the video track)Speed of zoom when recording is slowOverall I really have liked this camera. Its compact size is ideal for sticking in a pocket, and it has good enough glass to take nice pictures and record crisp video. Really the only downside is the AA batteries, but if you use this  with rechargeable Li-ions (such as Sanyo's Eneloops), or as a secondary camera then it's a non-issue.

Reviews.Title: My first digital camera
Reviews.Author: LRS
Reviews.Content: I ABSOLUTELY LOVE THIS CAMERA.  I have recommended it to all my friends and relatives.  I also purchased NIMH batteries and charger.  This is my first digital camera and I find it very easy to use and it takes great pictures.  I can also zoom in on something that is far away.  I like to take pictures of my pets, deer, birds, plants, as well as family.  It was very easy to download the pictures from the camera to my computer.  The picture quality is great and the batteries last a long time.  What a savings to be able to take multiple pictures and only develop the ones you want.  I wish I had gotten a digital camera sooner, but I was afraid it would be too complicated for me.

Reviews.Title: disappointed in the end
Reviews.Author: vartan
Reviews.Content: nice camera for its price, but once it stops working, say goodbye to the unit. i had mine for now over 15 months everything was ok, but suddenly it stopped working, with no apparent reason. tried to call CANON, their suggestion  to me was to send the unit to their repair center in the East  and for about 135$ plus 2 way shipping with insurance of course, they told me they will try to fix the problem. the new one on AMAZON costs about 145$. what a great idea from CANON.

Reviews.Title: great deal on a decent little camera
Reviews.Author: MoD-1
Reviews.Content: I shoot my SX130 regularly using the CHDK hack which greatly enhances the usability of the camera.The only real "problem" I have with it is that it chews through alkaline AAs.But I bought a pack of 16 from CVS for $15 and so far I'm halfway through it.other than that, it's a great camera.Maybe not quite as good IQ-wise as my G9 but the lens reach is much better.buy and enjoy

Reviews.Title: Great Lil Camera
Reviews.Author: yolanda
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera after ALOT of deliberation. Even though I wasn't too thrilled about the battery situation, I got it anyway. It is totally worth it! Just make sure you get rechargeable lithium batteries...You will save loads, I took like 50-60 pix and the low battery icon started flashing...that's the ONLY negative thing I have to say about this camera.

Reviews.Title: Not bad, but not awesome
Reviews.Author: Amy M
Reviews.Content: I took this camera to a convention recently and discovered it does not do well with taking action shots.  It's awesome for still shots, granted, but I had lots of trouble if anyone moved at all in the pictures - they all came out blurry.  I tried different settings with the same result.  I'm a little bummed, but I'll keep the camera.

Reviews.Title: practicing
Reviews.Author: Leyla
Reviews.Content: Before I order this camera, I read all the reviews and was some how happy I find the right camera for me. And happy with it, just practicing and making daily pictures and happy about that so much. Easy to use, and the pics are very clearly and I think in a short time my pics getting better and better. Love Canon products and was happy also got the camera in few days.

Reviews.Title: Missing Moments
Reviews.Author: fripp017
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my birthday last year, just before Christmas. I was using a Sony Cyber Shot and I wanted to get a better, but still compact camera. This one seemed like it would be perfect. But, as soon as I tested it out, I called customer service because I thought something was wrong with the camera. It can take up to 30 seconds in between shots. Sometimes I feel like I'm missing moments because the camera is taking too long to save the picture to the sd card. And now, almost a year later, my twin boys are trying to walk and the camera is having trouble keeping up with the pictures I want to take. The video is amazing and high quality, but the videos are so large they are hard to share. The high optical zoom is amazing!! Sometimes the high zoom pictures look better than the regular pictures! So, if you have the patience this camera is perfect for you! If not, you'll be left searching for a new one like me.

Reviews.Title: Great Buy
Reviews.Author: whatman
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for my wife, and she loves it.  So do I.  It has many features, and some we haven't quite figured out yet.  The picture quality is great.  **However, the wife got upset with it at first because she didn't read the directions, which say to press the button half-way to focus, and then press it all the way down once it focuses to take the picture.  No complaints with it so far.

Reviews.Title: Sweet Litte Camera
Reviews.Author: Gail Swartzell
Reviews.Content: I love this camera.  I had one previously and lost it.  I had gotten a digital SLR for a gift and that is a great camera.  I like the Canon because you can take it with you when you don't want a full camera kit.  I take a lot of barn and wild flower pictures.  With the Canon I can grab it and shot.  No set up, just point and shoot.  I would highly recommend this little guy.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: Derek R. Patterson "gina82"
Reviews.Content: This camera is nice and overall a great value.  I have not noticed the short battery life previously explained in reviews.  I find the camera difficult to hold sometimes.  The lens is so much bigger then a regular point and shoot so the camera s not square.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Renu
Reviews.Content: I got this camera 3 months back and every photo I took has come out beautifully.Its complete worth for the money.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the Money
Reviews.Author: Sanders
Reviews.Content: This is my first mega-zoom point and shoot.  I went from a little 5 mega-pixel Kodak that in a bundle cost around $100 around 8 yrs ago to this Canon.  I could not be happier.  I have not tried out the video yet and most likely won't as I do not use it(only once with the other camera).  The easy of use of the camera and the pictures you get are unbelievable.I did my research before ordering and was going between this one and the Coolpix 120.  Cost made me go with this one.  I had already read that when you get your camera the first thing you do before putting batteries in is read the manual then practice with camera.  Trust me, this makes all the difference.  And we are not talking about reading the little Getting Started booklet that is in the box, talking about install software and reading the full length manual.  Thankfully everything is easy to remember and the camera will help you out.  I love it.

Reviews.Title: Pretty Much Awsome on Ground
Reviews.Author: Catherine Helfgott
Reviews.Content: So far I've been pretty impressed with this Camera.  I'm an Avid Camera Fan....prior to a break in of my car I had a 20D and two 40Ds and one of the 70-200 IS 2.8 L Series Lenses...I now have a 50D with the standard lens.  I'm pretty serious about my camera addiction...and after the break in also had to replace a point and shoot.First off I didnt really get a chance to read the reviews on this camera before purchasing...I had about an hour to run into Best Buy, buy a camera, and head to Seaworld.  Wanted something with a relativley inexpensive Dive Case (the 50Ds is right costly), and I wanted something relativley inexpensive.I saw this camera, saw it had a case, saw the pretty nifty price, the functions, and the HD Video and was sold at that point.  Two hours later it was with me at SeaWorld SA.I got an opportunity to play around with the functions alot and was very happy.  Did the general 'P' setting for the first set of pictures in the direct sunlight.  The image quality was great and I was able to capture some pretty amazing pictures of some Sea Lions doing some tricks.  The color settings were quite nice also.  Played around in the shade a little bit and changed to shutter mode to catch the dolphins and shamoo going up...and I got some pretty serious, nice quality images out of those.  It darkened everything (duh) but the picture quality, the color and the sharpess were still very good and the amount of noise in the background was minimal.The zoom on this camera was also a big plus for me.  My last PS was an olympus 15ft waterproof camera that I bought for the pool...but now that I am diving I wanted something with a touch more oomph..and that camera had no zoom.  The quality and response of the zoom on this one was nice.  It also picked up the images pretty quickly for the auto focus.I'll have to go into how the camera does under water once I purchase the case...but until then I am right happy with the surface shooting I have gotten out of it so far.

Reviews.Title: best camera i have owned yet
Reviews.Author: Gina Tell "Gina Tell"
Reviews.Content: I got this camera for my birthday and have taken pictures of EVERYTHING in site.  I can't say enough of the quality of the pictures, especially the macro shots, WOW.  Without hesitation, if you are looking for the next step in a camera, this is it.  I never write these reviews but felt I had to so whoever reads this doesn't miss out on a great camera!!!!  I also must add that you need rechargeable batteries for this camera.  When I was reading reviews on them, I came across the Sanyo Eneloop 4 Pack AA NiMH Pre-Charged Rechargable Batteries w/ Charger.  BUY THESE!!!!!  I have taken so many pictures and have not needed to recharge yet.  Alkaline batteries die in 1 use.  Hope this helps

Reviews.Title: Good All Around Camera
Reviews.Author: Sean
Reviews.Content: I've owned many Canon cameras from past 30 years. I bought the SX130 for its wide and megazoom lens to complement my G9. I think it is a great bang for the buck. i.e. If you are on a budget, this would be the perfect all-around camera. Here is my take.Pros:- 12x wide-angle optical zoom- easy to use- good optical image stabilizer- good image quality- good 720p video- many manual shooting modes- not expensiveCons:- bulky- somewhat slow lens- focus goes in/out too often in video- very slow flash recycle time ~10 sec.(yes, I am using NiMH batteries)- plastic body feels cheap

Reviews.Title: A great family camera
Reviews.Author: R. Grimm
Reviews.Content: I gave this camera 4 stars because of the flash speed.  It still has the same problem as the previous style.  You can take 2 pictures but on the 3rd the flash needs to recharge and you have missed the one picture where the kids have smiled. Another downfall is the delete.  Great you can delete one picture at a time but want to delete all your pictures at once and you can't.  That being said, I still like this camera.  The zoom is fabulous!  I can't believe how far away you can be and it looks like you are standing right there! I also really like the number of pictures you can take with this camera.  The pictures are super sharp and I am really enjoying the easy use of it.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: Shane Brown
Reviews.Content: We haven't done much with this camera yet but it has every feature most people would ever use and more. It doesn't seem overly difficult to use. Many settings are self explanetary right on the camera menu. One of the deciding factors in purchasing this particular camera is the use of off the shelf AA batteries. We bought some good quality rechargables but if all else fails any corner store has AA's. They add a little bulk to the camera itself but I don't find that problem. It is still a compact camera compared to what we had in the past. There is a small printed user guide with the camera but most information is on a disc as it is with most items now. Not much use in the field. I do wish there was a printed option. With a previous camera I carried my booklet with me. I am not a professional photographer so on the occasion I may like to use a particular setting I could use memory aid ie; a book to refer too.

Reviews.Title: Very Happy
Reviews.Author: C. Racine
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research before I bought this camera, so I know it's hard to choose a camera with confidence. I bought this one because it had a good mix of praise for quality, focus, resolution and a good feature list along with the Canon name. I also noted that a lot of the poor reviews (here and elsewhere) were inconsistent or betrayed an inexperienced user, not a camera problem. That told me that there was no particular problem with this camera that everyone agreed on.Now that I've had it for about a week, I'm very satisfied. The camera starts up quickly and focuses well. I have taken poor pictures with it, but I don't hold that against the camera, this is not a pro model being used by a pro. It's a solid basic model that will get the job done for most of us. That said, I was pretty surprised at just how much can be customized and controlled with this camera. Certainly more than I'll ever use.I could offer some criticism around the organization of the menus or the depth of the instructions (If you're going to let me adjust things, tell me what they are), but really I'm very happy with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Summer photographer
Reviews.Author: Avid Reader "avid reader"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because of the easy way it had of taking and downloading pictures, I have two other camera's still working from the stone age, an Olympus and a Kodak, each had good points but the Canon SX130 has them both beat.What I thought was great is the ease it has in downloading and then zooming in on the picture, Taking "up close" photo's is important to me since I have a whole lot of Postal History I need to sellI happened to buy this Canon at another store and lucked out in getting it $30 cheaper.For those who just want a camera that is point and shoot and gets good close-ups.  I, a non photographer recommend this one.

Reviews.Title: CANON POWERSHOT 130IS
Reviews.Author: PeterP
Reviews.Content: This model is even better than the SX110IS it replaced (Due to accidental damage, not malfunction)I like the AA batteries in particular (easily replaced in a Peruvian street market when I forgot spares)I have "sold" half a dozen just by showing it.I am not familiar with all of the functions yet but "auto" and "video" alone take care of most of my needs.I find it easy to hold steady for video and sometimes un-noticed as a video camera.

Reviews.Title: another great Canon product
Reviews.Author: Robert D. Patterson
Reviews.Content: I needed to replace a small camera that had been dropped and after reviewing many different brands, Canon seems to give me the most bang for the buck. Always lots of auto. features, but I enjoy the optional controls for creative picture taking. About the only thing missing in this, compared to my other canons is the stitch photo. (I can live without that) Great picture quality, which is first. A decent zoom, for a small camera. The one big plus for me, is the use of AA batteries. I know they cause a little extra weight and size, but I definitely like the ability to be able to use AA batteries, just in case I run out and can always purchase an emergency set to keep taking pictures.

Reviews.Title: I Love This Camera
Reviews.Author: GilliganFan "GilliganFan"
Reviews.Content: What can I say ?  I replaced a 6 or 7 year old Olympus C-3020 with 3.2 MP with this beautiful camera.  The start-up time is sooo fast.  Still getting used to it, but literally 2 days after I got it, we took our daughter to the Disney World on Ice and I got great pics in the dark from the nosebleed section.  More stable on the 12x zoom than I thought it would be.  And LOW LIGHT pictures turn out GREAT.  Big pet peeve on my older camera (although it took great pics outside, even for an old 3.2 meg).  Video looks great, too.  Beats the old VHS-C format we were using (don't laugh).Can't review ease of loading pics or video onto computer.  Haven't gotten that far yet. But when I play them on the TV with the connecting cable that was included, everything looks great.  One more big thing... I remember all the complainers in the reviews I read before I bought this, who talked about it eating batteries.  Well, just go and get a Duracell 6 hour charger with the 4 Ni-mh batteries included for about 18 bucks. The camera uses 2 at a time and you have spares when you need them.  Problem solved, and the AA batteries beat having to set your camera in a charger, like you'd have to if there were a built in battery.  Very very HAPPY so far.

Reviews.Title: PowerShot SX130IS Real World Use
Reviews.Author: CV91913
Reviews.Content: First, I do like this camera.  The quality of the high res photos is excellent.  As a longtime photo buff that used a Canon A1 for 25 years, this camera will do almost everything that SLR would do and a bunch of stuff it did not do.  It is easy to use and combines the ability to use automatic features as well as a complete manual mode.Now for the stuff that keeps it from being 5 stars.  It eats batteries.  Forget about using alkaline batteries and go with rechargeables.  The mfg estimates of number of pictures or amount of video is pretty meaningless.  You will get about an hour of shooting time, depending on how much you use the zoom and flash.  I did some testing and with continuous recording I got about 55 minutes of video...no zooming and very little review.  I was able to shoot about 30 minutes of video and 400 pictures using some zoom and flash but it was all done in less than an hour of shoot time.  When I say shoot time, I mean the actual time the camera is on.  Not elapsed time, but, constantly turning on and off the camera does cost battery life as well.Next, manual focus does not work all that well.  Using the little wheel is tedious.As for video...the limit of 10 minutes of video at a time is pretty stupid.  I could see it if it was to accommodate the 4gb file size of fat 32 but 10 minutes of video at the highest resolution possible results in a file of less than 2gb.  They could easily have gone with a 20 minute limit.  The other thing about the video is the .mov (Adobe Flash) format of the video files.  Just about the only thing that will play them is a computer with Flash installed.  None of my standalone players will play them.  You have to spend the time to convert them (and btw...the software that comes with the camera does not export any readable formats so you will have to use some other software to do that.)  That all assumes that you just try to load the memory card via USB and not use the camera to play the files.Last...use fast, high quality memory cards (I am using Class 10 PNY cards and they seem to work well.)Again, I like the camera and all of these negatives only cost it 1 star!

Reviews.Title: Had problems but thats ok!
Reviews.Author: S. Fillbrandt "Sarah_Sue"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as a 2nd to my large DSLR. I was tired of dragging along that huge thing for simple events. I had this camera for 2 weeks and it stopped working. It just would not turn back on. I am fairly confident that it was a fluke. These things happen. Amazon had me a new one the next day!!!Coming from a SLR I LIKE the pop up flash. When you can easily CHOOSE when you want the extra light. I know a lot of people HATE that about this camera but honestly it gives you much more control and is nice for travel -like visiting museums where flash is not allowed.The battery life for this camera is JUST FINE. People need to realize that this is an impressive piece of equipment and cannot just use your everyday batteries. Get yourself a set of NiMH rechargeable batteries and you will be set.Overall this camera is fantastic. Definitely worth the investment.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, great price, great quality
Reviews.Author: mallydally
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a camera that offered more than a point-and-shoot, and honestly am so impressed with this camera. I use it primarily to take pictures of the meals I make at my food blog ([...] to see examples) and I think its perfect for what I use it for. I am not yet ready to take the leap into DSLR land, so this was a great stopgap and also allows me to play around with the manual controls so that I can get a feel for them.The Auto setting is really great though- for most novice photographers this will be more than enough!I can't recommend this camera enough- the only drawbacks are the manual flash and the battery life- however, after purchasing rechargeable batteries I do not find this to be a problem anymore.

Reviews.Title: Best camera in this price
Reviews.Author: S. Bhowmick
Reviews.Content: i am impressed again with canon. SX1301S is a winner without any doubt. i have clicked several pictures in different environments, different colors, different time. but in all the time it gave me same surprise. people could not believe few of my pics that i have taken from this cam. they thought i have downloded from internet from some professional website.it has so many features in built i could not imagine. for all occasion it has a feature and setting. if u really want to click good pics, just get one.hats off..

Reviews.Title: learned to like it
Reviews.Author: Monna "Monna"
Reviews.Content: I choose this camera based on good reviews and price point. When I first got it I was disappointed with the image quality until I read a reviewer warning to read the manual throughly and to use the manual settings (SCN). I now love this camera!!! The image quality is great I have used it in bright beach day to snowboarding days, at night outside and inside, to shoot fireworks (amazing pictures) and also the zoom is impressive.The only down parts to me is (1) the battery. It uses 2 AA batteries and it goes through them really FAST! So you will need to invest on GOOD rechargeable AA batteries and make sure you always carry extra batteries with you. (2) The time it takes to recharge the flash for the next picture.The best fun features are: Fish eye effect (you can make lean people look obese, distort faces, etc.), Super vivid (intensify colors), color accent (black n white picture with a few colored parts). I won't go to all features because I'm no professional and I feel I don't have much to add to the great reviews you can find here at Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Bang for the buck
Reviews.Author: Arizona Adventurer
Reviews.Content: Excellent bang for the buck. Picture quality is excellent and image stabilization works well as advertised. Loved the zoom feature, which I used extensively on a trip last week. While the LED screen is large, I miss the viewfinder from my old camera when in bright sunlight. The one thing I'm not as enamored with is the image transfer process, using the supplied software. It's not as automatic and straightforward as my old Nikon Coolpix 3200, though I can figure it out with a little effort. Some complained about battery power use, but it seems okay to me. Unless I was going to upgrade significantly in price and features, I would purchase again.

Reviews.Title: LOVE this camera!
Reviews.Author: heather
Reviews.Content: This camera is very easy to use and to look through all of the possibilities that it gives.  I read a lot of reviews and a lot of people said it was hard to understand.  I did not think so at all.  The book that comes with it lists all possibilities, very throughly. The camera takes very good pictures in light and dark rooms. There is a lot of different settings that allows you to take the perfect picture in just about any setting you would have.  I would recommend this camera to everyone that is looking for something new or just simply doesn't have a camera yet.  I have not found one this that I was unhappy with!  When I purchased this camera I also got the rechargeable batteries and car adapter to go a long with it so I could always charge the batteries no matter where I am.  I would encourage this as well with the purchase of the camera.

Reviews.Title: battery life
Reviews.Author: Outlaw
Reviews.Content: Yes this is very good camera i also have a canon powershot A 2000is but back to the issue people say they are having with battery life any regular batteries would not due such as duracells and others and if you are taking pictures with the flash on  boom there goes the batteries so to not run into this problem and walking around with packs of batteries in your pocket go out and buy energizer advanced lithium batteries might be a little pricey to some but if you want to end those annoying battery changes it's worth it so go out there and take those pictures without the hassle. PEACE!

Reviews.Title: PERFECT!
Reviews.Author: jesiyvonne
Reviews.Content: This camera is all around perfect for my husband and I. The price was AMAZING as well! The video quality is beautiful as well. This camera picks up a nice amount of the ambient lighting and there are many options in the camera to change things up. We are usually used to using manual cameras and so can be a bit picky when it comes to image quality and what look we are trying to capture but this camera leaves us very happy and we are overly excited to use it for its main function which will be capturing photo and video of our new baby!

Reviews.Title: Cannon Powershot
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: Great Camera for the price.  Non automatic flash takes some getting used to but other than that great camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Value
Reviews.Author: KS Review "KS Review"
Reviews.Content: Although not a DSLR, it has many features of a dslr as explained very well in other reviews. The 12x zoom is very useful in taking pictures because it allows you to be flexible in framing your shots and you don't have to move as close to your subjects. If you're considering between this camera and another with 3x zoom, go with this camera.People have negative comments about this camera because of battery life. It does have terrible battery life with the alkaline batteries that it comes with, but if you buy NiMH batteries like Sanyo Eneloop batteries you shouldn't have any problems. NiMH batteries are cheap and you can always buy more if you need to go a long time without recharging.

Reviews.Title: A great Christmas gift
Reviews.Author: Terry
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as a Christmas gift for my son and his wife.  It arrived in plenty of time for use at Christmas and my son says he was taking great pictures using the camera right out of the box without reading the instructions.  I couldn't ask for anything more.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Brian Mille
Reviews.Content: Lots of reviews I've read complain about battery life in the camera, I just don't see that.  As long as you use rechargables it stacks up with any other digital camera.  Great zoom and crystal clear pictures.  There might be better cameras out right now, but not for the price.

Reviews.Title: Loving my new camera
Reviews.Author: NAOMI S. CORONADO
Reviews.Content: I have been taking photos with this new camera all through the holidays.  It is fairly user friendly, but you really should spend some time experimenting with all of the features.  I am very pleased with the quality of the photos, and especially the zoom focus.  I have managed to take a number of great shots of birds with this camera.  I would recommend this camera for it's features and the price, which I thought was right for all it had to offer.

Reviews.Title: good
Reviews.Author: mel21
Reviews.Content: good camera for the money...love how great the zoom works thats why i bought it but after i take picture it takes awhile to allow me to take another pix...dont know how to correct that...picture quality great and so it video sound and quality...all and all very good camera...im happy with the purchase

Reviews.Title: HD VIDEO-YEAH RIGHT!!!
Reviews.Author: blackpearl
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera 3 weeks ago to upgrade from my 6 year old Kodak Easyshare.  My Kodak still takes great pictures but I wanted a camera that does great video as well.  My Canon Powershot SX130IS takes awesome pictures but the video capability is CRAP!  I have been to Bestbuy twice and they couldn't get the problem fixed so I turned to the Canon reps.  The problem that I'm having is that when viewing the video, it's constantly trying to focus even though it's on a tripod.  It goes back and forth from blurry to clear then blurry to clear in a matter of seconds.  The Canon rep had me to disable the IS which didn't fix it.  Then I was told to tap the shutter to focus prior to recording.  It failed again.  The third rep said the camera was defective.  I'll be returning the camera to Bestbuy but I will be getting another one.  Hopefully that one will be ok.  If someone has a suggestion please let me know.  I would really like to keep the camera b/c it takes great photos and I got a really good sale price.

Reviews.Title: Replacement for another Canon
Reviews.Author: G. YOUNG "Toy expert"
Reviews.Content: Over all it is a good Camera, I like the way the photo's come out.  I love the video, it is so clear and the sound is really amazing.  But like everyone said it really eats battiers for some reason.  The other thing is the time between photos is a little long I have not figured out how to shorten this time.

Reviews.Title: Great product Outstanding Customer Service
Reviews.Author: Robert K. Tucker "Navyolsalt"
Reviews.Content: After I had already ordered this I thought that it may not work with my Windows 7 operating system so on a Sunday I went to the Canon website and sent them an email asking about this. I expected an answer from Canon on the following Tuesday or Wednesday but two hours later on that Sunday in comes an email from Canon Customer Service telling me that the camera will work with Windows 7.  Wow, you can't get better Customer Service than this, Good Job Canon!  I'm very please with the Camera, first Canon camera that I have owned, all of my other cameras have been Sony.  This camera works very well with my Canon MP990 Photo Quality printer, a combination that you just can't beat for the money! Canon company has now established with me what will be a long term relationship with a loyal customer.

Reviews.Title: good for point & shoot camera
Reviews.Author: snissen "amz shopper"
Reviews.Content: My last two cameras were Canon elph cameras which i LOVED. Decided on trying a different model and chose this one due to its featuresI love the picture quality, autofocus, 12 X optical zoom, HD video, etc. It has many settings (b&w;, fisheye, colorswap and many more) that are fun to play around with...just have to read the manual or play around with the camera to see that you get you money's worth. The ding of one star is due to the fact that it uses two AA batteries rather than a rechargeable battery which most cameras use now. I got rechargeable batteries that are working fine...just put them in so i'm not sure how long they will last.overall, this camera that will satisfy most users.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: Dave J
Reviews.Content: Features are eye catching, price point is excellent.  First use was at a wedding.  Blurred images of bride walking down the aisle.  She was walking towards me and the focus/shot delay made centering very difficult and the images were blurred.  Perhaps manually selecting a faster shutter speed vs using automatic may have helped.  This was my first use.  Not sure why the flash does not automatically pop up when needed as my old Cannon si 1 did.  Flash recovery seemed slow to me.  Have not tested the video feature.  It was one of the reasons I selected this camera over the more compact sx210.  AA battery or rechargeable also nice feature

Reviews.Title: GOOD CAMERA
Reviews.Author: Gerald J. Joachim
Reviews.Content: EXCELLENT CAMERA. DOES EVERYTHING I WANT TO DO WITH IT. WAS HIGHLY RECOMMENDED BY CONSUMER REPORTS. SHOULD LAST FOR MANY YEARS.

Reviews.Title: DIGITAL ONLY WAY TO GO, BATS RED FLAG
Reviews.Author: Chessman
Reviews.Content: Relatively user friendly and for the beginner to intermediate a winner; however, a super battery hog. Uses 25% of battery and then shuts down. When you load test the used ones, you find they are still useable for most other items, but not this camera. Solution: Energizer Rechargeables, 4 pack, AA with charger=no brainer, TYVM.

Reviews.Title: A Really Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: Q. Brown
Reviews.Content: I wanted a camera I could carry around with me. I'm one that likes to have a camera with me all the time. Though I have a cell phone, the pictures even with the higher MP they now have still in my opinion doesn't compare.I happen to like Canons. I'm familiar with their features & settings & they're pretty easy to use. So when my PowerShot A560 broke I wanted another carry around camera. Found someone here on Amazon that was selling their used one.What I like about this Canon PowerShot SX130 IS is that it has a lot of similar features as my Canon SX50HS bridge camera. Features like Face recognition, Blink detection. Poster, Miniature, Fisheye & Color Accent to name a few. Has a decent zoom as well. 12x Optical. As an aspiring novice, this is a great carry around for me to work on continuing honing my photography skills.It uses 2 AA batteries. It's a good thing & bad thing. Good because I don't have to have an outlet to recharge if I don't have a spare (like with the lithium ones on my SX50). Bad because especially in the colder weather the batteries drain faster & it does make the camera a little heavier. Not that it weighs a ton mind you.Overall I'm very happy with this camera. Even looks good in the Smart Auto mode.

Reviews.Title: The best camera ever!
Reviews.Author: margaret bish
Reviews.Content: It is perfect for me, I love this camera, no repair troubles, great photos of any kind or subject, anytime.

Reviews.Title: Very satisfied
Reviews.Author: Christina
Reviews.Content: Ordered for my daughter who is taking a publications class.  Received item super quickly and camera is in better condition than I expected.  Very pleased.

Reviews.Title: very very good
Reviews.Author: JAVIER FLORES
Reviews.Content: excellent camera, very good I think that the relationship between cost and value cion is the best, worth the money, has amazing quality

Reviews.Title: i have to say i'm learning to love this camera -- much as i have resisted
Reviews.Author: S. Police
Reviews.Content: i have had my canon powershot sx110IS for a few years and have taken quite a few thousands photos and videos with it and just grew very attached to it.  the feel in my hands is familiar, i know my fave functions.  so i told a non-profit program in my city i'd donate my camera to them and upgraded to this one.  at first i was hesitant to use it.  i wasn't overly impressed by the fishbowl effect, but most of the other features were the same as my 110.  however, i do appreciate that you can zoom in and out on the video, that i could not do with my 110.  the pics are of the same quality, and i can zoom in even closer, which is amazing.  we were in the s.c. state university football stadium, and i was able to zoom in on the players and fans all the way on the other side of the field, even see what one guy was eating!  so the zoom and clarity are undeniable.  it's a good buy !Iol, i'm ashamed to say i still haven't actually handed over my 110 to the program (it's been a few weeks now), but more for sentimental reasons than anything else.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for the wannabe photographer
Reviews.Author: Scott
Reviews.Content: I hemmed and hawed for months about getting this or a higher end camera and for the price I ended up with this one.  I am so glad I made the purchase I did. I love to think I'm going to use all of the settings and options to make artistic photographs but it rarely happens.  However the options are there for when I do have the patience and the time to think about what it is I'm going to do.  The on screen directions help tremendously for those occasions since I can easily forget what the different settings are designed for.  The quality of the pictures are fantastic and the handling of the camera feels natural.This was a camera purchased to take pictures and video of our new baby.  We knew we needed something that would preserve good quality pictures and take video when we needed it.  Both have been excellent.  The video is very clear, movement is smooth and the audio is great.  There are no tinny sounds or problems with the mike in any way.  The options for various settings allows us to put it in "squirmy kid" mode and leave it there for when we need it.I hesitated for a long time because of all the negative reviews on the battery life.  I wanted a camera that took standard batteries but, obviously, didn't want to change those batteries every time I used it.  I have to say I have not had an issue with the battery life being short, and we take waaaaaayyyyy to many pictures.  That being said I do use rechargeable batteries and that might make a difference.  But, if I remember correctly the cheapo batteries the camera came with didn't do so bad either, they went fairly quickly but it wasn't the same day or anything.Bottom line I'm glad I saved the money and got this camera, it's got everything I need, extremely user friendly, high quality and is fairly durable.

Reviews.Title: Great for video
Reviews.Author: oz
Reviews.Content: Originally I bought the camera to take pictures however I ended up using it for my vlog and it works great. I recommend the camera its pretty easy to use however I still havent figured out how to use the fisheye mode.

Reviews.Title: my camera broke
Reviews.Author: gloria dickison
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because mine (the same model) broke and I love all the features the Canon Powershot comes with.  I did'nt want to buy new or different.  The one I ordered came in mint condition!  All the info the seller  provided was correct.  It was shipped in a timely matter and in it's original box.

Reviews.Title: Yellow stone trip..
Reviews.Author: Ted Harbin
Reviews.Content: This has to be the best camera for the money in the universe.. If you are looking for a great camera this is it..

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT
Reviews.Author: Karen
Reviews.Content: This camera is amazing! I was so excited when I received it and so impressed how well it was shipped and how FAST it was delivered. I would recommend this camera to amateurs and professionals alike because it takes such creative and beautiful photos. I have always been impressed at how fast Amazon gets my products to me and how I am never disappointed in anything I purchase. Amazon personnal have always been informative, friendly and patient. Thank you to the seller and to Amazon!

Reviews.Title: What a nice Camera
Reviews.Author: thinkgreenondemand
Reviews.Content: I got a great deal and i am happy with most of the shots I take ' very easy to use and less things to go wrong by having it not being a touch screen .Awesome pictures

Reviews.Title: Used as a substitute for my professional camera and it did great
Reviews.Author: Kristin P. Bennett "stitchupyrspine"
Reviews.Content: For a small body camera it takes awesome pics.  The various settings are easy to use, and the flash is strong.  It didn't kill batteries particularly quickly.

Reviews.Title: Power Shot
Reviews.Author: William F. Zeigler Sr.
Reviews.Content: Very good camera for the price.  I take many pictures that are job related and they are good quality. I send many pictures via on line connections and have good results.

Reviews.Title: Hobby
Reviews.Author: Darline Head
Reviews.Content: Love taking pictures and this camera has proven to be a success story for me with the end results  Quite a few people has ask me about it.

Reviews.Title: (Almost) everything you can ask for
Reviews.Author: CF
Reviews.Content: I want to start with a little outline why I got this camera:I wanted to try out photography but didn't feel like spending a lot of many on a DSLR yet. So one of the main things I was looking for was some manual controls (aperture, shutter, full manual mode) to learn using those. But as said before I did not have a lot of money and wanted a camera that I can easily take with me.Finding a Point-and-shoot that allows manual controls immediately minimies the options so in the end I went with the SX130IS. And after almost a year of use I think it's well worth it.What I like:- 12x Zoom (optical). I like to take pictures of animals and being able to zoom in helps a lot with not scaring them away- In association to the zoom: the camera can also take very good close-up makro shots- Image stabilisation. So even in zoom mode or for slower shutter speeds the camera still manages to produce sharp images- The resolution. Resolution is not everything, but it sure is nice to be able to crop and still have a good-sized image- Manual controls (obviously)Some things that are not that great:- For a point-and-shoot the camera is abit thicker than I expected- Low light conditions get problematic (which is to be expected from a camera like that)- Taking several shots in succession doesn't work too well since the camera takes a while to write a picture to the card- The dynamic range is low, which often leads to blown out skies (again, might be expected from this type of camera)- For some reason my white balance always was a bit off, no matter which setting I chose. Many images had king of a blue hue to them and also colors were often a bit dull. Those problems could however easily be corrected in post-processing.Although it seems like I have a lot to complain about, it is nit-picking and really can't be expected to be handled from a small and low-priced camera like this one. Actually if there is a better camera for that prize, I would like to know about it; it's hard for me to imagine. (As I am writing this, its successor, the SX150IS actually is cheaper; so maybe give that a try).If you are looking for a low-budget point-and-shoot with some room for experimentation and learning, go grab it!

Reviews.Title: It is good with the money
Reviews.Author: AnhMy Tran "Love playing Violin and Piano"
Reviews.Content: It is not good at focusing to the close objects.No matter how I do, how method, how function, I cannot take a picture at acceptable quality.

Reviews.Title: Fast Power-Up, Beautiful Pics & Vids, Limited Video Length, Long Next-Shot-Delay
Reviews.Author: gottlieb1885
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for work, which involves simply taking pictures of retail products. It works fine for that purpose, and I'm always impressed with the picture quality once I get the photos on a computer so I can edit them.Not too long ago, my much nicer personal camera took a splash in the ocean, so I've gotten some experience using this one for general shutter-bugging. As stated, the pictures and videos are beautiful - and the fast power-up is much appreciated.The worst problem I have with this camera is the next-shot-delay. This is the amount of time it takes until the camera is ready to shoot the next picture, and this has been a problem with most digital cameras from the very beginning. I'm not referring to the time it takes to recharge the flash between shots, but rather the most basic daytime non-flash photography.When simply taking pictures of products for work, it's not an issue. For general photography, it's a problem which will likely result in missed picture opportunities.For instance, I recently took the camera on a kayaking trip and it was very difficult to capture birds & animals due to the fact that both I and the wildlife I was photographing were constantly moving. Normally I'd just take multiple shots of the same subject to get a decent 'keeper'. With this camera, however, the next-shot-delay absolutely kills this 'double-tap' style of picture taking.Another problem I ran into was that there is apparently a 10 minute limit to the length of a video clip. This is not due to the memory card being full, and you can simply start recording a new video with another press of the shutter button. The problem is that sometimes I need the thing to just keep recording, and don't have the luxury of running over to start it recording again.For instance, I was recently pulled out of an audience to play stand-in guitar for a band whose guitarist didn't show up. It was a real honor, and I set my camera up to record it. This is exactly the type of unpredictable situation in which you really need a camera to simply function as expected. I played rhythm guitar for the first few songs, but was allowed some solo time during a break later on. I killed it and was anxious to review my performance. Unfortunately, all I got was the first ten minutes of me playing rhythm guitar, then the video stopped before the good stuff happened. Plenty of room left on the SD card, but the camera stopped recording at the 10-minute mark.While I realize this is a budget-priced camera, the video length limit is unintuitive, unnecessary, and surely not related to the cost of making the camera. It's just poor design which defies the reasonable expectation that the camera should record video up to the limitation of its memory capacity.The bottom line is that this camera takes impressive pictures and videos for its price, but you definitely need to consider whether the long next-shot-delay and video length limitation will work for your purpose before buying it.

Reviews.Title: Very nice for travel camera
Reviews.Author: GalCalif "Visit my Amazon Profile page!"
Reviews.Content: I like this camera very much as a the single compact size camera for travel. It has a decent zoom range, takes nice close up photos and is very compact with the huge bonus for me of using regular AA batteries so I can be certain to never run out.The ability to zoom in and out during movie filming is nice, and not all cameras have this ability.There are two things which I at first did not understand with this camera which made me think it was not as great as it really could be once I understood how it worked.Focus when in telephotoThe distance where you can get a good focus is a little shorter than it reads on screen (it displays the minimum focus distance briefly in the upper left of the screen when you zoom in or out). If you get the yellow box with the exclamation point instead of the green focus box, it is likely that you need to zoom out a little bit and try again. I thought at first the camera had focus problems, but is just because when you zoom it limits the focus close distance quite a bit.Focus when in MacroFor close up shots, either use Auto mode (where the camera chooses most everything including focus Auto/Normal), or make sure you select the Macro focus mode before you try to take the shot. If you do select macro, it takes amazing close up shots with good light. It is easy to forget to set to Macro focus mode.Colors and Skin ToneAt first I was very unhappy because often people's faces would appear orange or weird colors. I thought this was a problem with the camera, but it turns out it is just with the default color settings and can easily be fixed by using the camera's built in color adjustment settings.I use the so called 'Custom Colors' setting (press the Func Set button inside the rotating dial on the back, then select the colors option below the AWB option on the screen, navigate across the little icons on the bottom to the last one called Custom Color, press DISP. button on lower left back panel and then change the parameters as follows:For Custom Color parameter, there are 5 vertical lines (I call them 1 to 5 from left to right), to the right is 'more' and to the left is 'less' of whatever the parameter.Set them as follows:Contrast 4 (or 5)Skin Tone 1Saturation 3 (or 4)Red 3Green 3Blue 3Sharpness 5You will find that the skin tone problem pretty much vanishes and most all pictures are nicer!The only thing that takes a star away is that it is not good in low light situations.

Reviews.Title: Decent pictures, poor functionality
Reviews.Author: marlowejack
Reviews.Content: I received this camera as a gift.  I've used it for a year and finally given up on it.  If I bought it myself, the review might be a bit more harsh, but in reality, I would have likely returned it.  The photo quality is what you would expect from a 12 mp camera.  The zoom lens works well, build quality is good, hd videos turn out great, and the image stabilizer does its job.  I had grand expectation for this camera as it was an upgrade from my 6 year old 4 mp camera.  My grand expectations were gradually replaced by general disappointment.  I have four main problems with the camera:1.  lag time - the time between pictures is terrible.  It will often take 3-10 seconds to record the photo on the memory card before it's ready to shoot again.  I tried several memory cards, all high quality fast cards, and the problem persisted with all cards.  When you are using the flash, the lag time between shots gets even more ridiculous.  The flash takes forever to recharge.2.  user interface - the menus on this camera are very non-intuitive.  The scroll wheel navigating button is great.  However, the menu itself takes a long time to get used to.3.  auto mode - this is supposed to be a nice point and shoot camera - however to get a decent photo, I've had to manually adjust things like white balance and shutter speed.  I rarely get decent quick shots using auto.4.  battery life - this things eats regular alkalines for breakfast.  The convenience of a standard battery size is quickly outweighed by the cost of frequent replacement.  If you choose to spend a lot more $$ on the AA lithium ion batteries, you'll get a bit more life, but it's still a problem.Would I recommend this camera to a friend - no.

Reviews.Title: Great camera except
Reviews.Author: Christy Linn
Reviews.Content: When I first got this camera, I was really excited.  The problem I have is that not long after I got it, I started having problems with it focusing. The left side of the picture is always blurry no matter what I do.  I try to keep the main part of my picture in the center and have to crop it to get the blurry part out of the way. It happens on every setting. Besides that, it has some neat features. I love the smile detector and love that I can take pictures at night.

Reviews.Title: waste of money
Reviews.Author: austinTX
Reviews.Content: I read so many reviews and narrowed my choice down to this camera. I don't know why it has so many good reviews.When you view the photo on the camera it often appears clear/in focus when in reality (on computer) it's blurry.It's not fast enough to take photos of a my little boy who barely sits still. By the time the photo is taken, he's already moving on. It's only slightly faster when not using the flash.It's not fast enough to take multiple photos in succession when using the flash; in other words, it takes a while for the camera to recover for the next photo which makes this camera virtually useless.It's not fast enough to auto focus if you want a quick photo - often the image is not crisp or just downright blurry.I bought this over a year ago and don't even know where it is in my house. I just always use my Nikon D5100. This camera was supposed to be the carry around camera for quick shots when out and about but it fell flat.I started out with giving this camera two stars but after writing this little review, I think I'll downgrade to a one star review since I don't even know where it is and believe it was a complete waste of money.The battery life is lousy, even when using the overpriced lithium batteries especially made for cameras.On a positive note (the only one), Amazon delivered this in no time at all.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, overall
Reviews.Author: Molly Duerre
Reviews.Content: I have been truly impressed by the quality of the pictures that this camera can take. My only disappointment is that the batteries seem to not last very long (about 2 weeks before I need to replace them). I do tend to take a lot of pictures but not enough to merit replacing good Duracell batteries every two weeks. I plan to try rechargeables to see if they hold up better.

Reviews.Title: Piece of junk...
Reviews.Author: Kelly V Mallinger
Reviews.Content: So sad... researched this camera, loved the size, features, etc. but IMMEDIATELY started giving me the E32 error message, which from my research I'm finding will cost me as much as the camera to fix.  It also randomly rotates pictures (what the heck?) so when I download them from my memory cards they are upside down or sideways.  Terrible and so disappointing.  The few pics I have gotten are decent, but nothing special.  My old Kodak Easyshare Z740 took much better photos.

Reviews.Title: Pleased
Reviews.Author: William
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera one year ago. I love it. There was reports about low battery life. I turned down the display brightness to 50%, which was still bright enough. This cured the problem. It has more functions then I'll ever use. I just like auto focus. What I like above the big camera's, you can put it your pocket. Well my pant pocket. Took a lot of pictures recently in California. Yosemite, Redwoods, Giant Sequoias, and SF. My pictures were just as good as my sons big camera.

Reviews.Title: VERY Impressed.
Reviews.Author: Derek C. Odom "Derek C. Odom"
Reviews.Content: Over and over again I'm impressed with this camera. The reason I bought it in the first place was that I got sick of the $100 jobs going to crap on me and not doing much of anything special.That isn't this camera. The shots it takes are real, real high quality (most everyone I show them to can't believe it's a point and shoot), it's very easy to use, and it has a LOT of neat functions like fisheye effect and blurring.The zoom is really, really good. I took it to Bryce Canyon in Utah and it killed it.  The battery life is outstanding, as well, when compared to all the other digitals I've had.The flash stays out of the way, folded up on top until you need it. Although it's not recommended, this camera fits real well into my pocket.The LCD screen is clear and it effortlessly takes wonderful pictures.Not a single bad thing to say about this camera. I've owned it over a year now and it's never, ever, once let me down.If there were six stars, I'd give them to it. So, strong, strong five stars from me.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera !
Reviews.Author: Floyd W. Watson
Reviews.Content: Just what I wanted and needed! The quality is deffently there! So far it's been easy to understand in it's operation. I'm completely satisfied!

Reviews.Title: perfect for business
Reviews.Author: D. Brown "Cemdav"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this particular camera because of the Consumer Report's review.  It has lived up to the review wonderfully well.  It is easy to use and makes a great photo.  Very easy to download pics onto your computer with the SD card included.

Reviews.Title: Good camera, dust problem
Reviews.Author: JD
Reviews.Content: I'm not much of a camera person. I love my little point-and-shoot camera because it gives me the versatility I need to take good photos, but isn't huge, clunky, and hard to manage.That said, We purchased this camera Friday February 18, 2011, and it has worked like a charm until about 3 weeks ago. Next thing I know, there are 7 or 8 specks of dust INSIDE the lens that are ruining every picture I take.  Despite the dust, the little cam still works great, but the pictures have been ruined by dust in them. All of them. I will be contacting to see if we can get a replacement, because I had hoped this item would last for a few years before I'd have to replace it!

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Dawn C
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a gift for my 14 year old daughter, she loves his camera and all the features and modes. She is having a lot of fun getting familiar with this camera.

Reviews.Title: very pleased
Reviews.Author: Carl
Reviews.Content: Many products report to be the best and often they turn up not so good.  The Canon Power Shot SX is the easiest and best features in a camera I have ever used. Back when using older digital cameras ment figuring out how to use it and waiting for the slow shutter to complete the picture. Being a senior also ment trying to figure out how to use  new contraptions.My overview is, "well done Canon", fast shutter, large screen, good timer, larger lens, and easy to understand instructions. Thanks to amazon for offering a fair price for a quality product.

Reviews.Title: Great, great camera
Reviews.Author: D. Melissa Carter "Melissa Carter"
Reviews.Content: This camera is an excellent option for anyone looking to take professional quality pictures without having to drag along lots of different lenses, etc.  It has an excellent zoom range, and the clarity of pictures at maximum zoom (48x) is excellent.  It's ability to go from fully automatic to fully manual is also a big plus and helps to give all different photographers of all different skill levels an excellent camera that, again, doesn't require one to carry tons of equipment.  The price is unbelievable and to me this is the best buy in digital point and shoot cameras.  The only thing that would make it better is if it could be made waterproof.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use-Great quality
Reviews.Author: Kat
Reviews.Content: Very satisfied. Thinking of buying another one. Great quality for the price. Simple instruction manual. I like that it uses disposable batteries. Our other camera uses a rechargable battery pack which is expensive to replace.

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: V. Marlowe "vjmarlowe"
Reviews.Content: I absolutely LOVE this camera. Easy to use and takes great pictures! Wish I had found it yrs ago before buying Pentax

Reviews.Title: For a P&S; camera, very good.
Reviews.Author: May H
Reviews.Content: As the title says, for a point and shoot camera, the SX130 is beyond excellent. When one looks at a camera to buy, there's a few things to note, and I'll go on to cover how the SX130 fares in these cameras. Also remember, some specific things, as well as general things that a customer may look for may vary from one to the other, so keep your personal wants in mind.1. Picture Quality: The SX130 is amazing. The quality is almost negligible compared to a DSLR unless at higher magnifications. The picture is vivid, sharp, clear and fresh, and will guarantee you can capture moments, action shots and beautiful nature.2. Camera Settings: Camera settings is basically things like the modes it has and its f-stop ranges (aperture), shutter speeds, ISO and more. The SX130 does excellent in all these. The shutter speed is beyond good, even for fast action shots. The ISO is also comparatively high, and better than needed in most cases, however, for night photography a different camera may be desired. The aperture range is decent, but not amazing. You'll need a better range to take those "professional" photos. Also, the settings can be seen on the camera specs.3.Battery Life, Durability and Portability: The SX130's battery life is one of its major pitfalls. The battery life is so small that on larger photo trips you may even need to pack extra batteries! The manual says it can take 130 shots on a normal lithium battery, but more like 60, for me at least. For the durability, the camera seems solid for the most part. It has a bit of weight too it, that can be perceived negatively and positively, but overall, it seems strong. However, there seems to be something loose inside, that may or may not be intentional. The portability is also fine, however the battery powered function of the camera makes it weigh a bit more than it should.4. Price: Amazing. Its a bang for your buck. The quality of performance coming from this camera demands a higher price. Definitely good if you're on a budget but still want great photos.Anything not covered is things I haven't checked out yet (the video function, for example.)

Reviews.Title: Fine camera
Reviews.Author: Joyce
Reviews.Content: I cannot give anyone a big essay on this Canon's separate features because there are so many different kind of things it can do.  It takes beautiful pictures and most excellent videos...all extremely crisp.  I did have to call Canon and get them to send me a printed out OWNER'S MANUAL because I don't want to sit at my computer for hours and hours reading or looking things up as the SX130IS has so soo sooo MANY available settings and my husband and I just want to take nice pictures and short videos. I was looking for a good camera that wasn't so tiny that the buttons have to be real tiny! Though the good 'ol ON/OFF button could be a tad larger, it's a minor problem for us people with big hands.  All in all, fine camera with apparently many abilities I haven't discovered yet.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Gary Landerfelt
Reviews.Content: You will not be disappointed in this camera. It was a gift for my wife -- who is pretty much camera challenged. The images a crystal clear and it is very easy to use. The only down side is, it eats up battery life pretty quickly - so you'd better order a few a few pairs of AA rechargeable batteries to hold that expense down. Still, it ,takes excellent pics, and isn't that the bottom line for any camera?

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Jay Dog "Workin' Class Poor"
Reviews.Content: The best camera out there at this price range (worth way more then 200.00) The zoom is the best I have seen on a "point and Shoot"...even though this camera is more like an SLR then a true "point and shoot." Very pleased and would recommend it to pro and novice photographers alike. Way to many features to list...just buy it already, you wont be disappointed. Oh btw..it eats batteries so be prepared to purchase some rechargeable ones.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful Camera, top of the line for it's price!
Reviews.Author: shiftinromance
Reviews.Content: I researched on a new high-zoom point and shoot to get for quite a while before narrowing my decision down to this camera. Let me tell you, I could NOT be happier with my decision. This camera is beautiful, looks beautiful and takes beautiful pictures. It's really top in it's class/price range IMO. The pictures turn out wonderful and has tons of nice little features that other digital camera's usually really lack on. The zoom works great and exactly what I was looking for and the images aren't blurry/extremely grainy when zooming in far, A+++++.My first point and shoot was a Canon, I absolutely LOVED it..My second point and shoot was a Sony, I will NEVER purchase a Sony camera again..This purchase was obviously a Canon and now I have never been so sure that Canon is the way to go!

Reviews.Title: Great Buy
Reviews.Author: sunscreen318
Reviews.Content: My first camera was a Sony Cybershot that I paid around 150 for. It had a great interface for interacting with the software, that I didn't realize I liked until I saw some of the newer cameras by Kodak and other brands with "user friendly" software. I look for something that is straightforward and won't mess with me. Such as when deleting pictures, it can't ask you five times if you're reaaaaly sure you want to delete it. I also look to see if the buttons are bubbles or have fancy colors. That usually means the software is going to be no good. This camera has no BS menus with three colors. You can find everything easily and deleting is only a few buttons per picture. It also has a nice feature where you can select two pictures, and it will delete everything in between. It is not a professional grade camera, but you get what you pay for. For the price, it will take great photos with ease, and allows many option for low light shooting, and different settings for shutter speed, as well as all the other options expected in a point and shoot.

Reviews.Title: very good
Reviews.Author: Woody Sills "woodywood"
