Reviews.Content: this camera takes excellent pictures for a small camera. the zoom is fantastic the camera is eazy to use the picture quality is very good. i use a full size camera for most of my work but as for simple everyday use this camera is just fine

Reviews.Title: Great for a point and shoot!
Reviews.Author: Lauren
Reviews.Content: I purchesed this camera a few months ago and I really love it. I've always had very compacts p&s; cameras and with this one I was hoping for better quality photos and some more versatility, which is exactly what I got. I've found it so be really great for times with the family, pets and sporting evens, as well as more specific shooting. I have gotten some really great photos using the Macro Photography setting and I love it! The focus is great and you get wonderful bokeh when focusing on a close object. The manual setting allows you to do a lot, which is great for simple, creative shooting. You can get nice bokeh with the manual focus setting, and its very simple to make fun photos using a long exposure. The photo quality is great. As for the video, the quality is good. But I've found that even doing a video in front of a white wall, it tends to shift in and out of focus constantly. But if your wanting to focus on something detailed and raise it close to the camera it's great. So the video has it's ups and downs, and the cameras own noise while fliming tends to be able to hear when replaying the video. As for the bettery life, it's not the best, especially using video. Make sure you bring spares with you wherever you go with this camera. Overall I think it's a great product, with great versatility for a point and shoot.

Reviews.Title: I love this camera.
Reviews.Author: Geni
Reviews.Content: Got tired of pictures that were not clear.  Tried this camera and I am very happy.  I take too many pictures so I need a good camera that can keep up.

Reviews.Title: Great pictures for less money
Reviews.Author: DR
Reviews.Content: Great camera! I bought this as a middle of the row camera so I could take better pictures than a point and shoot, but not have the bulk of an SLR. It does the job, hope they can shrink it down a little on the next round.

Reviews.Title: Great, state of the Art camera.
Reviews.Author: bigeye "bigeye"
Reviews.Content: Excellent price and it does everything advertised and more.  I would highly recommend this to a friend.  I did my research before purchasing and it was well worth the effort.

Reviews.Title: Good camera & good value
Reviews.Author: LB22 "lsyab"
Reviews.Content: For a point and shoot, this is a very good camera.  The focus is very good and it takes good close ups.  I find it easy to handle and use.  Downsides are that it only has a wrist strap for the camera, I would like a neck strap...maybe they make one and I haven't found it yet.  I bought Sanyo nimh rechargeable batteries for it and so far so good.  I have not used the video feature yet.  For the price it can't be beat.  I had a Nikon point and shoot before and didn't like it.  I'm glad to have a Canon again.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful camera!
Reviews.Author: Emily A
Reviews.Content: This camera is the perfect in between camera. It's much nicer than a regular powershot digital camera and just below the expensive dslr cameras. The only thing I need to buy is some rechargeable batteries. Shipped very fast and I am very pleased!

Reviews.Title: A wonder in a small package
Reviews.Author: Robert E. Kendall
Reviews.Content: I find the SX130IS the easiest of the Canon cameras I have owned (I've had three!)Each camera was a big step over the previous one, and now SX130 seems to be the best. It is very easy to operate with great results. I checked Consumer Reports before I purchased it, and every thing they reported was exactly the case. I really enjoy my new camera.

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: maha
Reviews.Content: Love the ease of use, but not great with motion shots. Bought it for my daughter's wedding, and found out quickly that subjects must be perfectly still. Good for that, and indoor shots were OK.

Reviews.Title: Canon Camera Review
Reviews.Author: Carey
Reviews.Content: This camera is a bit big and makes it difficult to find a nice carrying case that would fit on a belt, but other than that the quality is great.  A nice large screen, flip flash (manual) and intuitive controls.

Reviews.Title: great all in one package
Reviews.Author: ddkphotos
Reviews.Content: have had several in this Canon series - starting with the Canon SX100, then 110, 120, 130. I love the ability to go from macro to 360 at the touch of a button in a small portable (in my purse) camera! It's still a point and shoot - so don't compare apples and oranges and compare it to a big dslr with interchangeable lenses. But I truly love it as a point and shoot - will take it on my vacations instead of the big bag of glass, and have never been disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth A. Head
Reviews.Content: Received this camera just before the birth of our granddaughter.  Was very excited to take it out of the box and with just a few minutes of reading the instructions, was shooting great pictures!Would advise purchasing rechargeable batteries to use in this camera.  Went through the alkaline batteries rather quickly.Have not used the video yet, so can not give a review of that feature.Would definitely recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: shauna
Reviews.Content: I absolutely LOVE this camera!  It takes great pictures with great resolution.  I haven't really messed with the instruction booklet, mostly because it's really simple to use.  Did I mention it has great resolution?  LOVE LOVE LOVE it!

Reviews.Title: camera review
Reviews.Author: Bill Schledwitz
Reviews.Content: The camera takes excellent pictures and has many useful features, but it quickly uses up batteries.  Using rechargeable batteries solves the problem so keep an extra set on hand.  The user guides are easy to follow and zoombrowser, the photo software program, is good when it works.  I received a "critical error" message and "invalid class string" on my desktop.  Canon customer support fixed it once but when it happened again they said it was a Microsoft Registry problem and wouldn't get involved.  I went to a business PC consultant who put in two hours and couldn't fix it.  He unistalled zoombrowser and installed google's picasa 3.  Picasa 3 works fine and is free.  It costs me about 1/3 the price of the camera and hours of aggravation to take care of my software problem.  I'm glad I bought the camera but I'm not happy with Canon's customer support.  I wish I had done things differently.  My purchase experience with Amazon was excellent as always.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: C. Fox "Carrie"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera earlier this year and this camera by far is my favorite.  The photo quality is amazing.  Yes the speed is slow to take the next pic but if you keep your finger down on the button, it will be ready within seconds.  I have also used this camera in low lights and the photo quality is just amazing.  I read a lot of people going thur batteries and I must say..I have not had that experience.  I did get rechargable batteries and I have not any problems.  My son is a kart racer and my action pics are just great.  I am very very happy w/ my Cannon and will never get anything but a cannon....

Reviews.Title: Really like the camera!!!
Reviews.Author: Betsy
Reviews.Content: Love the camera. Wish it had a view finder, but am finding ways to make sure that I hold it steady enough and the image stabilizer helps tremendously! My favorite part (other than the stabilizer) is the zoom & how lightly you have to press the shutter button in order to take a picture. Also, the delay seems less than my previous camera. Can't wait to take more wildlife photos in order to test out the zoom. So far, so good!!!

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: Plaid Pantsuit
Reviews.Content: Great camera for general use, easy to use though I think the controls could be a bit more intuitive.  The video is very nice quality even close up; good sound.  Not too heavy to hold steady in one hand.  I really like that the flash has to be flipped up to fire; no more accidentally shooting flash when I want to be conserving battery power.

Reviews.Title: Nice features
Reviews.Author: Ronald E. Martin "Plumb Cheap"
Reviews.Content: I am not a camera wizard, but it seems like a quality camera for a low price. The one thing that I don't like is the zoom lever... could be a little bigger and in a better location. Rechargeable batteries are a must, but it is handy to be able to use regular batteries in a pinch. I would highly recommend this camera for anyone looking for an all purpose camera.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: mom
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera.  I have used it for a month now and have taken some great pictures with it.  I like that it has a lot of manual and preset settings.

Reviews.Title: JudyO
Reviews.Author: JudyO
Reviews.Content: I love this camera!  It takes wonderful photos and the video is great!  I did a great deal of research on this camera and I am so happy I purchased it.  It has some manual functions that are exactly what is important to me.  I am sure that anyone who purchases this camera will be very pleased.

Reviews.Title: Fabulous camera
Reviews.Author: prats
Reviews.Content: Picture quality - ExcellentImage stabilization - ExcellentColors - fabulousZooming - amazingVideos - Excellent clarity!!Only Disadvantage - NO panoramic mode!!Price - Ridiculously cheap!!Very Very Very good camera!!! A must buy!!

Reviews.Title: Very impressed
Reviews.Author: Lori Jean Gray
Reviews.Content: I studied a ton of reviews from amazon, best buy, and professional reviews and chose this camera over the sx30is and am glad I did.  I had the Canon A620 which is a 7mp 4x optical zoom and I loved it.  It's 6 years old and still working great.  I just wanted an upgrade.  I considered a D-SLR but the price was just too much for me.  But I wanted a really good point and shoot that could take D-SLR type pictures.  Of course, nothing is THAT good, but this camera is excellent.  I find that I can take pictures indoors without the flash, where with my old camera it was nearly impossible.  They come out so crystal clear (most of them, not so much with my wiggly baby as the subject!) and the colors are so bright, and true.  I haven't even begun to look at all the options on the camera, haven't had to since it takes great pics in the SCN modes.  I am really looking forward to reading up on it and experimenting.  I really don't think you can be disappointed with a Canon camera.  I definitely agree on the comments about the battery life...I took maybe 100 pictures on 1 set of batteries (the ones that came with it) but I already bought the Rayovac rechargeables NiMH so I expect to see a huge improvement.  Such a great buy for the price.

Reviews.Title: Great Pictures, Great Creative Control
Reviews.Author: A. Davila
Reviews.Content: The "Canon PowerShot SX130 IS" is a great digital camera and a perfect fit for those wanting more than a basic snapshot model without a need for a full-out dSLR.Image quality is always a number one concern and as a still camera or in HD video capture the SX130 delivers.  The optical image stabilization for the 12x optical zoom lens produces clear, crisp 12-Megapixel images from wide angle to telephoto.  For quick and easy shots the Auto mode or simpler still, the Easy mode allow anyone to produce fine pictures.  Yet for those wanting more creative control they can choose from a host of Program modes, Shutter Priority, Aperture Priority, or even fully Manual mode.  All in a compact camera that can conveniently fits in a belt case.As for power source I am a fan of using AA-type batteries.  I like my portable devices to work well with rechargeable AAs so I only have to carry one kind of charger.  Plus it is comforting that in the worst case scenario I can walk into any convenience store and pick-up some alkaline batteries and keep going.  Don't get me wrong, I use rechargeables when possible as they get nearly three times as many pictures from a single charge than alkalines, but it is nice to have a backup option.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera load with lots of features!!
Reviews.Author: Doneyli De Jesus "Dones"
Reviews.Content: Excellent camera with tons of features. It almost feels like a professional camera. Image quality is superb and videos recording in HD is awesome as well.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, I really love it
Reviews.Author: Jack
Reviews.Content: I've had the camera for about 6 months now and I really like it. I bought it for a College Photography class and I'm really glad I did. It takes very clear pictures there is virtually no learning curve. The camera has a good zoom and has a giant screen. I've used expensive DSLRs since I got this and honestly, I much prefer using this camera. The pictures it takes are great for what I want them for and camera is small and light enough to take with me.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera for 179.99 (which is a little bit less than its actual retail value) so when I say that its a great camera for the price, I guess I should throw in that I probably would have payed a little more for it. I thought the price I payed was a really awesome deal, and 200 or even a little bit more, would have seemed very fair. Its a little bit heavy and bulky, so if you're looking for something slim and cute its probably not the best choice for you. The picture quality is really good though, and for a camera thats under 200$ I was really impressed with the zoom. I've heard some complaints that the manual controls were too complicated, but just from playing around I was able to figure out how to (basically) make any adjustments I wanted. I'm not a photographer, so I can't say anything about technical stats or hardware, but I've really enjoyed the camera and think that it takes really nice photos. To me the quality's a little better than most point and shoot digital cameras in its price range, and offers just enough creative control to fidget with settings without it being too complicated. I'd recommend this camera to anyone looking for an affordable camera to enjoy, thats not super serious about photography but would still like a bit of creative elbow room. Like I said, its not the super cute/cool looking camera that you pull out to elevate your social status, but if you're looking for photo quality this is definitely one of the most affordable ways to go.

Reviews.Title: FABULOUS EASY TO USE CAMERA
Reviews.Author: MG ROBERTSON MD "GARY"
Reviews.Content: I like everything about this camera. It looks professional, sturdy metal construction, easy to handle, fits the hand well. Very easy to use with a variety of settings but "auto" really deals with every situation. The 12x zoom is incredible and actually brings you closer than 12 with crisp, clear pictures. I like having AA battery power and Lithium batteries seem to last forever. The screen is large and clear, although I would like a viewfinder too. This is a GREAT camera for less than $200. One small inconvenience is having to manually raise the flash--no big deal. BUY THIS CAMERA--YOU CAN'T DO BETTER.

Reviews.Title: Rebecca
Reviews.Author: Rebecca
Reviews.Content: I love my camera! It is a big bulky as compared to other digitals but the features are awesome and it's so easy to use. Money well spent.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Dan Crenin "Dan"
Reviews.Content: I have always been a big fan of the Canon product line, so, this product presented no surprises.  It takes great pictures, and has all of the crazy photo options that one can use to adjust to the various lighting conditions.  The large LCD is nice.  I am a little old school when it comes to taking picutres, and like a viewfinder, which this does not have.  Other than that, though, this camera performs like a champ.I like the ability to take movies and stills with this camera.One issue I had, though, was that I had to do something out of the ordinary to get the movies off the camera and on to my computer.

Reviews.Title: Point and Shoot at it's best.
Reviews.Author: Mind20
Reviews.Content: Easy to use right out of the box.  Stability is way better than a lot of other cameras I own.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Thomas Perry
Reviews.Content: Amazon service can't be beat. Bought online from a local store. When I went to pick it up it was not avaliable. This was two days before Christmas. Checked with Amazon and ordered it. Recieved on Christmas Eve. Will never doubt Amazon again. The camera was awesome compaired to my old one. Easy to use and great pictures and video.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: princess528
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my mom. I have a similiar one, She loves it and it is easy enough to use. We took it out of the box and it was easy enough to use right away. The only con is that the batteries do not last long.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for shooting activities
Reviews.Author: M. Francis
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my wife for Christmas because she works with the Girl Scouts as a trainer.  She needed something that had a good zoom range to capture what is happening all around an event.  Stabilization also seemed like a good feature for hectic activities. The SX130IS seems to fit the job perfectly.Haven't tried to use the video capability yet, but sounds like it will be a nice option.

Reviews.Title: Cannon Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Linda C. Foster
Reviews.Content: I wanted a camera that was easy to use and dependable.  I have not learned all the features of this camera yet but took many family Christmas shots and snow pictures.  I am very pleased with the pictures that I got and think this was a great bargain price for this quality camera.

Reviews.Title: Ideal small camera
Reviews.Author: Jack D Adair
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera for my wife as a gift.  Although she is a little technology challenged she quickly learned to operate the camera and take quality pictures.  Camera lives up to it's reputation.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: William G.
Reviews.Content: My cousin in Australia had this camera and I really liked it.Easy to use, and made everyone in my photos look terrific.  Auto lighting and shutter speed and facial focus work great.  In fact, I can't emphasize enough how much better my pictures look.  Great features that the camera does that I am still learning about - but you can also just pop some batteries in and go! Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: canon digital camers SX130IS
Reviews.Author: Princess
Reviews.Content: I am also a fan of Canon digital cameras.  I own a Canon Video Camera F11 which does great viedos Also another Canon digital camera but when I saw this one on the market I knew I had to have it.  I have only had the camera a few days and learning what it does but so far am please with everything.  So it does go thru batteries but when you think about all digital cameras do.  This one takes the best in door picture in low light that I have ever seen.  I would recommend this product to beginners and also advance users.

Reviews.Title: Very impressed
Reviews.Author: Michelle
Reviews.Content: I just got this and I'm already getting the hang of all the extra settings. The pictures turn out GREAT! I would recommend this camera to anyone. Make sure you get Eneloop batteries though so it lasts. I have no complaints (:

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: tedtodd
Reviews.Content: this is my 4th digital camera, and i thought i'd spend a little more to hopefully get something more than a simple 'point and click'. it looked a little bulky and heavy, but it's well worth it so far. i've never been able to take a good photo at night, but got some great night shots during a snow storm this weekend. was also able to get some great action shots of my dog running through the snow. it can be challenging to shoot a white dog on snow, but this camera did an amazing job with it.summary:worth the additional price compared to your basic point and click camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for the price.
Reviews.Author: MERCDOG
Reviews.Content: This camera takes great pictures.  The videos look great for only being 720P.Minitirazation mode is fun.  Mimics having a tilt shift lens on the camera.Defintly recomend downloading the manual from the CD to get into all of the cool little features on this camera.The only issue I have found is the battery life.  I was only able to take about a 5 minute video and about 10 pictures on 1 set of batteries.  But I was playing with the camera a lot.  Just carry an extra set of batteries to avoid having an issue.

Reviews.Title: Fun and Easy
Reviews.Author: cat
Reviews.Content: So far every feature is what I wanted in this camera .I am still learning all the bells and whistles, but they seem to be pretty easy to master and hopefully  I'll be a pro in no time.

Reviews.Title: Quality Went Downhill Fast
Reviews.Author: D. Tegtmeier "Prey Tell!"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera the end of August 2011. About 3 months later (not long after the final return date of October 1st had passed) the camera suddenly started having problems focusing. I would get several photos and suddenly it wouldn't focus on ANYTHING. I would have to turn it off and back on before it would focus again. Now, the camera is 9 months old and I can barely get one or two photos before it stops focusing. I've missed some spectacular shots because I couldn't get it focused or rebooted in time. I go through rechargeable batteries just turning it on and off all the time. The photo quality, when it DOES work, is far better than ANY of its competitors in the same price range and even better than the grainy results of the Canon PowerShot SX150IS that I also bought. But, its problems are too many and too great for me to give it anything higher than one star. Sad that I couldn't even get a one year warranty on it without paying extra.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot
Reviews.Author: Rita W. Edwards
Reviews.Content: This camera is everything I expected and more.  For the price I don't think a better camera could be purchased.

Reviews.Title: Could Be Better
Reviews.Author: rusty
Reviews.Content: My old 35mm Canon Sure Shot Owl was damaged by leaky batteries, so Rayovac sent me a 140.00 check to buy something else with. Sam's Club had the SX-130 on clearance for 159.00, so I purchased it.At first, I was ecstatic with my sample shots, but as time went on, I saw more & more blurry / fuzzy images...especially indoors. It has gotten to the point where I have to take three or more shots of the same subject just to find one that is marginally acceptable. I mainly use Auto, and sometimes Easy mode, but I will use Program & Aperture mode if I want to change a setting or two.The camera works best in bright daylight situations, but even then, image quality is not as sharp as I like. Ironically, some of my low-light sunset shots looked pretty good in Program mode with Exposure Compensation set to -1.I am beginning to wonder if the IS (image stabilization) function is not working as well as it should after reading many favorable reviews, here, and elsewhere. I always wait for the double-beep sound (confirming the focus has been set) before taking my shots, and I always make sure that none of the shutter speed and focal length numbers are in orange, too. I try not to use the optical zoom too much - unless I can brace myself more effectively, and I definitely don't use the digital zoom (I turned that feature off).Many have complained about the short life of disposable AA batteries, and I can concur with that because my first pair lasted about an hour as I was learning how to use the SX-130. Even rechargeable Rayovac Platinum batteries last for less than 100 shots, but that is not an issue for me because I can always carry an extra pair - or two - if needed.This is my first digital camera purchase, and I have much to learn about the various controls and shooting options with this model. Thank God for the internet and the many web sites I have discovered to better explain how things work because the provided manual does not go into great detail, and Canon does not have any online tutorials that I am aware of, either.I am using a SanDisk 8gb class 4 card ($12.00 - Big Lots). Would switching to a class 10 card ensure better photo quality? Someone posted a review, here, admitting as much after they consulted with a knowledgeable camera rep at Best Buy.If a faster card does not help my image quality then I will exchange this model for the SX-150 - although the unit I played with at Sam's Club had horrible charge time for the flash - the sample images I took looked pretty sharp in my opinion. However, I noticed some major distortion in a shot or two along the edges. The SX-150 was set to the "L" size (A2)...could that have been part of the edge distortion problem?

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for great price
Reviews.Author: Selena
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera a little over a year ago and been very happy with the purchase.  The quality of pictures does not let you down, they are beautiful.  I am a busy mom with three kids and this camera is perfect for me.  Fits great in my purse to go with me everywhere.  It takes the clearest pictures even when my kids are moving during the shot.  The camera is easy to use, comes with many features. Canon makes a great product.  I am glad I got it and have been using it since day one!  It is well worth the price.

Reviews.Title: 10 months old and need another
Reviews.Author: Dee
Reviews.Content: Has been a pretty good camera for the amount of money spent, but this weekend popped out memory card and the trigger in the slot broke and now it will not hold memory card.  so 10 months later I am now looking for another camera

Reviews.Title: Only one problem.............
Reviews.Author: Bruce J. Long
Reviews.Content: Love the quality of the pics and the HD Video. Really excellent. Love the size and feel of the camera. But when the battery light starts flashing every few days when you are not even using it that much it gets quite annoying. My wife was shocked and thought it was something I was doing wrong. I wasn't. Too bad. Great customer service too.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Matt "Satisfied"
Reviews.Content: Great camera for the price.  Very, very easy to use.  Takes great pictures.  As other reviewers stated, get the rechargable NiMH batteries.  Overall, awesome!

Reviews.Title: Poor picture quality compared to other Canons
Reviews.Author: S. Oakley
Reviews.Content: I asked for this camera for Christmas because I wanted a camera with more zoom and a little more manual controls than my husband's Canon SD1000 that I've used for years. I was extremely disappointed in the photo quality both on Auto mode and after specific adjustments were made for the environments where I was shooting. The Auto on the SD1000 blows it away with no image stabilization. Lower light indoor shots were simply unusable.I love Canon but this camera is definitely not for me. If you're doing nothing but bright daylight zoom shooting then this might be a good option. Oh, and don't forget an extra stockpile of rechargeable batteries. The batteries that came in the box lasted a total of about a half hour total of non-continuous shooting and I didn't even try taking any video.Had it not had all of the issues above I might still have been disappointed with the large size. After using it in real-life situations chasing a two-year-old I realized the zoom is less important to me than ultra-compact size. I returned the SX130IS for an SD1400IS and I couldn't be happier! The 4x zoom is plenty, wide-angle lens is fantastic, and shots look amazing.Canon still has the goods, just not in this model.

Reviews.Title: Noisy images even at ISO 80
Reviews.Author: The_Digital_Dude
Reviews.Content: Wow, I read all the positive reviews of the Canon PowerShot SX130IS and promptly picked one up on sale.  Our old Canon PowerShot A700 has been showing its age with some hot red pixels on the sensor, so this seemed like a good try for a replacement.  I took a couple dozen pictures, some even at ISO 80, and nothing in the menu settings or configuration of the SX130IS is able to resolve the excessive image noise, which pretty much ruins detail.  The chromatic aberration on this thing is fairly bad, even at this price level.  It's also mighty battery hungry.  Even with the same Duracell NiMH batteries I use in the A700, freshly charged, the camera died and shut off after a few minutes of initially setting the time, turning off the sounds, setting image quality to the best available settings in Program mode, etc., and I hadn't even taken any pictures yet.  Maybe the Duracells have had it, so the next step would have been to try some of the Sanyo Eneloop rechargeables that others recommend.I've owned multiple Canon DSLRs since 2000, so I wasn't expecting anything close to a DSLR, but I did expect it to be better than the A700 point and shoot, which it certainly isn't.  Even accounting for the difference in 6 megapixels for the A700 compared to 12 megapixels for the SX130IS, the A700 takes clearer pictures (relatively speaking).  What's really weird is that the filesize is nearly the same of identically shot images of the same static scene by both cameras at best quality settings in Program mode, as if the newer camera is applying excessive JPEG compression, even in Fine mode.  A much larger resolution should result in a much larger file, hello?So, with the noisier compression at highest quality and the comparatively much worse chromatic aberration, I sadly will have to return the SX130IS and keep looking.  I actually will be willing to pay even twice this price for a point and shoot if it gives noticeably better results than this model.  I wasn't expecting DSLR quality, and the A700 is far from it, but this is definitely a step down.  No thanks.

Reviews.Title: Nice Cam
Reviews.Author: Saltfork
Reviews.Content: The SX130 is the Consumer Reports "Best Buy" - thats why I got it.  No regrets, it is one heck of a point and shoot camera.  Easy to use, awesome photos and videos.  Happy with the purchase.  Got the Canon leather case also and the 8GB SanDisk card.  I really like it.

Reviews.Title: Not Worth It
Reviews.Author: EmC
Reviews.Content: I wanted a camera that would be used most to take photos of my two young children.  Even on the automatic and easy settings with my kids sitting still (which is both rare and difficult)I was getting blurry pictures.  I know a thing or two about cameras from my extensively used Canon SLR.  I just wanted a digital camera that I could use on the automatic setting until I could set aside some time to learn the ins and outs of the features as my SLR was too bulky to have with me at all times.  This is NOT that camera.  Even after spending hours that I just did not have reading over the manual that Canon provides online, I was getting blurry, noisy pictures.  I returned this one and purchased a Nikon Coolpix S8100 and LOVE it.  I was able to use it right out of the box with amazing success.  Plus, now that I have had time to learn the functions, it performs even better.  Please don't waste your money on this Canon.

Reviews.Title: Good camera with a few drawbacks
Reviews.Author: Jerry Gillooly
Reviews.Content: After a couple months, I'm getting used to the camera. There were a few issues in the beginning, most of which I have sorted out, but some design glitches remain.This is a fairly large and heavy unit for a point-and-shoot, but it's almost as hard to grip as a subcompact. The right end of the body is thinner than the rest, and that's where the power button, shutter release, zoom lever, and all the controls on the back are located. It's difficult to grasp and manipulate the camera, especially one-handed, without inadvertently activating something. There is a tiny thumb rest on the back, but it's to high and too close to the shutter release for comfort. The finger grip on the front is too close to the end, and the body surface is slippery. I have average size hands, and this camera appears to have been designed for someone much smaller with stickum on their fingers.I like the flip-up flash that I can choose manually instead of electronically, but the lip of the flash head is too small to ensure a quick flip into position.Most importantly, though, the photos are gorgeous. Low-light shots without flash tend to be grainy, but every other condition has resulted in sharp and bright pics.I was torn between this Canon and the Nikon L110 and settled on this because the automatic lenses cover and the better pocketability would make it a bit more convenient in the field. I'm not sure I made the right choice.

Reviews.Title: Paid too much
Reviews.Author: SFC/retired
Reviews.Content: The camera itself seems to be as good as consumer reports say it is, I haven't had time to use it that much yet.  But the cost of this camera is about twenty five dollars more here at Amazon than Canon sells it for on their web site.  I always thought Amazon was or had lower prices until now.

Reviews.Title: Pat
Reviews.Author: Pat
Reviews.Content: Great camera for the money. It takes beautiful pictures and is easy to use.Anyone can  take pictures with this camera. Still shots, sporting etc.

Reviews.Title: Better than me
Reviews.Author: moxielady3
Reviews.Content: LOVE IT! I am in love with all the Canon cameras I've tried so far. Perfect for someone wanting more than a point and shoot without all the trouble of something more professional. My pictures are always complimented and now people want me for their pictures! How flattering! It is not me I assure you, it is the camera ;)

Reviews.Title: So far so good
Reviews.Author: Walter Roberts "geezer"
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my son across country and he loves it. It's very similar to my sx110. If it holds up as well it will have been a good buy. Fast, free shipping, too.

Reviews.Title: Decent camera, awful battery life.
Reviews.Author: Taylor J
Reviews.Content: This was the first "nicer" camera I had purchased in a long time and it looked like it would have everything I needed. It works great, don't get me wrong, my major issue with this camera is that it dies so quickly! I always have to have a spare set of batteries with me if I plan on using my camera. Just the other day I was outside taking pictures when my first set of batteries died on me. I put in my backup batteries and the low battery signal started flashing at me within 15 minutes. If you can remember and have the patience to switch out the batteries often, this camera is fine, if not you should definitely keep looking. I plan on resuming my search in a few months.

Reviews.Title: Hey...I like this camera
Reviews.Author: Ron in Carolina
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice and easy-to-use camera...And best of all it takes great pictures.I like to use the zoom for close-up shots and when you do that you have to worryabout camera shake...No problem...It has a built in stabilizer....So cool.It's got a good size...So it fits your hand, so your fingers are not in the way.Hey...I like my camera.

Reviews.Title: excellent quality
Reviews.Author: JO
Reviews.Content: excellent quality , as well as super performance, picture also very sharp in detail each and every not even single picture fail or not clear

Reviews.Title: Amazing Pictures
Reviews.Author: Chicago Karl
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough good things about this camera.  Fell in love with 10MP SX while at a baseball game and found out I could take pictures of players faces from across the stadium and when that got stolen I picked up this one the 12MP.The more settings I learn the more I love this camera and the settings adjustments really work compared to a lot of $100 pocket cameras.

Reviews.Title: Wife Loves the camera
Reviews.Author: Russ
Reviews.Content: Our camera broke prior to going on vacation.  My wife wanted a camera similar to the one we had.  It was a Canon Powershot SX120IS.  Your product worked the same and took the same size card. It even came with batteries.  My wife was very pleased with it.  She took a lot of pictures on our vacation.  It performed very well. The price was great, too.  It was delivered like you said it would be, also. Thank you very much.

Reviews.Title: OK camera
Reviews.Author: Rward
Reviews.Content: I have had several other more expensive power shot cameras. I expected this one to take as clear of photos as the others but it does not handle motion very well.I had now ordered two of these cameras. And sent both back. The first had a red screen upon start up, which my other ones never had. The red screen stayed longer and longer upon start up until finally it never went away and I was unable to take pics. So I sent it back. The second had the red screen as well upon start up so I just immediately sent it back. The package was damaged when it arrived so I assume it got banged around too much and the camera is too sensitive to this kind of handling, unlike my older model. Picture wise it takes ok photos. However I would not recommend this particular model. It is not very hardy.

Reviews.Title: Great camera but BATTERIES DIE FAST!
Reviews.Author: R. La Bonte "raynin"
Reviews.Content: The camera is fantastic for point and shoot people but the fact that the batteries die so fast takes the spotlight. Also, you have to manually move the flash up and down to use it so if you forget and that moment is gone, it's gone. Otherwise it's a great camera. Always have extra AA's available or be sorry.

Reviews.Title: Great Cam !
Reviews.Author: BT
Reviews.Content: Has been nearly a year now that I have been using this product and it has been great ! Was my first cam :)The image quality has been really amazing. I also like the video integration. Would suggest this to starters.Amazon delivery, of-course, was as good as ever. UNBEATABLE !

Reviews.Title: Works perfectly
Reviews.Author: Marcus House
Reviews.Content: Works perfectly.  We even dropped it once on concrete by accident and it still works.  What is really amazing is that we can record videos and the memory does not seem to be anywhere close to full with the 16 GB card.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera
Reviews.Author: Robin Lyons
Reviews.Content: I have spent years looking for the perfect camera.  This camera has everything I've been looking for.  The vivid setting really brings out the colors in an outdoor shot.  While it took me a little while to figure out all the features it's actually very user friendly.  Make sure that you always carry extra batteries because this camera like all good camera's will use up the batteries quickly.  Also, ordering this thru Amazon I got it super fast.  Was delivered to my door step within two days.  Just make sure when you order this that you also order some type of SD card.  I give this camera a 5 star rating.

Reviews.Title: Did I mention Battery Life?
Reviews.Author: Gavin T. Davidson
Reviews.Content: I've long been a fan of Canon cameras, starting in the 1980's with an AE1.Moving into the 21st century, I picked up a Canon S10 which in my estimation had great image quality for the time.Since that time, I've owned probably 3 other Canon digital cameras - all of which have not disappointed as far as image quality is concerned.The SX130iS has proved to be a black mark against Canon digital cameras, for one simple reason - THE BATTERY LIFE IS HORRENDOUS!When I first received this camera and had to change the batteries very frequently, I assumed that I must have left the camera on by mistake, hence the reason for the low battery indicator flashing!?!Only after I started to pay attention to battery life, did I realize just how dismal the battery life actually is! I've used this camera with a variety of alkaline batteries from Duracell to Energizer, as well as Duracell and other brands of re-chargeable battery but all have the same result, pathetically short battery life.I called Canon CS, who knew nothing about short battery life and suggested using lithium batteries instead.My other current point and shoot camera, a Canon SD1100iS can use the same proprietary battery for an exponentially longer period of time. In fact I use it more than the SX130iS as a result.As mentioned in other reviews, if you have a truckload of batteries that you wish to carry around, then this camera will perform very well indeed.For me, the battery life is the Achilles Heel with an otherwise quality product from Canon.I know I wouldn't buy one again - simply based on the battery life - it's just too much effort and you may well miss out on a lot of shots as a result if not fully prepared.

Reviews.Title: Better buy a LARGE box of batteries
Reviews.Author: cltucci
Reviews.Content: Yes, I read the reviews first, and had my eyes wide open when I bought this, and I admit I was warned.  I was seduced by the high ratings not only here but in other places, maybe even Consumer Reports.  However, even after reading everything, I was still completely shocked at how PATHETIC the battery life is on this camera.  And we should be comparing it to other cameras.  Most cameras do not run out of juice every time you take a video, no matter what kind of batteries you put in them.  This one, however, does.  Probably 30-60 seconds of video is enough to kill off normal batteries.  Special batteries might last a bit longer, but seriously, do you really want to carry around a bunch of spare batteries all the time?  On the positive side, picture quality is pretty good.  But you can do much better than this camera.

Reviews.Title: Fine, but consumes too much battery
Reviews.Author: Ayhan
Reviews.Content: Camera is generally OK. However, it consumes too much battery, even when not using flash. Even when camera is powered off. I expected much better.I'm a Canon lover. It was my 3rd Canon. I even bought another Canon after this disappointment. To my opinion, SX130IS is not worth buying!

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: iamStanley
Reviews.Content: It is very inexpensive camera with all photographic controls and good image quality. I do not use it in poor lighting, in decent lighting it is very capable camera. You have real photographic tool in your hands. It may be a very good camera for teaching photography to younger kids. The camera is very well constructed, study, made of hard, good quality plastic and is very reliable. I took over 8000 pictures with it, and it is still like new. The video is great too!

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: DizzyLizzi
Reviews.Content: I'm still learning how to use this camera but over all I love it and it takes great pictures. I read other reviews on Amazon and reviews from other sites about this camera and most of the reviews were 4-5 stars and highly recommended purchasing this camera.  I have two friends were photograph as a hobby and both recommended I purchase this camera.  So all in all I'm pretty happy and excited.  I'm going to London in April and can't wait to take many photos. The memory card is sold separately and I didn't realize that when I purchased the camera but no big deal the camera is swanky compared to the camera's I've had in the past.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot
Reviews.Author: woodslady
Reviews.Content: Takes nice photos and videos.  Sound quality of videos is good.  Would prefer it came with a hardcopy of instruction manual instead of just disk.  Camera is larger than I thought it would be.  Main downside to this camera is that it eats batteries.  We have had it 6 weeks and used only moderately and have gone through at least 8 batteries!

Reviews.Title: nice little tag-a-long pocket camera
Reviews.Author: Al-ien
Reviews.Content: This camera for me was an upgrade from the older Powershot SX100IS which I wore out.  That little sx100 took some fantastic macros and with the 10x zoom... I was also able to get some decent wildlife images... several of which were published in a book this year (Living Sanibel by Charles Sobczak, Indigo Press 2010).  I like the scene selection additions like fish-eye and miniature effect. Also the  LCD screen is larger, (big improvement), than the 100SX. It also has more MP's and has a slightly wider and longer lens.  Of course, the best reason to get a camera like the SX130IS is to be able to take it everywhere with you... and still get quality images.  These little point and shoot cameras have come a long way... with image stabilization and lens quality! Why not five stars... like all the cameras in this series no viewfinder and no raw images...and no way to protect the screen, but, then what do you expect for under 200$. You can see examples of both the sx100 and the sx130 at [...] .

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot
Reviews.Author: King Rhodes Associates
Reviews.Content: This camera was purchased for use in an active real estate company. We've had Canon cameras in the past which figured in the purchased of this camera. It has not disappointed us with the picture quality and clarity.

Reviews.Title: Rubbish
Reviews.Author: Nora
Reviews.Content: It was broken when it arrived..when I contacted you online said it couldn't be returned.. I still have it in its original box.. The lens door would not open.. Rubbish .. I will wait to see if you get back to me now.. Or is this review going to fall on blind eyes???

Reviews.Title: Gift
Reviews.Author: Lydia
Reviews.Content: This camera  was purchased as a gift for my brother. So far he has taken tens of thousands of photos with it & it still works like new.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: William J. philler
Reviews.Content: We had a canon 100 10x for several years, and worked fine until if fell off the table. The new one is even better. It is a 12x which  allows her to take a picture from a distance without bothering anyone near by. The camera is simple to operate as it has a computer operation that allows it to automatically focus and set the proper aperture.  It is almost fool proof.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!!!
Reviews.Author: K
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera right before my son was born in 2011. I have to say that I have been pleased with the camera and liked enough that when it broke I replaced it with a newer model I have though compiled a list of pros and cons.Cons:-BATTERIES: Uses AA (which it seems to use rather quickly) I really wish that it could be rechargeable…just plug in and charge but I solved this issue by purchasing rechargeable AA and I always have a pair ready and charged.-CLOSURE: Did not like the battery and SD card closure. Since the camera tends to eat up the batteries rather quickly, you have to switch them out often…after 3 years of usage the flap or the door that locks the battery in place started to break and sometimes it failed to close correctly leaving me with several attempts to close it right.-FLASH: The flash you have to pop up manually…which I guess could be a nuisance but what bothers me the most is the fact that after so many times of lifting the flash up the hinges snapped and the flash failed to engage (reason why I am replacing it)-SIZE: This camera is not very slim in size so placing it in your pant pocket is definitely out of the question (well you can but it will be a tight fit)-ZOOM: Since the zoom lens retracts and extends anything that gets caught in there really could screw it up. As an example to the kids to the beach and some sand got in the lens causing it to fail to close, I had to sit there clean it out before it finally closed.Pros:-IMAGE: The colors in the image are amazing to me! Especially when shooting indoors or fast moving kids, this is actually the whole reason I am sticking with this brand and camera. I think that the image quality far outweighs all the cons!- EASY- Very easy to use!!!- SETTINGS: Love all the different settings! Especially the color swap or color keep! When I was pregnant I tied a solid color bow around my belly and took a black and white picture but kept the color of the bow! It was not perfect of course but with a little editing it looked amazing!Overall I like this camera, I think if Cannon would make a built in flash and a rechargeable battery that you can just plug into the camera (kind of like a cell phone) this would be a huge winner!

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot
Reviews.Author: Carol Cottrill
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for a while and have to say it really does take good pictures.I love this camera and am very well pleased with it.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot SX 130
Reviews.Author: Da Lowrider
Reviews.Content: This was a fun little point and shoot camera.  It's past it's shelf life and we have a couple other later versions of the Powershot but this was a great little camera for it's limited purposes.

Reviews.Title: Have had this camera for years and still love it
Reviews.Author: Sunkist
Reviews.Content: Great shots, easy to use, a good fit in the hand.  The only downside is the battery life, whenever connecting it to the computer it seems to really drain it.  Also, in movie mode it picks up the sound of the zoom lens gears operating but, an all-in-one convenience makes it worth it.

Reviews.Title: Happy with my purchase!
Reviews.Author: Tamaree Frances
Reviews.Content: Very happy with my camera. It is exactly the one I wanted as I dropped my previous one. Finding it was easy and ordering it was painless. I received it in good time with no problems whatsoever!Tamaree FrancesDerry, NH

Reviews.Title: Wow. Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Don M. Compton II "bingo625"
Reviews.Content: I have 15 digital cameras and this is the sharpest except for my $2,000 Canon.Uses AA batteries so you always have power without charging and buying expensive Sony batteriesThis is very inexpensive but huge in the quality department. I have two.

Reviews.Title: It's ok
Reviews.Author: cissy
Reviews.Content: The compact cameras just don't do a good job of taking pictures in low light.  I own another canon that is smaller than this that I bought first.  I went back to using it as the pictures from this one were no better.

Reviews.Title: I love my new canon powershot sx130
Reviews.Author: jimmy tellez s.
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for this device did everything it was advertised to do work perfectly I recommend to buy

Reviews.Title: Simple, lots of options, and great shots
Reviews.Author: Patricia A. Betcher
Reviews.Content: Always a great shot.  Gets lots of good shots - great details.  Why get any more pixels!?  I love using the color enhancer - it makes images seem surreal.  Love it.  It always catches great pictures of FAST sport athletes.  It blurrs if the event is at dusk, but you can get some great action shots with it.

Reviews.Title: Great pictures, great features for a point and shoot.
Reviews.Author: canderson141
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera a few years ago and have had so much fun taking pictures with it. It's easy to use and there are plenty of good features for a point and shoot. The only drawback is that sometimes in bright light it's hard to see the screen, especially in the sun. It would be nice if it had an actual viewfinder for ultra sunny days or bright lights.

Reviews.Title: Amazing product
Reviews.Author: Angelica Chavez
Reviews.Content: You can not go wrong with this camera . It captures beautiful pictures .  I can honestly say you won't be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: Love this camer
Reviews.Author: Mary Lou Wilson
Reviews.Content: I had this same camera and had it for a long time and dropped it and to have it repaired was more than my new purchase and  love the camera.

Reviews.Title: Very Pleased
Reviews.Author: Sharron Simmons
Reviews.Content: We have a Nikon D80 with several different lenses that takes beautiful pictures  but wanted something smaller and easier to carry around. The pictures are great quality and am very happy with the purchase. It will meet our needs perfectly when we don't want to carry the big case.

Reviews.Title: 5 so far
Reviews.Author: na
Reviews.Content: camera takes wonderful pictures, attaching string keeps it secure, 2 AA batteries is convenient, it is easy to use ok

Reviews.Title: Bought it as a gift.
Reviews.Author: Amanda
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my folks for the holidays. They can both use it and like it... Not to mention they are taking great pictures with it! It's all the camrea they say they will ever need and then some. They do not think they will ever need another camera. On is tech savy the other is not. And it the one that is not that has used this camera the most. Though I learned to love Canons from them. Even though right now I do not personally own one, doesn't mean they don't still know how to make great products.

Reviews.Title: Pictures are beautiful!
Reviews.Author: Marmof11
Reviews.Content: This camera has everything that I wanted, with one exception.  I take a lot of picture of flowers...close up...and this camera doesn't have the "Macro" option that my previous camera had.  Otherwise, great purchase!

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: smiles
Reviews.Content: Bought two for gifts and ended up keeping one for ourselves.  Love the ease and size.  Been using it for a year and no problems.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!
Reviews.Author: J. Kimm
Reviews.Content: I had this camera for a couple of years but when I took it on my trip to Jamaica I got it wet and this camera does not like water and it never claimed to. I went out and got the SX160IS from Best Buy but when I got it home I found it didn't have as many options as the SX130IS. I returned it and got on Amazon and ordered this one. I'm so happy to have it again. It is the best for taking simple random pix. I love the vivid option. It took the most beautiful pix in Jamaica (till it got submerged in water)!!!! I highly recommend it for ppl who just like to take everyday pix.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Joe
Reviews.Content: Cheap, reliable and easy to use. Takes great pictures for what I need, mostly very close-ups for work. two more words.

Reviews.Title: Just a great camera
Reviews.Author: WF
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for 19 months now and I continue to be amazed by the quality of the pictures that this camera takes. I was looking for a high megapixel camera with good zoom but was almost scared off by comments about battery life. The battery life has been excellent and I like the fact that if I carry two extra double A batteries with me I am back in business immediately. Close up pictures on the auto setting are particularly excellent. I would highly recommend this camera for anyone looking for something other than a camera with interchangeable lenses.

Reviews.Title: Canon is Satisfactory
Reviews.Author: larry g. jansen
Reviews.Content: Quality product manufactured by Canon.  Only problem is if your hands are larger, hitting the correct commands is sometimes difficult with this type of product.  Otherwise, worth the money.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Jeff Finch
Reviews.Content: We purchased this for my elderly mother in law as she was finding it difficult to get good quality processing with print film.  She learned the basics of it but when she found a better processing place she switched back to film.  My 13 year old daughter now has it and is using the video and still features to shoot stop motion videos for Youtube.  It takes really good quality images and is simple to use with more features than many people will ever use.  I've had past experience with Canon on technical issues and they have excellent customer service and repaired my other 6 year old camera at no cost due to an OEM component that failed.

Reviews.Title: So dissapointed!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I have loved the Canon brand. LOVED it and have been loyal until recently. I bought this camera last year. I've had it for 12 months, and already, the company has replaced it for me 4 times. Not joking. 4 times. It all seems to have to do with the battery adn the flash. I put new batteries in, and the red light comes on saying low battery. After taking a couple of pics (literally like 3) the camera shuts down. Canon's customer service has been EXCEPTIONAL! No complaints there, but this camera has not lived up to what the company usually produces. Ugh.

Reviews.Title: Good while it lasts
Reviews.Author: Dyane "health coach"
Reviews.Content: The zoom feature stopped working in less than a year.  Very disappointing as well as the quality of the definition.  No bargain there.

Reviews.Title: OK for the zoom and 12 MP, but...
Reviews.Author: Captain Silver
Reviews.Content: ...not a great camera.  In my opinion, Canon's latest image stabilization systems (DIGIC 4 and DIGIC 5) aren't as good as the earlier ones - no matter what the setting, I get way too many blurry unfocused pictures from this camera.  Others complain that it eats batteries, but I haven't had this problem.  I'm just not impressed with the pictures it takes.  My go-to digital is still a Canon A710-IS, with (I think) DIGIC-III technology (MIJ, not China).  Even though it is an extremely dated camera, and only 7MP, I think the quality, consistency, and reliability of its pictures is better than any AA-battery camera Canon has put out since.  If you are in the market for a good AA-battery camera, scour e-bay for one of these.

Reviews.Title: A good camera but sometimes misses when in Zoom mode.
Reviews.Author: J. Reader "J.R."
Reviews.Content: For the price it's an excellent camera. The zoom sometimes misses and the picture comes out fuzzy, but most of the time the zoom works just fine. It takes only two AA batteries, which is great, but they get depleted pretty quickly, so you need to always carry at least another pair.

Reviews.Title: It's a great camera BUT EATS Batteries like they are M&Ms.;
Reviews.Author: Mule
Reviews.Content: It's a great camera BUT EATS Batteries like they are M&Ms.; And rechargable NiCads only work in it when brand new. Once recharged the camera just says "REPLACE BATTERIES" once their recharged. HQRP AC Power Adapter for Canon PowerShot works OK if you are shooting from a static location like pics for ebay/Amazon.

Reviews.Title: good camera except..
Reviews.Author: KARINE NERSISYAN
Reviews.Content: The camera takes nice, sharp pictures and works well. I love it except you constantly have to replace the batteries. When going somewhere make sure to take extra batteries. Other than that I liked it.

Reviews.Title: Canon SX130- outstanding camera
Reviews.Author: ZimLarry
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my 17-year-old daughter at about the same time as I bought a Canon G12 for myself for over twice the price. My daughter gets better pictures than I do! Especially when using the zoom. She even got an outstanding shot of the moon!I HIGHLY recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: New Camera
Reviews.Author: Virginia Lane
Reviews.Content: I  love the features of this camera.  It zooms in great and the pictures are clear.  I definately would recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: definitely good value
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Got this camera knowing it was on the cheap side. It certainly doesn't look feel that way. It seems solid and full of features.

Reviews.Title: A good overall camera, perfect for travel, not so good for kids
Reviews.Author: Bandora Fox "Bandora"
Reviews.Content: I have always had a very good experience with the Powershot series.  This camera offers a lot of good features and quality for the price.I never had good results with taking pictures of my kids, the camera was too slow and I missed way too many moments.  The Kids and Pets setting yielded blurry photos more often than not.  Having the camera on Auto or Portrait worked better but still too slow.It is a bulky camera mainly because it uses AA batteries but I love this for travel convenience as I can always carry spare batteries without having to worry about being able to charge.  It can be a battery hog for disposable batteries but with rechargable batteries I get lots of use before needing to charge.HD video is not very good, it is great quality when in focus but there is constant auto focus which blurs and refocuses the images every few seconds which is highly annoying.I love this camera for travel but for everyday and family use I would recommend a different model.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: sripaps
Reviews.Content: Nice camera for the price. Looks good and pictures are very clear. I would recommend this for amateurs and who needs a simple camera with good features.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SX130IS 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 12x Wide Angle
Reviews.Author: Kathleen Kinnunen
Reviews.Content: Canon PowerShot SX130IS 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 12x Wide Angle is an awesome Camera.I loved it. Pictures were very clear.The camera was easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Incredible Camera
Reviews.Author: Jeremy
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera now for a few months and it far exceeded my expectations. My wife and I bought this camera to have something that would shoot more like our DSLR but not be near as bulky. This camera is only a few steps behind my Canon Rebel in the quality of photos we took. Optical zoom is the way to go! If you need a compact camera and don't want to give up high quality, go Canon, you'll never go wrong!

Reviews.Title: Review
Reviews.Author: james wright
Reviews.Content: Everything I expected, a great gift . Easy to use and takes great pictures. Downloading is a snap a very nice little camera.

Reviews.Title: Love my camera
Reviews.Author: Jessica
Reviews.Content: So far I love it, love that it uses double a betteries because with my old camera the battery always died at the worst times. Purchasing eneloop batteries is a must, they are amazing and will last forever!

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SX130IS 12.1 MP Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: M. Munoz
Reviews.Content: Maybe its to soon to make a review. I received it two days ago. But i am impressed with all the functions this camera has. If you like a thin camera style maybe this one its not for you. This camera is heavy, and a little big for the ones you can get like panasonic or sony.  Someone wrote something about a dust in the lens and this one  has something, not to big but has a little point inside.Actualization:Ok. I received this camera 3 months ago and i am really pleased and happy. The wide format is perfect to capture every thing you want and dont lose anything. The M mode let you choose the iso, aperture, speed and all this help you to take better photos. Im not a expert photographer but i think with this camera you can capture very good pictures.Some one wrote (in spanish) something i think its really true. "Say a camera take a good pictures is like saying a guitar plays a good songs".

Reviews.Title: cool camera
Reviews.Author: shek
Reviews.Content: Although for the money i think i would have gotten a better camera however it meets my needs. I wanted a little better quality without having to carry a large slr.

Reviews.Title: Its a good camera but slow flash recharge time
Reviews.Author: Boiler29
Reviews.Content: I use this camera heavily for work and take at least 1000 photos per week.  Closeups, far, high zoom, delay, the whole bit.  It takes great photos most of the time.  The autofocus has a lot of trouble but not any more than any other  powershot I've used in the past. I use the newest version of regular Sanyo eneloops and have no trouble taking 300 flash shots within a 2 hour period of time.This camera does, however, have up to a 10 second delay between flash shots which is somewhat annoying for my purpose because I'm just continually shooting.  Using SanyoXXX batteries doesn't seem to help with the flash recharge time.

Reviews.Title: BEWARE OF BATTERY LIFE
Reviews.Author: cmr "reviewermom"
Reviews.Content: The camera itself is wonderful - I have taken some beautiful photos with it.  I went with the "Canon" name thinking the product would be fabulous.  I regret now that I did not return it due to battery life.  If you are purchasing based on photo quality this is a great camera.  If you don't want to replace batteries every 15 shots then purchase another.Spent a day at one of the Disney parks and I had to be sure I had 10 batteries with me.  The rechargeables do not seem to get any extra life out of them.  Not sure why it consumes battery life so quickly but this is definitely a problem with this product.  I recently spoke to another person who has the same camera and asked her thoughts.  She said the same thing - great, clear, concise photos but no battery life.  Canon needs to fix this problem and they will have a fantastic product.  I do like the fact that you can video from the camera but again the batteries won't last through an entire video.

Reviews.Title: Totally Awesome!
Reviews.Author: Dex662
Reviews.Content: I can not put into words about this camera!I've owned Canon Camera's from a 35mm print to my 1st digital being the Power Shot A-10 and then have owned several others (lost or given away for newer cameras). They just keep getting better and better.The ZOOM is unbelievable!My son has a Canon Rebel and I can say it takes almost as good of images as his Rebel.

Reviews.Title: my camera
Reviews.Author: P.A. De Voe
Reviews.Content: I have an older Canon, it still takes great pictures, but it was time to move on.  I am very very pleased with my Power Shot SX130IS the zoom is great, the lens as always from Canon is flawless. Yesterday I used the full zoom to take a picture through a window of a cardinal that was perched across the street (100 feet away) When blownup you can see every feather!!! Just LOVE my new camera.

Reviews.Title: Very good camera
Reviews.Author: MS
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera great value for the price, I have taken it on many trips and it take amazing pictures.

Reviews.Title: Amazon  Canon Powershot SX1301S
Reviews.Author: Kenneth Dillon
Reviews.Content: I love my camera, takes great pictures and the zoom is wonderful.  Very easy to understand and download pictures onto your computer.

Reviews.Title: I love this camera!
Reviews.Author: harold
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera from Amazon on Sept. 7, 2012 specifically for use on a Canadian cruise I was taking on Sept. 18th.  I had virtually no time to read up on it's use or to practice with it before leaving so I just shot everything in "Auto" mode.  279 pictures later I was extremely pleased with all but 4 pictures..... all 4 of which were my error.  The camera was VERY easy to use and the clarity of the pictures were spot on.  I did find out, simply by chance, that when I toggled the lens to it's maximum length, (times 12), then toggle it again it zooms out to 24X, then again to 36X, and finally to 48X.  The setting above 12X are digital and not optical and you definitely need either a tripod or an extremely steady hand to shoot at those focal lengths but it was nice to find out the camera has that capability.  Also the "anti shake" works exceptionally well.  I was also delighted to find out just how dark an area I could shoot without flash.  Best camera I've ever used for that.  Even though the screen would say "use flash" you could shoot without the flash and unless it was almost completely dark, the picture would be readable.

Reviews.Title: Opinion on camera
Reviews.Author: picky
Reviews.Content: Repurchased this model camera...my original camera was stolen...great for my casual needs, easy to use and takes good photos.  Only negative is short battery life...rechargeabe batteries improve that issue. Be informed, packaged deal (buy both camera and flash card for $xx may not be a good deal)

Reviews.Title: Short life of batteries
Reviews.Author: I. Ho
Reviews.Content: I used to own a Canon digital camera which came with a rechargeable battery.  With an overnight charge, I could use it for almost a whole day.  For this Canon SX130IS, two brand new batteries can only last about a couple of hours for just taking pictures (no video).  I wish I did not buy this one. If I am allowed to return it, I would definitely send it back!

Reviews.Title: Great camera.  Many features.
Reviews.Author: C. Burton
Reviews.Content: Feature packed camera is really easy to use, two auto modes (regular and easy), with full manual control for special shots.  Quick startup.I especially like the dial on the control buttons for easy adjustments.  Large bright screen.Pop-up flash eliminates flash guesswork.  Up and it's on, down and it's off.  Also, the flash is uniform over the whole field, even in large rooms.Great HD video with zoom.  Uses rechargeable AA batteries, a big plus for me.

Reviews.Title: Canon forever! So user friendly & great pictures!
Reviews.Author: metaluna00 "Kim"
Reviews.Content: This model is my upgrade from the fabulous PowerShot A75 because I wanted the image stabilizer, wide lens and longer movies. My Powershot A75 takes the sharpest pictures I've ever seen so I'm keeping it as a back-up. I've had it for 8 years and taken thousands of pictures - very few have been less than perfect.The SX130 IS: I love the screen - it's huge! Even though my hands are small, this camera is very comfortable to hold. Using the auto setting will show a slider image with icons/instructions on taking a better picture. It does this while analyzing your distance and lighting. I look forward to using it for many years but there's one thing I don't like - no instruction book except on the CD. I printed all 174 pages so that proves how much this camera can do. Take your copies to have hold punched and a binding. I paid less than $5 for that! The green booklet is 34 pages and only a Quick Guide. Users want the full instructions on paper when away from home. I want to know everything and understand all the features and my memory isn't that great. I'm really annoyed at the big watermark ("COPY") across the middle of every page - including the cover. I don't have one bad thing to say about the camera. Images are outstanding, it's easy to use and a very reasonable price. Be sure to get the Eneloop rechargeable batteries (with charger) and you won't have any complaints on battery life.

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: great - love the wide angle.  the pictures are clear and crisp.  still working on learning the manual settings....not so easy.  The camera is a bit heavy and large but that is the price you pay to have one that uses AA batteries versus the rechargable batteries of other cameras that often fail, are difficult to find replacements that then work worse than the original.

Reviews.Title: Canon SX130IS - Good Camera But Needs Appropriate Batteries
Reviews.Author: JWCPA
Reviews.Content: Background - After my 35+ years old Olympus 35-SP (compact 35mm viewfinder camera) auto exposure control went bad a few years ago, finally decided that a new digital camera was in order.  Wanted something similar to Canon A590IS I got as a spouse present in Dec 2008, but that camera is no longer on the market except from places like eBay, as used (two purchased tries resulted in fatally defective items received each time) or as new (much more expensive than original pricing or for present similar new cameras). The A590 is a nice camera with a good features/price ratio, a viewfinder that was becoming a rare feature even in 2008, but a less-than-stellar AA battery life that was finally resolved by using more appropriate battery types than Canon recommended (see remarks at end of this review).There are not many digital cameras with viewfinders on the market these days for less than a quite a few hundred dollars, so the closest that I thought might have the photo quality/features similar to the A590 was the Canon SX130IS. For a side-by-side comparison any current two cameras, see the camera-catalog.com to set up your desired comparisons. As a side note, my understanding is that the later Canon SX150IS follow-up model now on the market is a relatively minor upgrade of the SX130.The SX130 has many the positive features of the A590 (but enhanced), and some of the negatives (e.g. long flash cycle times, need for better AA batteries), with a few minor feature (for my uses) differences. The most obvious differences I see are that the SX130 is slightly larger/heavier, has more megapixels per photo, a larger optical zoom (12X vs. 4X), but lacks a viewfinder and an auto flash. The flash must be flipped up manually when indicated while in Auto mode, but the camera will operated whether the flash is up or not (sometimes photo looks fine without flash). Since I'm use to mounting a separate flash unit as needed for my old 35mm camera, the manual feature doesn't bother me, as I thought it an advantage if I want to easily NOT allow the flash while in Auto mode for lower light distance photos. The lack of a viewfinder is a real disadvantage, as it's much easier than a LCD screen for photo composition, and especially in bright sunlight it become very difficult too see the LCD screen unless one turns up the screen brightness to max (just about see scene sometimes).Some items to note: - A paper user guide is not provided, you have to use the digital PDF copy off the included CD or downloaded it from the Canon website. A major inconvenience in my view, now one needs a computer system just to read something to learn or look up something about the various features/settings. - There is no SD card included with the SX130, not even a pathetically small 32MB card like with the A590, so one can not immediately test the SX130 right out of the box unless  a spare SD card is available. - As with other digital cameras, the included Canon bloated software takes up umpteen megabytes of computer hard-disk. I did not use that software as there is better free Internet downloadable free stuff available for photos downloading/organization/editing. Also, it easier for me just to take the SD card out and put into a cheap USB reader (available for a few dollars from eBay, Meritline, Amazon, etc.) and transfer the photos to a computer just like with any other flash drive.Once we got my spouse's A590 model's perennial Canon short AA battery life issues (see other Amazon and other forums' reviews) resolved by using either Energizer Ultimate lithium (4X or 8X) or Sanyo Eneloop (slow discharge rate when not being used) rechargables, that camera has provided fine service. Using regular alkaline or regular rechargeable NiMH AA batteries can be a waste of money/time as too many folks may never get any more than a very small fraction of the number of  the shots exaggeratedly claimed in the Canon camera specifications for a set  of these battery types. If the camera design and/or normal manufacturing variations are such that some non-trivial number of units (judging from the reviews) really need some specific types of  AAs for better/acceptable performance, then Canon would better serve itself and its customers by not put ting possibly misleading shot numbers for using alkalines or your average store-bought rechargables. See my Amazon 1/31/09 A590 review and later 6/25/12 Comments note about the Canon A590 and batteries at http://www.amazon.com/review/R3TZKZJ5U6K19V/ref=cm_cd_notf_message/176-3175168-1504157?ie=UTF8&cdForum;=Fx63B1EKY0E2BL&cdPage;=1&cdThread;=Tx1I9RO32Y8R49X#MxYYFXHZN76US6Since my Sept 2011 SX130 purchase, the camera has operated well for me using the Energizer Ultimate lithium or Sanyo Eneloop batteries. I get several hundred photos per pair from the lithiums, and as of 8/28/12 I've shot more than 120 photos so far with a pair of Eneloops straight out of the blister pack (not been in a charger) and no sign of a battery low indication yet even though the Eneloops were originally purchased near the end of June 2012.12/31/12 Batteries Update:I used the above mentioned pair of AA Sanyo Eneloop (newer 1500X charges model) 2000 mAH low self-discharge NiMH batteries (right out of the blister pack) for the past 6 months and got 160 shots before the low battery indication came on.  When the Eneloops start off fully charged instead of just out of the product packaging, I'm expecting they may give me closer to 300 shots or more. See my more detailed Eneloops review at:  http://www.amazon.com/review/R15BOEYASLAUTN

Reviews.Title: disapointing
Reviews.Author: K. Peters
Reviews.Content: the camera itself is ok but when i leave it on  to wait for that perfect shot the low battery light comes on, i don't carry batteries in my back pocket i'm thinking of sending it back and going back to a rechargeable battery !

Reviews.Title: I'm glad I bought the Canon PowerShot SX130IS camera!
Reviews.Author: Mary Lou Morey
Reviews.Content: This digital camera is just the right size to carry, easy to use and takes great pictures.  I would certainly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Canon camera
Reviews.Author: MJ
Reviews.Content: Very happy with the product, which was a replaecement for an older model that was stolen... More zoom power but not as user friendly as the previous one i had. Definitely worth the purchase

Reviews.Title: This was a Christmas gift to me
Reviews.Author: Samuel S. Croft "Capitol Hill Guy"
Reviews.Content: I love this camera.  It is the older model that was on sale when the new one came out but I love it.  It's easy to use and sturdy.  Takes great pics and easy to load on to my computer.

Reviews.Title: One of the best for its price point.
Reviews.Author: Roxyana W,
Reviews.Content: The Canon PowerShot SX130IS was my first camera, and it still one of my favorites. It has the power and features available in larger, pricier cameras but the portability to go anywhere, and it's quite resilient to damage.So, then -- list time:PROS:-Compact and portable, will easily fit into a pocket.-Excellent Zoom, puts my Eos Rebel T3i to shame. Doubles for a pair of binoculars now and then.-A Macro function, which is a special point of interest for some. It won't match dedicated macro lenses or cameras, but having it certainly makes a difference in your photos.-Around 9000 other features. Not literally, but this camera can handle a good variety of challenges and be set to perform quite a lot of functions, from portrait to landscape shots.-For its price point, it takes good photos and video. Pricier cameras would take better photos and video... but you would have to go more than double on the expense for that to happen.-There aren't any weird tints to your photos with this camera.-Runs on two AA batteries, which is great when you're traveling.-Having a wrist strap, while common to many cameras, is still a pro when the camera is small enough to fit in one hand.-You can control the entire camera with your right hand.CONS:-You better have a lot of AA batteries. Battery life, depending on use, can range from 3-7 hours... unless you are taking photos very quickly or taking video, in which case two hours would be impressive.-Ten minute video length, max -- you can take as many videos as your memory card allows, but none of them will be longer than ten minutes.-If dust gets into the (irremovable) lens (it will,) you will know. And may the force be with you in trying to remove it on your own.-Some people won't find the video or sound quality up to snuff.
