Additionally, trying to play a video on some computers will often necessitate a download of the Combined Community Codec Pack. Windows doesn't like MP4s, for some reason.-It's a little slow, especially under low-light conditions.-The LCD screen is built-in to the camera -- it doesn't flip out.-It's also your viewfinder.This particular Powershot is my favorite of the series. It's never let me down, it can go anywhere with me, and it lets me photograph moths and landscapes with equal success. It has a myriad of features, and most of them aren't novelty gimmicks. Especially for it's relatively low price, this is both a great travel-camera and an excellent beginner camera. It won't disappoint you.

Reviews.Title: Very happy and great photos!
Reviews.Author: flaboy772
Reviews.Content: I am not a professional or even a recreational user so my review may not cover many of the extras this camera is able to do.  I am a below average user who wants it to be ready and easy to use.  Since I bought this for use during an overseas vacation buying a camera that uses AA batteries was important because you can buy AA batteries anywhere and not have to worry about finding an outlet or how long a charge will last.  The menu was very easy to figure out and maybe one day I will read the manual to be able to use many of the fancy extras but for clear and wonderful pictures I am very satisfied with the camera.

Reviews.Title: Tough camera can take a beating
Reviews.Author: Kek
Reviews.Content: I gave this camera to my son as a gift.  He is a hiker and hinted that he wanted a camera that was not prone to failure in less than idseal conditions.  This Powershot SX130 is small enough to fit in a pocket and still produce high quality pictures.  It has taken a beating and keeps on ticking.  (Sorry about that John Cameron Swayze)

Reviews.Title: I love this camera!!
Reviews.Author: gresensam
Reviews.Content: If you're going to have a professional photoshoot in the dark, perhaps not your best bet. (I find the flash to only work in certain lightings. It only works for nighttime if you are right beside the person..literally) However, for an amateur photographer just wanting to take snaps of a tour or your best friend, it's beautiful!

Reviews.Title: Canon sureshot
Reviews.Author: Barbara L. Lee "picture buff"
Reviews.Content: Camera arrived promptly and as described.  Tried it out and it performed beautifuly.  Previous camera was also a canon so this one was easy to use, much the same as the previous camera.  I purchased this model because it was rated a best by according to Consumer Reports Magazine.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SX130IS 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 12x Wide Angle Optical Image Stabilized Zoom with 3.0-Inch LCD
Reviews.Author: Laura S
Reviews.Content: Camera takes awesome pics.  One reason for purchase was to be able to use camcorder with lighting in dark areas or at night, and I haven't yet found a way to accomplish this....cams real dark at night or dark lighting.  HELP!Canon PowerShot SX130IS 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 12x Wide Angle Optical Image Stabilized Zoom with 3.0-Inch LCD

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Camera
Reviews.Author: Olga
Reviews.Content: Love this camera! Takes great shots, easy to use and the colors look amazing! Best camera ive owned so far!! Love it!

Reviews.Title: A excellent option
Reviews.Author: jos vazquez "Josep"
Reviews.Content: I read many reviews on this camera (and many others) and I decided to buy it .. and I have not been disappointed by it ... if not now also recommend it for anyone who does not want to make professional use of it. I tried your little video camera but when it comes to photography is really excellent for its price (I have to take pictures on an airplane in flight and were perfect). therefore believe that many of those who gave negative reviews about it did not read the instructions (must allow time for the camera to focus the lens before taking the picture). In addition, energy consumption is quite normal and best of all is the appearance of the device (it has a very good design). In short, if you take good pictures with a camera, relatively cheap, I believe this is an excellent option.

Reviews.Title: Easy Setup and Easy to Use
Reviews.Author: David Bower
Reviews.Content: We wanted an easy to use camera for photographing paintings and this one seemed to have excellent credentials and with 12.1 Megapixels it had what we needed in that department. It does not include a memory stick so it's advisable to order one with the camera if you don't have spares lying around the house. I happened to have a 1GB SanDisk so I used that until the 16GB that I ordered came in to replace it.We found the camera setup to be quick and painless; there is a quick start booklet in print form but the more comprehensive 180 page user manual is only available as a pdf file which comes on the installation CD. One thing the booklet was careful to point out was the importance of formatting the memory stick by the camera. This took less than a minute using the camera's menu so it was really no trouble; setting time and date was also very easy to do.The software that comes with the camera is called ZoomBrowser and so far seems to be doing a good job. There are the usual number of editing options including trimming, color adjustment, red eye, plus stitching which permits the creating of panorama pictures.The suggested method of transferring the photos to ones computer is by a patch cord which comes with the camera; it requires a USB port on the computer and automatically starts the transfer process with a few clicks. We have taken a number of pictures with the camera attached to a tripod and have gotten excellent results so far.The camera has more bells and whistles than we will ever use but it's nice to know they're there just in case. At this point we're very pleased with the camera and feel it will do all we need it to do.If anything further develops I'll update this review.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic medium-zoom camera, great for amatuers and the like
Reviews.Author: Codguy202
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a good quality digital camera, as I haven't owned one personally (my family has some, but none that are mine), and I decided that $200-250 would be my max price.Came across the Canon Powershots and had a feeling that I'd be getting one of them, as I was very pleased with the reviews and specs (plus my dad has a more expensive one, and I really liked it). Finally decided on the SX130IS based on great reviews, and it being an upgraded product.I haven't tested out the video yet, however, I am very happy with my decision. The pictures are amazing quality, and with a decent memory card (size and class) it produces crisp pictures at a decent rate. I work at a zoo, and taking pictures exactly when I want to of the animals is important (whenever actually looking at the animals at least). Couldn't be happier! I would go into more specific detail, except that I haven't experienced everything from the camera yet. I mainly just want to take basic photos with it, at places like a zoo, but I want the other features in case I want/need them. So far, that hasn't been the case.Apparently, the camera sucks up battery life, but just get rechargeable batteries, and you're set. That way you don't have to constantly buy new batteries. I got the Eneloop batteries, just for this camera, since I could potentially go a couple months without turning it on. I want to make sure that they won't lose charge while not using the camera, and can recharge, to save money.Only negative: About 4 or 5 days after purchasing this camera, it ended up being fulfilled by Amazon and was $30 cheaper, and free 2 day shipping (with Prime, which I have). I don't regret it, but if I had waited a few days, I would have gotten it cheaper and at the same time anyways (due to the longer shipping without being fulfilled by Amazon). Oh well!

Reviews.Title: Case recommendation
Reviews.Author: Reviews-mystuff
Reviews.Content: Replacing a Pentax 4 year old model. Tech wise a major jump in features and performance.I consider its size a plus, for large hands. Apparently it is somewhat larger than other models  Its relative, it is not a large camera.Does everything. AA batteries a plus as I don't take that many pics.Case: Was a challenge to find one for a larger camera. I contacted Case Logic and they recommended the TBC304, fits with a centimeter of slack, ok fit. This will also hold extra batteries, andSD chip, USB cable but is small and can be easily shoulder carried all day. Looks smaller that Amazons GT case.For the reasonable price and performance, buy it.

Reviews.Title: This is my third purchase of this camera
Reviews.Author: Sheilag
Reviews.Content: I purchased a precurser to this camera for my daughter 4 years ago and liked it so much that I bought one for myself last year.  I liked it so much I bought this one for work.  It is simple to use, durable and takes excellent closeups to wide angle shots with very little training in it's use.  I actually like the fact that it is a little larger in size- it prevents my employees from taking it home in their pockets.  Photos are excellent.

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: Mrs. Thill
Reviews.Content: we love it!  this is actually the 2nd one we bought, the first was droped in a lake with the lens open.  After checking around, this one had the best feature for the price.

Reviews.Title: Say Cheese
Reviews.Author: BobbyCorwen
Reviews.Content: Well this is not epic and amazing camera, but it sure beats anything carried by our local HH Gregg. It is a very easy to use camera for fun pictures or the photographer on the move. It is very durable (which is a plus for me) and easy to use and master. I truly enjoy this and for the money I believe it to be one of the best deals out there. I highly recommend this camera to anyone regardless of your picture taking motives of ability.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SX130IS
Reviews.Author: David A. Tiangco
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for a few weeks. Talk about some serious bang for the buck! 12.1 MP images, 12X optical zoom, 720p video with stereo sound. That combination of ingredients is super hard to find for under $200. Believe me. I've looked. There are only a few drawbacks. For one, the size and weight are somewhat large compared to other point-and-shoot cameras. Also, instead of a switch or a dedicated button, you have to dial the top knob (11 possible positions) to get into video shooting mode. That might present a bit of a challenge in darker situations. Also, the flash needs to be flipped in and out manually. Very easy to forget sometimes. Other than that, this is one great piece of equipment.

Reviews.Title: An upgrade from my SX110 but not quite.
Reviews.Author: Nomad Vehr
Reviews.Content: I owned an SX110 before getting this camera for Christmas, mostly because of the HD video and stereo mike. As the SX110 it is very intuitive out of the box. Since I don't bother with manuals it was OK with me to get it with the PDF version, which is much faster when looking up specific functions.Battery life wise it sucks juice by crazy but I solved this by buying Sony 2700 mAh Cycle Energy batteries. Generally I think the rule is more megapixels equelas more battery consumption and more shutter lag from my experience.Regarding Auto mode, be warned! Unlike the SX110 this will set automatically to high ISO under really low light conditions, unlike the SX110 where in Auto mode you had a choice of HI and Normal ISO. Also there is no self timer in Easy mode. Pictures taken at ISO above 400 come out really grainy, then again, there is nothing new to me in that department, I deal with it by shooting in Tv or Manual mode.As for the rest the camera performs as expected. Low cycle speed during flash shooting but it's normal on AA cameras. AA Batteries is the reason I have gone behind this series of cameras just not to carry around an extra battery pack or charger. They are available aywhere, but make sure to carry an extra set of high capacity AA's. Unlike SX110 this camera will go through alkaline batteries rather quickly.On the picture video side, everything I have experienced in Canon cameras over the years. Nice to have HD video although there is the 10 minute limit (instead of full memory), but it's fine in my case since I seldom shoot videos longer than 30 seconds.

Reviews.Title: Not what I expected
Reviews.Author: Ana
Reviews.Content: I expected it to be faster and it really takes too long to write the pictures.  The zoom is great, but that is about it.  The camera turns on with barely a touch and I often find that the battery has run out because the camera turned it self on in my purse.  It goes through battaries like crazy.  You have to manually open the flash which is frustrating as well. I would not buy this product again.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!!
Reviews.Author: VA Architect
Reviews.Content: Santa brought my 13 year old daughter this camera for Christmas and she just loves it.  It takes wonderful pictures, especially close up and without flash.  Some of them are so good in fact that she hopes to enter them in a local art gallery.  She takes so many pictures, we might have to get a new external hard drive so that we won't have to get a new computer.  It does gobble the batteries but not much more than other digitals that we have had.  (She does take most pictures without flash, which will make a difference.)

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for a Great Price!!
Reviews.Author: RobinD
Reviews.Content: I love, love, love this camera!!  Easy to use, great quality pictures, and just fun to use. Enjoy taking pictures with this camera.  It takes great indoor shots, as well as outdoor shots.  It's a great camera for someone who enjoys taking pictures of their pets as much as I do!!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for avid-learners
Reviews.Author: rajeshkallur
Reviews.Content: Im a photography enthusiast. I wanted a cheap camera to learn the basics, with full manual control and great pictures, and quality. Canon gives you all!!Go for it, amazon says its temp . out of stock, but its ok, it took me 8-days to get it. but i got it for a great price! 180$.

Reviews.Title: Need Time
Reviews.Author: DonnyB
Reviews.Content: Just got back from the Caribbean and used the camera for the first time. I always wind up learning the hardway. First of all, Change the batteries to whatever everyone else has suggested. Otherwise your going to wind up splitting hairs. Secondly some of the pictures didn't come as clear as the ones from my original Power Shot A75. Down in the caribbean its difficult to see the screen, so couldn't really tell if I was focusing correctly. But with time, will learn how to use the thing correctly. Thought it would be simple as it's supposed to self-adust according to the situation. But that being said, the next shoot out should tell me if it's a keeper or a returner.

Reviews.Title: Good camera for families
Reviews.Author: Brandy Young-guzman "Brandy"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to upgrade from our older digital camera.  We have 2 young daughters that are hard to catch good photos of, and we wanted to get something that would be easier to catch the good frames with.  It was very easy to use from the get go.  It was so easy, in fact, that I have become more interested in photography and am looking to upgrade again, but while keeping this camera for normal outtings.  This camera has been so great, it captures great quality photos, has many options to choose from, and puts up with a lot of banging around that comes with having 2 kids.  Excellent camera for people who have some sort of technological abilities!

Reviews.Title: Good Camera for the price.
Reviews.Author: Jim
Reviews.Content: For not being a DSLR, I was very impressed with the picture quality and overall performance of the camera.  The 12x digital zoom is great as are the controls.  My only complaint is the lag time between when you press the button to take the picture and when the picture is taken.  If you can get it for less than $200 and part of a bundle, you've gotten a good deal.

Reviews.Title: Love the Canon
Reviews.Author: msc
Reviews.Content: I love my new Canon camera.  Very high quality pictures and so easy to use.  I looked for a camera that had the scene selection button on the body of the camera so I didn't have to go through a menu to find the needed option.  This Canon was just what I was looking for.I have now used the camera for over a year and the only complaints are low battery life and sometimes out-of-focus pictures.  It's supposed to have image stabilization, but for a confirmed amateur like myself, it's still very easy to get fuzzy pictures with this camera.  With much concentration this problem can be avoided, but I'm a point-it-and-shoot-it type of photographer and don't take the time to make sure every little thing is perfect.  The batteries HAVE to be charged before each use and I don't like that at all because I use my camera quite often.  I can't remember the type of batteries I purchased at the moment, but they were some of the recommend best.

Reviews.Title: Crisp clean hair on my hubby's toes ;)
Reviews.Author: Pen586
Reviews.Content: I was skeptical about buying this camera because of the awful battery life I've been hearing about. I went into best buy today and made the purchase anyway. If it turns out to be that awful I can take it back. (also I mentioned that I was comparing prices with Amazon and they gave me the amazon price even though they wanted 250 something for it..worth mentioning) I also went a head and bought the rechargeable batteries. So far the camera has some really great features like, black and white with what ever color you want to stand in, fish eye, posterize, sepia, etc. It takes absolutely great pictures. I took a close up of my husbands foot to see what it could do and I could see in vivid detail his toe hair's and pores on his skin. It takes great portraits and scenic's too. I used this camera for about an hour and the batteries that came with the camera died. I put the rechargeable ones in and we'll see how long they last. So far I am glad I purchased this powerhouse camera for a good price.

Reviews.Title: Very nice camera
Reviews.Author: Ellen Webb
Reviews.Content: Great camera.  Photos are beautiful.  I'm not that familiar with digital cameras so it takes a while to learn all of the things this camera will do for you.

Reviews.Title: A good value point&shoot; camera
Reviews.Author: scout
Reviews.Content: This is a nice light-weight point&shoot; camera that takes reasonable to good quality pictures in a variety of light conditions.  Its flash only has enough power for really dark shots up to six feet away but the image stabilization allows shooting still subjects in very low light without it.

Reviews.Title: Lots of camera for the price.
Reviews.Author: JB
Reviews.Content: This camera offers many of the features of a more expensive camera. And there is no need to buy a lot of extra expensive lenses as you would for a DSLR. The zoom range takes care of just about any photo length you could want, except for the most outrageous safari type lenses. I saw this camera as a best buy at Steve's Camera Reviews. I'm very pleased with it.

Reviews.Title: Yes, it eats power...but
Reviews.Author: Pete
Reviews.Content: This is a great piece of engineering.  Looking for photo quality, then low light performance, then optical zoom.  Really effective AUTO mode, but a nice range of shooting options too.  The retractable 12x zoom make this a good "compromise" camera.  Well worth having a few extra sets of NiMH rechargables in the case.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding Camera
Reviews.Author: George Goss
Reviews.Content: After my year and a half old Canon Powershot SX110 IS was stolen, it was a no-brainer to buy this camera.  It does everything my "old" one did, and was less expensive.  Having to print out an owner's manual from the included CD was a bit of an annoyance.

Reviews.Title: Reasonably priced and full of features...
Reviews.Author: Shailaja Sridhar
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my father in law as a gift. He loves it! It's easy to use, reasonable priced and full of some really nice features. Excellent choice for a casual photographer.

Reviews.Title: New camera
Reviews.Author: amazinglyenough
Reviews.Content: I was searching for a new camera for my girlfriend this being the 3 rd I will have purchased in as many years. I reserched cameras and talked to people and this camera stood out as being not only easy to use but with controls good enough to take very excellent pics if you are and advanced user. Buying it here on amazon with a 8 mb sd card and saved 50.00 at least.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!
Reviews.Author: tellemarie
Reviews.Content: After working with P&S; for so long I thought it was time for a slightly more advanced camera. Saw this and the reviews it was getting (along with all the customer images) and decided to get it. VERY pleased with it! There were a few moments when I was learning to work with the shutter speed and focusing that frustrated me, but after working with it more I got the hang of it. It's great straight out of the box and I love the miniature effect! The only downfall is finding it a case - doesn't fit in P&S; and it's too small for a full-sized camera!

Reviews.Title: Just a frustrating point and shoot to use.
Reviews.Author: R. Smith
Reviews.Content: I've owned a few Canon cameras, the A60, the A570, 300D and an S5.When my S5 went on the fritz, I decided to grab a low cost feature rich alternative as a standby until I bought a higher end DSLR. On paper the SX130 was the answer. High megapixel, strong zoom, large LCD screen, hi-res video....But IMO, it doesn't do any of those things well, or even acceptable for a low cost camera. By now  you've probably read about the horrible battery life. I experienced it first hand. I now realize why they limit the video to 10 minutes - because after about 12 minutes of video you're going to drain two brand new double AA batteries to the point that the camera will shut down. I have never used two batteries in less than 15 minutes for anything before, much less a camera- which leads me to my second complaint and that is limiting me to 10 minutes of video sucks. Yes, I know its a camera but in the age of 32gb and 64gb SD cards, Canon should trust me to decide how much video I want to shoot. Try video taping anything that last longer than 10 minutes - like realizing you are the only person with video capability at a recognition ceremony and have to stop and start it twice with gaps (and then have to use video editing software to put it all together).Finally, this camera is horrible at action shots. I took several photos at a recent wedding where someone in a group shot was moving only to have everyone in focus except the person moving. You couldn't even see their face details. I'm sure using something other than "auto" would have helped but the whole point of a competent point and shoot is that I don't have to worry with these kinds of details. Its to be expected that I should be able to take a photo without these kinds of issues. My Canon A570 is a much better camera (and yes I did pay more for it but you'd think that technology after several years would be included in the newer SX130). Even the LCD screen is snowy and dark.I'm a bit of a Canon snob but I'd rather have a Fuji, Olympus or even a Kodak in the price range I paid for this worthless camera.It does take good pictures but the conditions have to be perfect for it - lighting, movement, battery life, etc. It produces far too many substandard photos to make this a camera I'd trust for a once in a lifetime event. If after reading this you are still serious about buying this camera, then buy mine. I'm never going to use it again.

Reviews.Title: Don't even bother...
Reviews.Author: M. Randall "photo & travel enthusiast"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera as a replacement for a Casio Exilim I had.  I am an avid photographer and always have one in my purse.  My Casio has been a work horse but is starting to die.  I am a huge fan and own several Canon DSLRs so I thought a P&S; would be a great addition.I read the poor reviews about battery life while in video (which I don't usually shoot), slow flash recycle and the LCD screen being unavailable while the camera saves the previous image.  I thought that it couldn't possibly be that bad... I was wrong, IT WAS WORSE THAN I EVER IMAGINED.I never got the shot I wanted, it was slow to focus, slow to take the photo and when it finally did, the moment had already passed.  Outdoor during daylight hours it seemed fine, but any instance in which it required a flash would end up with me pulling my hair out.  So much for 4th of July party photos.Additionally, while I can shoot in manual/program mode, when using a P&S; that's not my preference and the "scene" selections on this camera are basically non-existant.  Kids & pets or Landscape.... nothing for night shots etc.Please save your money, do some research and whatever you do, do not purchase this camera or you will be as angry as I was.  I cannot believe that Canon puts their monaker on such an enormous hunk of junk.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Marcy
Reviews.Content: Got this camera last year for Christmas and I love it. I especially like that it has a "manual" flash that can be flipped up and down quickly. At first I thought it was an inconvenience but found it to be the opposite. The camera is a nice size, not too small and not too big. Something to grasp onto. Takes great pictures and has a great zoom!

Reviews.Title: CAMERA
Reviews.Author: James W. Mclean Jr. "pawpawmac"
Reviews.Content: My last camera produced fuzzy pictures and so I bought the Cannon after reading its information. I'm more than pleased with it. It makes clear, quality pictures that show remarkable detail both in content and color. Recommend this to all in need of a hand held, point and shoot camera.Excellent seller, fast.

Reviews.Title: I love this camera
Reviews.Author: Leann1988
Reviews.Content: This camera was purchased as a gift for my mother who likes to photograph flowers, outdoor scenery, pets and her stained glass artwork.  I have had my Canon Powershot SX100 IS for three years and it has not let me down.  And, other than the zoom, there isn't much difference.  I love the ease of the settings, image stablizer and it takes great photos even without a flash.  Not to mention, it is tough as nails.  It often goes hiking and spends time in my backpack or coat pocket without a case.  Although it runs on nonrechargable batteries, I can usually take 60 photos without a flash or a lot of zooming on two regular alkalines.  Lithum batteries, even being more expensive, are the way to go.  I have never used the video function.One downfall of the model I just purchased was that it did not include a hard copy of the users guide.  Having the user manual on CD is ridiculous.  I took another reviewer's recommendation and had the 90 pages printed at a copy store.If you want a camera that takes fancy pictures without a fancy price, this is the one for you.

Reviews.Title: not a fan
Reviews.Author: granny
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera and in less than one year the flash quit working.  I was told to return it to the factory, which I did.  First they did not contact me that they received it.  After sending an Email I was told they received it and it would cost me $161.00 to get it repaired.  I did not pay that much for it new.  This is a total rip off and I told them to return it to me.  I do not recommend this camera!

Reviews.Title: I love my new camera
Reviews.Author: Ginger Morris
Reviews.Content: I have been without a camera for way too long. This one is working excellent. It has everything on it and I'm very happy with the brand. Now I can take pictures whenever I want and know that they will turn out GREAT!!!

Reviews.Title: Muy bueno.
Reviews.Author: Saúl Reyes
Reviews.Content: Llego a tiempo, en términos generales muy bueno.El producto ha salido en excelentes condiciones y no he tenido contratiempos.

Reviews.Title: Okay for 1 year, then Batteries Drain While Off, Disappointed
Reviews.Author: J "tech head dc"
Reviews.Content: I liked this camera for most of the first year that I had it. Regular AA alkaline batteries drain pretty fast, so I got the expensive rechargable Canon batteries it made a big difference. I could take dozens and dozens of photos without having to recharge. However, after about a year, all of my batteries (new or used, rechargable or not) started to drain quickly while the camera was off. I don't use it much, so this was a problem whenever I wanted to grab it and take a quick picture. The behavior was disappointing and confusing, because previously, I could leave it off for long periods and there was no problem. This week, I put in a fresh pair of alkalines to see what would happen. I did not even turn it on, and a couple of days later, the batteries are completely dead.There is definitely a problem with some part of the camera -- something broke or shorted out. I don't know, but I passed the 2-year store warranty recently, which is a lesson I had to learn. I would not buy this camera again.The focus and color and quality is not very reliable either. Sometimes the pictures are good, but other times the pictures are inexplicably dark or out of focus. The manual focus ring is too difficult to use quickly. I bought it because of the 12x zoom, but the focus is unreliable depending on the mode. And the variety of modes don't make much sense or much difference either.Too bad. I feel like I cannot trust Canon products anymore because of the problems I've had. I can't even give this to my mom if I upgrade. It kind of works, but it's confusing and she won't have any understanding of why the battery dies so quickly. I feel like I wasted two hundred plus on something that is now a piece of junk. My partner's iPhone 4s takes way better pictures than this much bigger piece of equipment. Really disappointed.

Reviews.Title: A very good camera worth the money value
Reviews.Author: rashaaban
Reviews.Content: This camera has a lot of advanced options for its size.The prize is reasonable and the features are very good for a non-professional user.I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Very Good, Very nice, high quality!!!!
Reviews.Author: BelPerez
Reviews.Content: Optical and digital zoom are powerfull. I very so happy because this camera is very usefull for my research with aquatic insects

Reviews.Title: Great camera.
Reviews.Author: A.P
Reviews.Content: I am an amateur photographer, was looking for a camera that had full manual controls and which in turn, had a good price, I found this camera.The camera is heavy, but feels solid, although it is plastic not feel my hands over a toy.The only thing I disliked was that when I shake the camera gently sounds a little in order, as if "dancing" in the body of the camera, I imagine the weight of the lens, but it moves focus perfectly, otherwise, the motion objective feels reasonably and is a little noisy.Otherwise, the picture quality is better than expected, I think that despite all, deserves a 5 plus the price is very good.

Reviews.Title: I love this camera
Reviews.Author: ampwinter
Reviews.Content: I think this camera is great and works really well for the price.  The zoom is great.  My sister has the same camera and is very pleased with it as well.  She takes professional pictures with it.  I do not have any complaints.

Reviews.Title: canon powershot sx130is
Reviews.Author: Lasha
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera mainly because it was reviewed as having good pic and video quality, it has HD video, and it takes AA batteries. So far it's been superb all round.

Reviews.Title: Great gift
Reviews.Author: froggyvld "frog fanatic"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for a Christmas gift for daughter-in-law. She had been taking pictures of my grandson non-stop. Pictures are great.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, excellent deal
Reviews.Author: kclingerbrewster
Reviews.Content: This camerahas a great zoom and camcorder feature. The pictures are great and its really easy touse.

Reviews.Title: Good Buy For Us
Reviews.Author: MCW
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for use within my company. We use it to take new employee photos for ID badges, etc. Perfect - it does a great job every time!I am glad I made this purchase. Just what we needed and at a great price.

Reviews.Title: Pretty darn good camera
Reviews.Author: Western Walker
Reviews.Content: The controls and operation are very similar to earlier models which is part of the reason we chose this camera.  The feel is comfortable.  We do miss not having a viewfinder option as well as the large screen but the brightness and size make the viewing screen a major improvement over our older model.Overall I would recommend this camera although it is larger than most it is much more comfortable in your hand.  We also like the 12.1 MP and 12 x zoom.

Reviews.Title: beautiful
Reviews.Author: zaid
Reviews.Content: I surfed the Amazon website for a camera and I found canon sx130is, it's very beautiful made, the most classical modern shape, I bought the black one, I bought it from target store in Amazon website it's made in china, when you buy this camera you need to buy a memory card for it because when you want to take a single shot the camera will say (cannot record image) because there is no memory card on it, so I bought a SD HC memory card, I love all canon product.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot is a nice camera for the price
Reviews.Author: JAY
Reviews.Content: The Canon Powershot is an easy camera to operate.  It took very little time to learn to use and it is comfortable to hold when taking pictures.  The camera has a lot of great features and for someone who is not a camera buff, this cameral fits my needs perfectly.

Reviews.Title: great for the price
Reviews.Author: ohiogirl
Reviews.Content: bought this to replace one I dropped and broke.  Focuses well;  flash isn't delayed like the last one I had.  Very pleased with Canon.

Reviews.Title: Great camera but.....
Reviews.Author: CarleyG
Reviews.Content: I like the camera quality and everything, just not the battery life.. I went through 6 batteries in a week - and those aren't cheap!! I wasn't even using it a lot, but I like the pictures, although the quality doesn't quite match the price in my opinion...

Reviews.Title: Very pleased
Reviews.Author: mwither
Reviews.Content: Am very happy with this camera! It is small enough to take with me anywhere yet has more features than the smaller digitalCameras I am used to ;) definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: Love my camera, one thing I would change
Reviews.Author: Heather Sobkowich
Reviews.Content: The camera is easy to use and takes amazing photos.  It is slow though to take a second picture and I can't figure out how to speed that up.  You take a photo and you have to wait to take another for quite a period of time, so I guess that would be shutter speed?

Reviews.Title: Seems to be a great camera.
Reviews.Author: Jason Kratochvil
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for a friend.  He absolutely loves it.  I have seen the pics it has taken and they are great.  I have owned several canon's in the past and everyone has been excellent.  Can't go wrong with this one!

Reviews.Title: I Love this Camera!
Reviews.Author: meohmy
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for a couple months and really love it.  The zoom is amazing and I've had a lot of fun with it.  The only thing I don't like is that it EATS batteries quicker than my 4yo with a bag of candy.  But everything else is amazing with this camera.  Perfect pictures, everytime!

Reviews.Title: yellow yellow yellow
Reviews.Author: A Hamm "foodie"
Reviews.Content: I was not happy with the color on this especially indoors. It may have been the camera itself as had some ohter issues with it..  I ordered a panasonic lumix (24 mm wide angle) after that and compared the two. the color was much better on the panasonic with the leica lens.  sorry cant remember model right now but it has 12 x zoom and comes in many colors was 249 so more than the canon but much better color.  things I do miss in the canon as love my 800IS but this camera just did not do it for me.  The panasonic is much smaller too which I really like altho I do miss the viewfinder but seems the perfect camera is hard to find.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, but not as good as my other Canon
Reviews.Author: SAC "SAC"
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera and the zoom is amazing. However, the pictures are not as good as my point and click camera. Also, when using the video mode, the picture frequently goes in and out of focus. This does not happen with my other Canon PowerShot. But when the video is clear, it is crystal clear.

Reviews.Title: Sweet camera
Reviews.Author: R. E. Sweet
Reviews.Content: This is my 8th in a long series of Canon cameras, so the learning curve for me was relatively easy.  I do forget to put the "flash" unit up, which is annoying at times.  Also - Image Quality is quite good, not as good as previous Canons.  What I found most disturbing was the write speed of this camera.  With a 30 MB/sec card in (the fastest available in SDHC), write speed is extremely slow.  Add the flash and it grinds to a halt.  But, that being said, the 12Mp and 12X optical are great in a unit this small.

Reviews.Title: Don't like this camera
Reviews.Author: Patticake
Reviews.Content: I got this camera last year for Christmas.  I cannot tell you all the shots that we have missed of grandkids and pets over the last year.  There are too many variables for this camera for someone like me who is basically point and shoot.  Blurry, fuzzy, dark pictures...I could go on and on.  When the batteries run out, and this is often, the whole thing resets and you have to enter the date and time.  Not fun.I hate this camera and bought a new point and shoot last week.  I'll be getting rid of this one asap.

Reviews.Title: Not as good as I thought
Reviews.Author: Marco from Brazil
Reviews.Content: First of all Im a Canon man this is maybe my 4 th canon camera.To be honest I do not Know if the problem is with me or the camera but I do not think this camera takes sharp portrait pictures.The problem is when take pictures of people the biggest part is too noise. To take pictures of landscape this camera is very good evenin low lights with some adjustments I took great pics.I will keep trying some new adjustments to take nice people pictures but Im not very confident I will get nice pics.The flash is good the size is not very small but not too big eighter. The controls are nice and well explained on the screen. the battery life is too too  short without recharbles batteries.  I tryed little the s95 which in my opinion takes better pics with nice color for 200,00 more.

Reviews.Title: Don't believe the good reviews
Reviews.Author: T. Hartman
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for 14 months now.  It started out taking great pictures outdoors and in bright interiors.  Movies were impressive.  It wasn't ever very good at interior flash pictures, with a large percentage coming out blurry on much of the depth of field.  Now I can get maybe 1 good picture out of 20 on interior shots, perhaps 1/3 good on outdoor shots.  It must have the dreaded dust syndrome, even though the camera has not been used outdoors that much.I was devastated at how badly 98% of my Halloween, Thanksgiving and Christmas pictures came out.  Canon, you let consumers down badly with this piece of junk- I won't be buying your cameras any more for a long time (if ever).  I recommend you don't waste your money either.  I am going to use my 4 MP Kodak with 10 power zoom again until I can find a better camera.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera... terrible battery drain
Reviews.Author: KenSea
Reviews.Content: This camera takes beautiful, crisp pictures of a quality I have never experienced before. The manual controls have allowed me to take SLR-like pictures, but without the hefty price tag. I love this camera and all it's features, but the battery life is a HUGE issue! I have seriously considered returning the camera, due to extreme battery drainage, but am keeping it because I've decided that the annoyance of having to pack a 4 AA (2900 mAh NiMH) battery charger into the camera bag and constantly having to remember to plug in the charger is similar to a cell phone. You wouldn't go far without your charger would you? If you use the awesome features that come with this camera..ie. zoom, flash, huge LCD display screen (of course you do, or you wouldn't have chosen this camera) than you can expect to replace your batteries once to twice a day on a vacation. This camera should have come with a heavy duty rechargeable battery pack and a charge cord/docking station, what were you thinking Canon?

Reviews.Title: Wanted  to replace my old Canon Powershot...Very disappointing
Reviews.Author: In my humble opinion...
Reviews.Content: I wanted to replace my Canon Powershot A 710 which I've had for 4 years and loved. It took perfect pictures every time. After reading about this Canon, I decided to buy it instead of fixing my old camera ( which stopped taking pictures because of an internal problem with the auto flash.)  I am still wondering if that was a mistake. This camera is very slow with the focus and at times does not focus clearly so some  pictures are blurry. I have adjusted and tried everything to see if it could get better. No, it's the camera. That's how it is. It's cheaply made, all plastic, the other was mental. It doesn't even come with a manual (only a disk to download the 150 page manual on your computer which is quite inconvenient when you're out shooting and not at a computer to refer to certain things) The battery life is terrible, maybe 4X shorter than my other Canon Powershot.  The  grip is, well, there is no grip, which you just have to get used to I guess, and keep the strap on your wrist. All that said, I decided to keep it, I'm leaving on a trip and now have no time to refurbish my old camera. I will get Lithium batteries which will help that issue, use my old camera's manual which discusses  many of the same features that both cameras have,  and  hope for the best regarding the blurry/focusing issue. The camera does have a few very cool features like taking shots in vivid colors. It's easy to learn,  displays the instructions for you if you want that setting on. The video looks good but haven't yet played around with that.

Reviews.Title: Love it love it love it
Reviews.Author: R. Ellis "saphyress"
Reviews.Content: I've had this a few days and absolutely love it!! I had a Sony CyberShot and was never happy with it. It was compact but the zoom was ok at best and the video was terrible. I was never happy with it, and when I had the opportunity to get this Canon I jumped at it.Wow! I work in a seaside town, so in the middle of August we have some beautiful photo opportunities, and my Sony was never up to the challenge.I took pictures from straight into the bright clouds (on bright setting), boats on the waterfront (landscape setting), flowers (choosing one color) etc and they all came out just as I was expecting.I got the hang of where everything was very quickly, and was able to quickly shift between settings, so do not feel I'll miss out on any photo opportunities for that reason. It was heavier than I've been used to, but is a good feel and size for holding while setting up a good shot, the weight translates to a quality feel. The zoom is just incredible, beautiful amount of detail!I got the NiMH batteries right off the bat, as that seemed to be the only drawback for people. I'm not a huge fan of that, the Sony did have a battery pack that could be removed, but the rest of the features are so awesome I can live with it.With this camera I really feel like I can capture how it feels to be there at events etc, which I haven't felt for awhile. I look forward to using it at family events etc this year.Updated Sept 29 - Love this camera more every day! I have taken shots with little effort that I could never get before! Every day I see something in a different way because I have a camera that will get the details. Have been very successful with pics of active kittens, gorgeous sunset with rays of light, unbelievable shot of the moon and more! Thrilled every day I got this one and learning more every day

Reviews.Title: cam
Reviews.Author: brian
Reviews.Content: this product is very good and it worked very well and everyones happy my family took recent pictures with it and they came out perfect.

Reviews.Title: easy to use camera takes good pics but needs better batteries
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "bob"
Reviews.Content: My teenage grandchildren love this camera due to ease of use and good pictures. It uses only 2 AA batteries but what comes with it only lasted for 20 pics, so get good lithium or NMH batteries.

Reviews.Title: Blurry...
Reviews.Author: Palomine
Reviews.Content: I am a little disappointed with the photos: many of them come out blurry, both indoors and out. I find I have to sharpen them up to make them look good before printing or posting them.  Also, the write speed is very slow.  The flash isn't very helpful as the use of it causes most images to be washed out.  With those sort of problems to deal with, I wouldn't recommend purchasing this camera.  In fact, next time I need a camera I will probably look at other brands.

Reviews.Title: Full-Res Video Hard Limit of TEN MINUTES. =(
Reviews.Author: D. Morrison
Reviews.Content: Even if you use a large and high speed sd card such as 16gb class 10, the camera will automatically stop recording video at 10 minutes if it's set to its highest HD setting, or if it reaches 4GB in length, whichever comes first.  (So if you were to video a blank piece of paper for 10 minutes it will STILL STOP!  This makes no sense because video compression works partially by "delta compression", in other words, what has changed in the frame adds size to the video file; so even with zero changes, it stops for no reason when there is plenty of space left to record on.)  If you set the video to the lowest settings it will last about an hour (I'm told by Canon USA tech support.)In short, you get what you pay for.  Canon has obviously reduced the functionality so you can't take decent length video, and are forced to buy a higher priced camera.  This is nothing new, but standard manufacturing procedure (make one model, then "cut" out features and subtract price).

Reviews.Title: Very Blurry Pictures and Shaky Video
Reviews.Author: Russell Teller
Reviews.Content: After our previous Cannon IS camera was stolen, we were looking for a good model to replace it with.  After much research, we decided to go with this model.  Upon receiving it, we began taking pictures and video only to notice that the pictures came out very blurry unless the camera was absolutly still (like on a flat surface), and the target was also very still with a lot of light.  The Image Stabilization does not work at all, and the focus is horrible.  When taking video, the camera continuously attempts to re-focus, resulting in blurry video, and when playing it back on a computer, the image is constantly shaking.  Absolutely horrible camera for the price; I miss my old Cannon that actually worked...

Reviews.Title: worst camera I've ever owned
Reviews.Author: Jennifer
Reviews.Content: I have to replace the batteries on this camera every time I use it! It's very hard and frustrating when I want to take a picture of my child in the moment but I'm having to stop and change the batteries. The moment is lost. I've spent lots of money on good batteries and rechargeable batteries and it made no difference.

Reviews.Title: Not worth it
Reviews.Author: Jeannie T
Reviews.Content: The flash broke in 1 month and the picture quality on phone is just as good or better. This was a waste of money.

Reviews.Title: eats batteries
Reviews.Author: Serial Skier
Reviews.Content: Takes MUCH better photos than a smart phone, but only works on new or almost new batteries. can't even use rechargeables.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot
Reviews.Author: Debra S. Lindsey "granny89"
Reviews.Content: I have only used it a couple times, but so far, I really love it!!! I'm looking forward to taking lots of pictures of the grandkids!!!

Reviews.Title: Camera isn't working properly after a short time.
Reviews.Author: Billie Joy Myers
Reviews.Content: About 5 months ago husband took photos of his mother's funeral and when we got home and printed out the photos we noticed that the left side of each photo was blurry.

Reviews.Title: Did not like
Reviews.Author: Kelly Cook
Reviews.Content: I purchased the camera for my trip to Kilimanjaro and I ended up not even taking it.  I was hoping to be able to take some great shots of animals but I tested it by taking shots of my dog and they were all blurry.  I read the manual and used the "sports and pets" setting but the shutter speed was never fast enough.

Reviews.Title: Photos not sharp!
Reviews.Author: Norb
Reviews.Content: Purchased at Amazon. I returned it after one day.  It is just too heavy, but the thing that made it unacceptable to me is thet the pictures it took were just not sharp, regardless of the favorable reviews.  Certainly a camera that expensive should take good pictures not blurry ones.

Reviews.Title: Picture quality was poor - overexposed in Auto - Service Good
Reviews.Author: Michael D. Callahan
Reviews.Content: The picture in Auto would overexpose.  I could manually take a good picture but it was work.  I think this one camera was defective.  When I received the camera, the batteries were already in the camera.  Someone had used it.  I bought one new at Best Buy and the batteries were in the package.  When I returned the camera, the vendor was very good.  The service at Amazon was very good.  I think it was just this camera.  I have owned PowerShot in the past and like it.

Reviews.Title: batteries don't last
Reviews.Author: Donna Sawyer
Reviews.Content: The camera is good, but the batteries don't last long enough. It quilt right in the middle of my grand daughters class play.

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: Viktor V. Choban "myth buster"
Reviews.Content: Nice for the price. I like it. Batteries are easy to find and it is able to make good images. Only indoors isn't that great.

Reviews.Title: This is not my first canon
Reviews.Author: George
Reviews.Content: First off let me say thank you to Amazon.com and there friendly and helpful staff for getting my camera to me faster then I expected. placed the order on Friday morning and Monday morning it was on my door step.As for the Canon Powershot SX130IS that I ordered. I already knew it as a great camera two years ago I was sent one from the college I was attending for one of my classes  the school wanted every one to have the same camera, so they sent everyone in the class a Powershot SX130IS. The down side to my first one was finding out after I slipped and fell in to the water while attempting to get a photo that the camera was not water proof to any extent. The camera sub merged for about three to five seconds. The camera was never the same after and presently no longer works. I decided as soon as I could I would buy another Powershot SX130IS to replace the first one, and I did that here at Amazon.com. I figured I couldn't go wrong $60.00 for a camera that Walmart was getting $199.95 for last summer, and canon wanted $299.00 for. I'd say I save my self a nice little bundle. and the photos it takes in my opinion far exceed the manufacturers expectations. For a point and shoot camera honestly Canon out did themselves. I put copies of all my photos on my IGoogle account and on my face book account to share with all my friends. So that they can see how well the Canon Powershot SX130IS works. My next Camera will be a canon Rebel more then likely a T3i later this year when the leaves start to turn. I live in Maine and the power shot does a nice job but I want more zoom so I can get more detail."So Amazon keep those prices down and I'll be back later this year."

Reviews.Title: CANONPOWERSHOT TIME PROVEN
Reviews.Author: Steve Munoz
Reviews.Content: I HAD OVER THE YEARS SEVERAL POINT AND SHOOT CANON CAMERAS AS WELL AS THE LARGER SLR FORMAT CAMERAS....THEY HAVE PROVEN TO BE DEPENDABLE AND DURABLE....THE VERY FEW TIMES I NEEDED WARRANTY WORK CANON SERVICE QUICKLY REPAIRED THE PROBLEM OR OUTRIGHT REPLACED THE CAMERA. ..... ITS CANON

Reviews.Title: chic and easy to use
Reviews.Author: babibreze
Reviews.Content: I was searching for something different (professional looking) and easy to use.  I love the look of this camera and it takes great pics. Very easy to use.  I am very happy with my choice.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot
Reviews.Author: sphish "sphish97"
Reviews.Content: The camara has wonderful picture qualities, however I was very disappointed with the fact it only takes AA batteries.  It would have been nice to have the option to charge the camara through a computer or a battery insert.

Reviews.Title: overall GooD~! for this small machine, but Battery is the inconvenience part
Reviews.Author: Sanique
Reviews.Content: The specs and photo quality are satisfying.. the mega pixels and 12x zoom in gives a good quality too!However, battery consuming is inconvenience, while normal AA (i have been using the Duracell AA batt) only last for only approximately 3 hours. Rechargeable battery should be considered to buy along with this product~ at first I tot there would be spared batteries that could be recharge come along with the camera, it's kinda upset when i see only 2 alkaline batteries are attached that could only last for couples of hours... =(but overall, the camera is awesome with clear display of wide screen~~ =)

Reviews.Title: great pictures, terrible battery
Reviews.Author: Azm
Reviews.Content: This camera takes amazing pictures and has a lot of modes to play around with.The flash recycle time is quite long. Also the battery life is terrible. I returned it and bought a sd1400is instead just because of the battery.I took this camera with me on vacation to cabo and it died while I was in the middle of recording a whale emerging from the ocean. I had an extra set of batteries in my pocket but having to change them so frequently (1-2 sets a day) was too much. Also it did not come with any rechargeable batteries.If you do decide to buy this camera be sure to try the super vivid mode for amazing scenic shots.

Reviews.Title: Good point & shoot, but not very sharp
Reviews.Author: Dantiri
Reviews.Content: This is a decent point & shoot, but don't expect too much from it. Portraits will not come out very well, the lens is very wide so distortion is an issue, also, the portrait preset will give you weird colors and make the picture even softer. Very noisy when you go over 400 iso. Picture isn't very sharp, I never liked the overall softness. There are too many presets which will only confuse you. color is nice, canon offers a good variety of settings for color control. I wouldn't really recommend this camera to friends because of the sharpness issue. I still prefer my old kodak z730 bought in 2005 as far as sharpness and the overall picture quality you can get without fiddling too much.

Reviews.Title: Canon NEVER Fails to STUN or Depress User.
Reviews.Author: Scott S. Divincenzo "scottidee"
Reviews.Content: NO Hotshoe - Sync or Remote PORT ?  but rather color swap and miniature + fisheye. This cam would be perfect with a sync port-- SX130 built in flash recycles every  10 daysTo canons CREDIT the CUSTOMIZED self timer can be programed 01-10 snapswith a 01-30 second window VERY handy 9 for  NO  BASIC remote ports

Reviews.Title: Good Family Camera
Reviews.Author: Silver Line
Reviews.Content: Pictures are very sharp and clear and experimented with all options.Liked fish eye, miniature modes alot. Gives pictures of professional looks.Experimented a lot indoors and pictures are not dull.Even captured running tap water droplets by experimenting with manual controls.Video quality also looks very good on camera play back eventhough I haven't yet uploaded it on to computer.A good camera for day to day family pictures.Bought enelopes rechargeable batteries in Costco for dollar 25 as suggested by other reviewers and works great.Cons: There is no panoramic sweep mode on this camera

Reviews.Title: It's A Battery Eater For Sure!
Reviews.Author: Rod Hall "blue_man_blues"
Reviews.Content: I had a Kodak EasyShare Z981 and just loved it.  Unfortunately, someone else liked it better than me and stole it from my work vehicle.  I decided to replace it with this Canon PowerShot SX130IS 12.1 MP.  There are things that I like and dislike about this camera.  The main dislike is that it eats batteries faster than I can buy them.  For example I put in 2 new Energizer alkaline batteries and after 8 shots, the low battery light was flashing.  After 3 more shots, the batteries were dead and had to be replaced.  A friend, who has the same camera, suggested Lithium batteries.  He said that he got almost 200 shots out of a set of batteries.  I haven't tried them yet, to be honest.  The other thing is the time it takes between shots.  It seems quite slow. It could be the possibility that I'm just used to my Nikon COOLPIX P90 digital camera.  As far as picture quality... It takes excellent detailed pictures. The video quality is very good.  The different functions of the camera are outstanding for a economically priced camera.  All in all, the Canon PowerShot SX130IS is a very good point and shoot camera for the money.  I wouldn't hesitate to buy it as a gift for someone.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot Camera is a Sure Bet!
Reviews.Author: Victoria F. Welch
Reviews.Content: If you don't want to fuss with settings and just want to take pictures by point and click, Canon Powershot is your toy.  You won't get the pictures that will win awards but you can just pick it up and capture the shots that you want to remember.

Reviews.Title: I want my Power Shot A630 back!!!
Reviews.Author: allani
Reviews.Content: I was going to sell off my brand new P.S. SX130IS, but alas I fell 5ft onto my trustworthy P.S. A630 damaging the LCD, but not the camera itself.The SX130IS:Very mediocre photos. Crisp photos are the exception.Very mediocre photos. Even a "crisp photo" doesn't have sharp edges where they should be.Very mediocre photos. You never know if you'll get the photo you shot.Very mediocre photos. Coloration is cold. Natural colors aren't warm, as they look to the eye.I.S. is spotty.  Sometimes impossible to get non-blurry photos despite multiple tries.Battery life is wimpy.  Carry extra batteries, especially for flash use.As with A630, macro photos are a crap shoot/crap shot.Skip this camera and the disappointment and get a good camera!I'm now looking for a replacement.What happened to Canon?

Reviews.Title: Didn't work out
Reviews.Author: KVO
Reviews.Content: I ordered this and was thrilled with its size and zoom capability.  I have a 1 year-old, and love to take pictures of him.  This camera did not have a setting that I could capture a photo of him in motion, which he always is!  I am accustomed to having more control over the SCN functions - this camera has 28!  You cannot, however use them on demand, the camera selects the appropriate SCN function for you.  The auto controls that adjusted for skin tone to avoid white-out when using the flash were nice.  OVerall it did not perform as expected.  I returned it and bought a larger-bodied camera with more control.

Reviews.Title: Huge Disappointment with Canon
Reviews.Author: Arthur G. Broadhurst
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for 18 months.  I used it occasionally.  It replaced an older SLR camera.  I am an experienced photographer.  The camera takes excellent quality pictures, or at least it did until recently.  I noticed that the pics I took in August seemed slightly out of focus and I thought I must have done something wrong on the day I used it.  However I just got out the camera again to take to a lacrosse tournament where my grandson was an outstanding player, and I wanted to get some good photos of him and his team, both still shots and during the action.  I was horribly disappointed to find that the pictures were in sharp focus on the right side of the picture and fuzzy or blurry on the left side.  My grandson played in the championship game in the Yale Stadium last Saturday and the pics were useless--and there is no way obviously to replace the situation.I contacted Canon, they pointed out what I already knew, that the camera was out of warranty (even though it was shortly after the warranty expired that the problem showed up) and that it would cost $139 to have it repaired plus parts if needed, when I paid $169 for it new.  I was shocked at Canon's attitude and extremely disappointed that this camera failed after so short a time.  So I have learned a valuable lesson.  Canon is not what it used to be and the quality is just not there any more now that these cameras are made in China and their service is just not up to their reputation any longer.Updated November 24, 2013.  After reading a lot of reviews about this camera I thought I should comment on some issues.  First, battery life.  I did not experience the poor battery life that some have reported, and I always used standard batteries.  Second,I never had any problem with the zoom.  Third, I spent a lot of time yesterday attempting various solutions to the image focus problem, using various settings (with autofocus, and manually) to see if I could find any combination of settings that would make any difference, and regrettably, nothing would make any difference--the left side of photos (when in horizontal position) were just slightly out of focus, just enough so that I can see it looking closely.  I have never experienced this sort of problem and I have no idea whether it is a software problem or whether the lens itself is the issue.

Reviews.Title: Not too happy......
Reviews.Author: Kate Britton
Reviews.Content: The flash stopped working shortly after we bought it.  Doesn't take good pictures.  So difficult to get a good shot.

Reviews.Title: A camera named Upgrade
Reviews.Author: Will Itend
Reviews.Content: If you want to take pictures indoors this is not the camera for you.If you want to take pictures of anything in motion this is not the camera for you.If you want to take videos in focus this is not the camera for you.If you want to lug a tripod around and try every single setting to get one good photo...this is your camera.Owned two Canon PowerShot SX120IS the model previous to this disaster. They still take excellent photos in allconditions.Called Canon customer service "did you have the flash raised sir".Canon blew it with this model. Will not purchase another Canon product.P.S. I had to return this camera in the first week...burnt out pixels. The replacement was junk.

Reviews.Title: Worst Camera EVER
Reviews.Author: khall
Reviews.Content: If you have a toddler or any animal/person that moves quickly, don't bother with this camera. The flash takes forever to recharge, and the batteries (even expensive rechargeable ones) are crap. I am literally disgusted with this camera. I should have returned it to the store when I had a chance. I decided to give it more time, and maybe the function of it was "user error". No, not so much. I will be asking for a new camera for Christmas, and I'm not sure it will be a Canon. Slowest camera I have ever owned!

Reviews.Title: Not pleased with night time pics
Reviews.Author: Life Is Good "Bella"
Reviews.Content: It's my second review of the camera. I used it last weekend to shoot pics of my family and I did not like the quality of the pics and also at times it looks yellow when I shoot inside even when I put flash on. I am still experimenting but this will be a part time camera when it's bright day mostly.

Reviews.Title: Bought this camera to replace a lost Canon
Reviews.Author: Laurie
Reviews.Content: OK, ifyou are taking photos of something still...outside in good light, then this camera is fine.  Forget indoors or children....the flash takes forever to recharge..no burst mode and sucks the heck out of batteries....I get poor shots (I'm not a great photographer but my other canon helped way more)....I just ordered teh SX40..hope that is better.

Reviews.Title: Camera review
Reviews.Author: Cindy
Reviews.Content: The camera was delivered in a very timely matter and works great. Exactly as expected. Very satisfied. Bought if for my husband before we went on a family vacation and the first time he used it he took over 2000 pictures. He was very excited!!!

Reviews.Title: Canon power shot
Reviews.Author: Radel
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. It is the perfect small camera to take any were,when i don't want to take my Canon xsi. The lag time is very short so you don't miss out on things. The zoom is great and it allso take's wonderfull pictures in low light. The double A bateries are another reason i bought it to.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: Rachel
Reviews.Content: When I first got this, I had read lots and lots of horrible camera reviews and was very worried about it breaking. One month later it's still going strong. This is the best camera I've ever used and I love the manual focus. I haven't tried using the flash yet.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot
Reviews.Author: JOY "Jan L."
Reviews.Content: Was an upgrade from my last Canon camera.  Didn't take me long to get it going and I LOVE IT!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  So much better and gives better results than my previsous model.  So glad I spent the money on it,.

Reviews.Title: Uses up batteries like candy.  Less that 5 hours, sometimes 2!
Reviews.Author: frustrated
Reviews.Content: Excellent camera, lousy battery life!  I used 12 batteries on a 1 week cruise and upon coming home, used up 2 more while sorting them on my computer!  Beware!

Reviews.Title: I had high hopes
Reviews.Author: D. Cornell "Barefootd"
Reviews.Content: I looked and tried and looked and tried at different point and shoot cameras for weeks to replace my Fuji (that I loved but dropped and the screen bled).  I also talked to friends who have Canon and said "you can't go wrong with a Canon"...I beg to differ.  I took it to my moms birthday celebration and ended up having to ask someone else to also take photos as my pics appeared "yellowish" upon review.  They WERE VERY YELLOW when I got them downloaded.  AND some other reviewers complained about the "light streaks" while shooting indoors and YES there they were...big streaks of light coming from the ceiling lighting in the room.  And the flash...Oh my...what a pain to have to lift the flash and miss a good shot...then when I did leave the flash up on 'auto' it washed out the subjects in the picture (and some people had an orange cast)...the flash has a setting to lower the intensity but that didn't work either.  I took some outdoor pics and they came out fine.  So this camera definitely loves a lot of light and other than that it's just not a good buy.  As for the batteries, I used the AA lithium right away and did not replace them for a week.  I really had high hopes for this camera with the great zoom and multiple features....just not Canon quality this time.  I returned the camera and am on the hunt again!

Reviews.Title: Zooming in & out
Reviews.Author: SoSilly
Reviews.Content: I have had the camera for about 2 months now and it works very well. The only problem I run into is that it freezes sometimes when I'm zooming in & out. Other than that it takes great pictures and I have not read the manual yet. People are always impressed with the quality of my pictures.

Reviews.Title: Better than similar cameras in its class
Reviews.Author: Savannah Lewis
Reviews.Content: I previously owned the PowerShot SX120IS, and it was a fantastic camera. When I saw there was a *new and improved* model, I purchased the SX130IS only days after its Amazon premier. I consider it an intermediate point and shoot since it offers simplicity along with an impressive array of manual functions. Although a professional photographer would probably not be impressed at first glance, the image quality may change their mind. I have received NUMEROUS offers from people, "I will pay you fairly for a photo shoot!" and the like :)Fantastic macro shots, great zoom, very easy to use. Overall, the image quality is the most important and I am definitely impressed with it! If you're on a budget but have high expectations for point and shoot image quality, this camera is sure to satisfy.The video feature has never impressed me. The auto-focus is very spotty, it tends to try to focus on other things (or just goes out of focus all together) in all lighting. I was very disappointed when I tried to record my daughter on Christmas morning and the videos were COMPLETELY out of focus at times. If you set it on manual focus the quality is decent. Also, if you're shooting video in HD (720p) you can only record about 30 seconds worth before the audio starts going out of sync. This is a problem Canon is aware of, but still extremely disappointing.I will purchase the Nikon P100 in the next couple weeks, but I do plan on keeping this Canon as a backup.

Reviews.Title: Big Disappointment
Reviews.Author: Jomo
Reviews.Content: I am very disappointed with this camera.  No matter which mode, I generally end up with photos that are too fuzzy to save.  Even with image stabilization turned on, the results are no better.  I have read and re-read the instructions, and my co-workers have tried the camera--no luck.  Even my professional photographer husband has looked at the camera, but the end result is that neither of us can figure out how to produce sharp images.

Reviews.Title: Defective camera
Reviews.Author: Roseline how
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed I received this camera which was received defective has never turned on.  Buyer did notvrefund, I am waiting for amazon's help.  Note that I took camera to to repair stores where both told me that have knowledge of this series being defective, I have also googled with same information.  Very disappointed thus far with camera and seller.Roseline

Reviews.Title: wonderful camera
Reviews.Author: shell
Reviews.Content: The camera I received is great works wonderfully I received it very fast and was as described I'm extremely happy with my purchase thank you so much! :)

Reviews.Title: Like it.
Reviews.Author: vrn1
Reviews.Content: I first bought digital P&S; camera (3 mpix, 3x zoom) in 2003. Then it was more than 450 $. This one is 12 Mpix, 12x zoom, hd video and 134 $. Great screen, noiseless (almost) zoom. Very impressed by this camera. But I'm using it less than a month, so far. Will see.

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: forestmeister
Reviews.Content: A nice little camera. Canon PowerShot SX130IS 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 12x Wide Angle Optical Image Stabilized Zoom with 3.0-Inch LCD worked wonders. I don't want to write 20 more words.

Reviews.Title: Do not recommend this camera!
Reviews.Author: Sudheera Sathyanarayana "Sudheera"
Reviews.Content: Takes long time to 'focus', More than 50% of the pictures are out of focus, important moments are frequently missed. Not meant to take pictures of kids. Very long 'next shot delay' which is frustrating. Battery life sucks, does not even last for 100 pictures with rechargeable batteries(2200mAh). Definitely do not recommend this camera, I would spend few bucks extra and go for a camera with faster performance. Camera is bulky and heavy, can not comfortably hold in one hand. I give 2star for its good low light pictures and video but slow performance is unacceptable!

Reviews.Title: slow lens
Reviews.Author: H. Guan
Reviews.Content: I ordered the camera and played with it for several days. The lens is a little bit slow, it start from F3.4. So without using flash, almost all indoor night time pictures are blurry or noisy.Another problem I found with the camera is, the control wheel on the back is very difficult to rotate, I always accidentally pressed down buttons while turning, that may be because I got a defective unit.If low light performance is not an issue to you, this is still a excellent camera.

Reviews.Title: Blurry and video struggles to focus.
Reviews.Author: comeon83
Reviews.Content: First a disclaimer.  I love Canon cameras.  My last one was a Canon and I never had any problems with it.This camera on the other hand has several issues.  It has so many modes that you basically need a course to teach you how to use it correctly.  And its not like one mode is only slightly better than another in a certain situation.  If you pick the wrong mode your picture will be drastically worse than optimal.If you dont use the correct mode the picture will be so blurry you cant even make out the faces of your subjects.Video also has problems.  Any movement of the camera causes the video to be blurry and it takes up to 5 seconds for the camera to refocus.  5 second lapse and you could miss the subject or event of your video.Lastly battery life can be a problem unless you use newly charged NiMh batteries with high capacities or dont mind eating through normal AAs.All that said I have only used the camera about 2 or 3 hours.  Ill use it more extensively later this year and update my review.

Reviews.Title: Cannon power shot camera
Reviews.Author: A. blonsky
Reviews.Content: It's ok,not the best camera I have ever owned....will do for now. I would  reccomend  this product probably for a starter camera.

Reviews.Title: dropped and it shattered
Reviews.Author: bruce peterson
Reviews.Content: worked great until I dropped it, so I can not comment on long life. It was very easy to use but I dropped it and then threw it out

Reviews.Title: Not sure about this camera?
Reviews.Author: Diane Hudson
Reviews.Content: I think I may have recently posted  this in wrong place? (Anyway, please excuse typos..am hunt & peck ;-)) The point...JUST received this camera today. Put in new advanced lithiums (energizer) because the eneloops I also ordered came today with a useless Euro-charger (prong plugs???) Dunno what happened there!So using new Advanced Lithiums until eneloops can be ordered....again.I ALSO have a PShot A1100is and it goes forever on AA lithiums...even short videos, etc.Today turned on the new 130's video and BLAM...INSTANT battery warning light?! When I turned off, then back on, the batt warning stopped for reg pic taking? Any further attempt at video received the warning AND "change batteries".(My A1100 rarely does this...with it,I am STILL on the same 2 batteries now after 2 weeks of video, pics, etc.!)I bought this camera for a future Africa trip(Sept) so I would have another AA powered, plus bigger-zoom, camera to accompany my A1100...something pocket/small bag size.One more thing..when I first tried it, seemed the batteries were a little warm? Even Before I tried the video.Can the "HD" video feature be turned off and a less draining vid option used? I could not find an option for it?Am now wary about this camera...wondering if it might be defective? But in a quandry since few cameras accept AA any longer. Thought AA cameras are better for somewhat remote trips because one can almost always find AA batteries...(but doubtful reg emergency alkalines would survive even a handful of pics!!)Any recent ideas? I know this camera came out a long time ago, but after reading up on it it seemed better than the newer model (150?)Thanks in advance!

Reviews.Title: Excelente Camara
Reviews.Author: Arturo
Reviews.Content: Desde que uno la saca de la caja, se da cuenta que es una excelente camara.Desde hace bastante buscaba una camara con buen zoom y bastantes megapixeles y cuando vi esta ademas tenia grabacion en video de alta definicion lo que implica un mejor sonido y una imagen mas clara.Con solo sacarla de la caja esta lista para usarse, desde los que mas saben hasta los que la usamos en modo auto, toma excelentes fotografias, definitivamente la recomiendo.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SX130IS 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 12x Wide Angle Optical Zoom
Reviews.Author: poetroy
Reviews.Content: Although I haven't had the opportunity to use this camera extensively, I find it easy to use and satisfactory in performance.

Reviews.Title: Good for the price
Reviews.Author: IAZD
Reviews.Content: It is a good camera for the low price it is offered for. The image quality is not as good as I expected, kind of noisy images even in sun light conditions. The autofocus features a magnification tool which is very useful and reminds me of analogue cameras, I think that is cool. I definitely recommend this camera for recreational use.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Zoom! Eats AA alkaline batteries within a few minutes (not hours)!!
Reviews.Author: just-another-aggie
Reviews.Content: I wanted to point out two things.This camera has an amazing zoom. I had a Canon A620 previously and while this has the Canon image quality (which means amazingly good too :) ) I was simply blown by it's ability to take great pictures at such high zooms.If you are thinking about using AA Alkaline batteries, you should plan on buying tons of those things (and prepare your conscience which is going to blame you for polluting the environment). It comes with 2 Alkaline batteries and I forgot to take the NiMH rechargables (that I also got in one of those camera bundles deals at amazon) on my trip. This can chew up batteries within minutes (I kid you not!!) - in movie mode, within seconds (seemingly) it will start warning you about batteries needing replacement. I wish Canon had managed to get 4 batteries instead of 2 AA batteries into this body. (Hence the 4 stars).Also having to manually move the flash up (it doesn't pop, you have to swing it up and open) can become a chore but you'll see the message asking you to do that when the camera detects it.Finally limiting the movie being shot to about 10 minutes (720p resolution) only for a single shot (the movie is then "written" to the SD card) seems kinda limiting.

Reviews.Title: Blurry and Slow
Reviews.Author: BookGirl "BookGirl"
Reviews.Content: I took the time to learn the features and was really excited about this camera. . especially the insane price.  Unfortunately, I'd say over 85% of my pictures were super blurry.  Yes, I was adjusting ISO and various settings and playing with flash, yes I know how to use the camera.  I was still wondering if it were me, so I gave the camera to some experienced photographers who set down their fancy Canon and Nikon DSLRs and played with mine on Christmas.  They, too, got nothing but blurry pictures.  Maybe it was my in-laws living room lighting. . .but everyone else at the party (from the cheap Fuji users to the pro DSLR users) took great pics.  Even my SIL's camera phone took better pics.  I also tried it at a restaurant with decent light and still blurry.  However, I did get some gorgeous lowlight pics of our Christmas tree and I was amazed at the sharpness. But when 85% of my pics come out blurry, that's a one star rating for me.  It's unreliable.
