I think camera companies spend too much time adding cool features to their point and shoots or try to make them look cute like a DSLR. .when what we really need is something that's compact, feels nice in the hand, and takes amazing pics easily.  Forget the cool features. . .if we wanted cool features we'd get a $400 P&S; or a DSLR.  I think they are all missing a market in P&S; and that's why some think P&S; are becoming obsolete. . which they should NOT be.  It seems you either get a crappy P&S; or a pricey one like the s95 for $400 that mimics a DSLR.  Then, next up is the DSLR.  What about a nice P&S; at $250 that is reliable and compact and well-made?  For this, I'm going to try the Canon SX 210 IS next.  If that fails me, I guess I'm going to suck it up and get that $400 s95.Also, this camera is heavy and huge for a point and shoot.  Again, if I wanted a huge, heavy camera, I'd pay for a DSLR.I did like the manual flash.  I didn't think I would but I actually think I prefer it. . but that's the only thing this camera has going.  Well, that and the nice huge LCD screen.I thought I'd like using AA batteries but I didn't.  They were a pain and are part of the reason the camera is bulky and heavy.I used the video briefly but prefer using a real camcorder so I have no comment on it's capabilities.

Reviews.Title: Don't bother
Reviews.Author: Bren
Reviews.Content: My phone takes better pictures than this.  I wish I had gotten a cheaper one because it's not worth it for the price.  I was disappointed.

Reviews.Title: DONT BUY THIS CAMERA!
Reviews.Author: leveille
Reviews.Content: The camera takes terrible pictures and the battery life is bad! I would never recommend this camera! I have only had it since April and it is nothing but a big disappointment!

Reviews.Title: sx130
Reviews.Author: William Driscoll
Reviews.Content: Wonderful camera, value priced and works great. Very happy. I purchased a 16g memory card and the camera will take 10000 pics. COOL

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Kmo
Reviews.Content: I just have to say.... amazing!!!! i take pictures with this camera and is incredible, is so easy, you must have it!!!!

Reviews.Title: Awful camera
Reviews.Author: FS
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera believing all the great reviews on different sites but was thoroughly disappointed with the quality of the pictures and the speed.  The flash takes A LONG time to charge after taking a picture and forget about taking any pictures without it!! They will all come out blurry.  Tried changing all the different settings to no avail, maybe its just me and I don't know what I am doing, but I've gotten close to throwing the camera out the window after trying everything and not getting good pictures.  I am looking for another camera, hope I have better luck next time.

Reviews.Title: Ok item
Reviews.Author: Weaver
Reviews.Content: The camera is ok. But, the life of batteries to take Video,Photo,is very short.You will need to have many batteries to keep up with video and Photo on the camera.Good luck and stock up on batteries... Rechargable are the best for the cost of batteries life time...

Reviews.Title: good but not great
Reviews.Author: dave
Reviews.Content: the pics are good. Time for camera to recover with flash is slow. Lots of options not used yet. Video not usd yet.For the price so far i've been happy with it.

Reviews.Title: defective out of the box
Reviews.Author: TJ
Reviews.Content: Picture quality was good but low-light poor. The camera looked like it was not new but more importantly, it would go through batteries in 10-15 minutes making the camera body very hot.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera, AWFUL battery life
Reviews.Author: Sophia
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera from amazon for almost $300. It took beautiful pictures and great videos. I was very happy with the camera except for the battery life. The battery life of this camera is really awful! After taking only a few photos with the camera it would say my battery life was low. You need some really powerful batteries for this camera. But even that wont give you much time to take a video or take some photos. I decided to sell my camera because i thought it would be too expensive in the end and annoying to have to keep buying AA batteries.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera but....
Reviews.Author: rrw
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice camera with excellent features, however it's battery life is something to be desired.  It needs a battery pack rather than AA batteries.  Other than that a very nice camera.

Reviews.Title: Please read this before you waste your money - or a restocking fee when you return it!
Reviews.Author: bethray "beth"
Reviews.Content: To make it short and sweet:  I was online over and over again, at Best Buy several times checking out point and shoot cameras. I figured that a 4.2 out of 5 was pretty good for the price and the sales person kept pointing me toward this option.  Perhaps I am spoiled with my SLR, but I was looking to replace a Casio point and shoot that recently broke.  I can't carry an SLR on me at all times.  I am so upset that I now have to pay a restocking fee to return this.  If you want a camera that you will take out of your pocket and want to snap only one picture, this is for you.  The flash return is SO SLOW that you cannot prepare for subsequent shots - instead, you look at a black screen and an orange flashing light.  Additionally, I'm not sure if this is common with point and shoots, but the flash does not automatically pop up - you are given a warning message to then manually eject it.  Well, my PERFECT SHOT is gone by this point.  I tried to tell myself that I'd get in the habit of putting it up every time just in case.  Again, perfect pix opportunities missed!  Please take this review seriously: I wish I had listened to the one review that pointed out some major drawbacks to this camera.  Good luck.

Reviews.Title: It does everything it said it would
Reviews.Author: West Texas Hunter
Reviews.Content: It is very good.  I very am pleased. I haven't tried the video feature so cannot say about it.

Reviews.Title: BATTERIES DRAINs LIKE IN A SECOND...
Reviews.Author: Aakshi
Reviews.Content: Batteries won't last even 10 pics... worst camera ever..Bought it as a gift, now m stuck with if forever. Don't even want to sell it someone else and waste their money..

Reviews.Title: Crapy Camera
Reviews.Author: Scarlett
Reviews.Content: Takes crappy pictures, bad quality and focus, and confusing to use, It broke after a week. Never buying anything like this again. Very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Me encanta
Reviews.Author: Roy Soto Cruz "rsotocruz"
Reviews.Content: Tengo dos cámaras canon y en realidad creo que es la mejor marca en cámaras digitales, espero pronto comprar una camara profesional. aparte de esta tengo una g12 y es increíblemente buena

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot SX 130IS
Reviews.Author: Nancy Mielnicki "NancyM"
Reviews.Content: I have had a Canon film camera for many years. I know others who own a Canon digital. I liked the camera but found it a bit difficult to operate. I did not like the way I had to work the dials on the back at all.

Reviews.Title: Battery Life
Reviews.Author: DR D
Reviews.Content: I returned this Camera because the battery life is very short. I took about 15 pictures and then the battery life indicator came on. I put in new batteries and had the same results.

Reviews.Title: Worst Camera Ever..
Reviews.Author: sgs
Reviews.Content: The camera is the worst one can have since the evolution of digital camera's. The Battery life sucks at not more than 15 pics for normal battery cells and if we use higher version (high capacity) battery cells which are costly, then it takes around 50-60 pics. Which is again quite bad compared to the other cameras in the market. You need to carry a lot of cells if u are on a trip and have to fiddle with those when you are about to catch an excellent rare pic. This all is really frustrating and I recommend not to buy this camera at all unless you are ready to face the hassles of changing batteries and all. Features wise, there may be few in the category who can beat this. But, noone wants to be in hassles of changing batteries again and again to get good pictures. Hope Canon comes up with a fix for this camera soon.

Reviews.Title: Please dont buy
Reviews.Author: lisa thomas
Reviews.Content: Ok, so I realllly wanted to LOVE this camera, after doing a lot of research in my budget range, i finally decided to buy this camera despite all the negative review it got on the standby time when you take a photo.Yea, so I cant be waiting 4 seconds everytime I take a picture just to see what it looks like, I mean if im paying 200$ for a camera, I better be happy with it. And the image quality looks too Digitaltly if thats even a a word. I would not waste my precious time or money on this camera. Canon tried, but not this time. sorry guys.

Reviews.Title: horrible
Reviews.Author: sonia
Reviews.Content: i just bought this camera not even a month ago and best buy wont return cameras after 14 days!!! im stuck with this awful camera. i originally bought it due to consumer reports and them saying it was a compact camera with great zoom. this camera is bulky and heavy. i went to bahamas hoping to get some great pics but came out with many low quality, dull colors, blurry images. now, i cant even get any images on the screen. the stupid thing broke, mailing it to the manufacture. im about to go to jamaica and without a camera. i highly do not recommend buying one of these cameras

Reviews.Title: Horrible battery life
Reviews.Author: Lisa
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera and returned it on the same day.  After 5 photos at high setting and 1 video, the battery low indicator came on.  This camera will eat up batteries, it does not come with a rechargeable battery.  The flash requires that you manually flip to use.  Most parts are plastic and the body does not feel like it is built sturdy.  While the camera is on, you can hear it running.  I was disappointed after my purchase to learn how this camera does not live up to what it is supposed to be.  Seems like a good deal with all the features but I would not recommend you buy this camera.

Reviews.Title: not such a good deal
Reviews.Author: Cheri Miehe "Devsmom"
Reviews.Content: I love Canons but this is the worst I have ever had.  The battery life if ridiculous.  And it doesn't take nearly as good pictures as any other Canon I have owned.  Definitely disappointed in this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Not Great
Reviews.Author: Mrs. P "Mom to 3"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for real estate photos and the wide angle capabilities it offered.  I also liked the fact that it takes AA batteries rather than having a battery that needs to be charged.  So far, I would say that I am not thrilled with the camera although I have yet to take any real estate photos with it.  Rather, I have taken family photos and a variety of spontaneous shots, and the picture quality is good but not great.  Also, the camera is rather bulkier than I thought it would be.  One nice feature is that the flash doesn't automatically engage which gives the photographer a bit more control over lighting effects; however, that's just not a big enough advantage to make me love this camera, especially for the price I paid.

Reviews.Title: total disappointment, it got returned!
Reviews.Author: Book Mama
Reviews.Content: This camera went back.  It is NOT up to Canon standards at all.  It was impossible to get quality photos with indoor shots.  Don't waste your $$, there's a reason it is only a little over a hundred bucks!!!

Reviews.Title: Cannot record more than 10min on video
Reviews.Author: suprvw
Reviews.Content: The camera works good, but the put a limitation where you cannot record more than 10min on video.  I wrote cannon and their reply was that that's what camcorders are for.  So I'm returning this camera and buying a camcorder that can take stills.  NOT A CANON CAMCORER!

Reviews.Title: Can't take pictures outside!
Reviews.Author: Flys4Fun
Reviews.Content: I would like to see someone take pictures with this outside! No viewfinder, so when your looking at the shinny screen outside all you see is your own face!

Reviews.Title: Worst Camera - don't waste your money
Reviews.Author: Erin Gray Mccaskill
Reviews.Content: I just wanted a working camera to use for pictures of my kids.  On my daughter's third birthday, it just stopped working (three months and two weeks after buying it.)  I have to have it shipped for repairs and won't get any birthday pictures!  After a few years of use, I would understand and expect that but it is still new.  I would never buy this product again.

Reviews.Title: I should have known better
Reviews.Author: Elaine - "Busy Business Owner"
Reviews.Content: The idea of only getting 6 shots from my batteries is ridiculous.... What was Canon thinking? Less than 45 minutes after the UPS guy dropped off my camera, was I printing out a return label.... GREAT! I get to TRY out a camera for $30!! I can try some "As Seen On TV" products for $15 and for a longer testing period!I went to my local camera store and the guy told me that being that I'm a little bit more advanced, to save my money, he'd give me a break on a nice starter DSLR. I compared prices and yes, he's giving me a break.From the shots that I took, I would still have to do more adjustments in Photoshop and it would be nice to raise my rates, but that's just bad business.

Reviews.Title: very disapointed
Reviews.Author: EF
Reviews.Content: I always have heard Canon is one of the best; not this one!  Bought Christmas 2010 for my husband for an upcoming family event; wanted to get use to it - it continues to take blurry photos. To try and get a clear photo, you have to hold the button slightly for it to self focus and then snap for the photo - by then the grandchildren have already moved and lost the chance of a good picture.  I regret very much getting this camera and feel it was a total waste of money!

Reviews.Title: No zoom in video mode the sound of the lens is very loud
Reviews.Author: GK "GK"
Reviews.Content: No zoom in video modeVery loud sound when you zoom in and out or when you turn the camera on/off and the lens come out or go insideWhen I try to use my camera to take picture of my daughter on the stage in the theater every one looked at me to tell me with their eyes the sound of the lens is very loudBad quality at 400 ISO and above

Reviews.Title: Beach photos not to be taken with this camera
Reviews.Author: patspics
Reviews.Content: I am so disappointed in this camera.1. You  can't see what photo you are taking in bright light. The picture is very faint.2. The view finder is still needed to correct the above problem.3. The battery life is extremely short.4. Why didn't you print out a decent booklet that is easy to use? The instructions that came with the camera are totally inadequate.  I find your instruction disc very poor.5. I looked for another brand of point and shoots and none have a view finder. Do you all just go along with one idea and have no thoughts as to what is really needed?

Reviews.Title: Costs too much to use....
Reviews.Author: briantulsa69
Reviews.Content: I would have loved to keep this camera because it's a top-notch model but it eats batteries like crazy and you have to use the memory cards with the most G's to get the full benefit of the camera. Those are a minimum of 55 bucks each. Also, since it shoots vids in HD you have to have an HD computer monitor or television to watch them AND since they're hidef vids and pics you can't get as many on each of the memory cards. So, they fill up fast (only a little more than an hour of video) and you have to run out and buy another 55.00 memory card. I returned if for a less sophisticated model that does the same thing.

Reviews.Title: Needs a solar powered backpack....
Reviews.Author: JesusChrysler "Brian__Buffalo"
Reviews.Content: As a recently retired professional photographer, I decided to lighten my load a bit by selling off my Canon pro systems. I did lighten the load, until I found out how quickly this quirky little beast gobbled up batteries! Ready for this? Count 'em, three photos for each set of two AA batteries. Yes, three pix per set. Totally unacceptable. A disgrace to the Canon family. I'll go back to using my girlfriend's awesome Kodak point & shoot which provides hundreds of shots per set of two AA batteries.

Reviews.Title: Just OK
Reviews.Author: Udhay
Reviews.Content: Pros:The quality of the photographs is good.Works pretty good in low light situations.Lots of options. If you know them you can take amazing pics in all conditions.Picture looks shaky without flash in some conditions.ConsThe camera is heavy.Remembering to lift the flash is a pain. If you don't remember then by the time you take a second shot with the flash on the moment is lost.

Reviews.Title: Canon powershot
Reviews.Author: bassfish51 "bassfish51"
Reviews.Content: Excellent camera, I love it so far but need to use it a lot more prior to making an accurate appraisal.

Reviews.Title: Do Not Buy the Case Logic DCB 302 with this camera!
Reviews.Author: JBinMD
Reviews.Content: The camera doesn't fit in to that case (Case Logic DCB 302).  That case is too small -- it is a slick case, but not large enough for the camera it is linked up w in a package.  I'm not sure why is shows up with the SX130IS camera as it is not a match.  The camera is a gift so we aren't reviewing that yet.  Very disappointed that I now have a case that won't work!  And, need to get one soon!

Reviews.Title: Camera quality not acceptable.  Made in China may be the reason
Reviews.Author: Ranparia
Reviews.Content: Great Camera, with one BIG problem, A new set of AA battery lasts for only 10 minites!  I ran through 6 sets of batteries just to set the program. I hated to send it back.  Amazon was very nice to smoothly accept it back with immediate return of almost full price I paid.If you want to buy this Camera, buy it only from Amazon.  May be you have better luck then mine.Ranparia.

Reviews.Title: The auto is terrible, bland pictures
Reviews.Author: H. Caspi
Reviews.Content: In the past few months, I've been taking pictures with a Nikon D5100. The quality is stupendous. I didn't realize how spoiled I was with the quality  until I got this camera. The quality in Auto is just horrible, in my opinion. I'm sorry, but my 6 year old p&s; Canon S1 took much better pictures (I sold it to buy this one, thinking that technology has improved). This is like a toy camera with lots of ways to change around the setting of your picture (making you feel like a real photographer), while the quality you're starting with is really low. The colors are washed out, the contrast is very sharp, the colors are nonexistent. I returned this to get the Canon 780, which I've borrowed in the past and loved. It's smaller with less manual options, but the quality from the get-go is superior, and it's smaller so more convenient. Don't buy this cr@p.

Reviews.Title: DON'T FORGET TO BUY SD CARD!
Reviews.Author: Free
Reviews.Content: Went to Zanzibar Islands, Tanzania, ready to point and shoot but no pictures...forgetful me.... I didn't buy the SD card. It's so inconvenient for cameras not to come with this needed accessory.  Thank God for my detail oriented boyfriend (JCS) who surprised me with an awesome SLR digi cam he bought for us.  Thanks for saving the trip and making memories babe!  If you're like me and don't read the small print, I'm telling you: DON'T FORGET TO BUY A SD CARD!!!!Best Wishes!

Reviews.Title: Missed opportunity
Reviews.Author: Saibal
Reviews.Content: Was waiting for a review of this camera and the only one I saw was by the user on amazon.com. Got motivated and purchased it this morning and returned it by evening.Wanted to get a compact camera that can do 1080p with a larger display, which would be the two features that my next camera should have, to beat my current Canon Powershot TX1 (which has 720p video and very tiny display). Since, Canon has "disabled optical zooming during 1080p video recording" on all their compact cameras, I had to climb down from the 1080p requirement. On the second spec, the large display on this camera is nice.Here are my issues:1. The black body really looks cheap and fragile.2. The controls for manual adjustment is very difficult even for my small hand.3. I have to rotate the dial on top to choose between still shots and movie mode. In my TX1, the shutter button and the video recording buttons are separate and that makes switching between operations a breeze.4. The camera is far heavier than my TX1 and doesn't feel comfortable for video recording.5. A camera with so many features, but no hard copy manual. It is not exactly a point and shoot model and NO MANUAL. You have to print it from the CD-ROM.6. Manual focus feature was new to me on a compact camera and I couldn't get it to do what it claims. I could see the focusing distance bar change, but no change in the image focus.7. You have to MANUALLY pop the built-in flash every time you need the flash! Was this a requirement from the museums that ban flash photography?There are plenty of other features that are not there in my TX1, but they are not a necessity for me.Appended later comments here:My goals for a new compact camera was probably not in line with most buyers/readers. I also own a Canon DSLR and I take that out when I want to shoot flora and fauna. All my cameras from the days of Canon A1 (film SLR) have been Canon. I love the convenience of a compact camera as a single device for both still and high quality video during hikes/camping/skiing/travel/vacation. As I aged, I got a bit tired of lugging my giant Lowepro backpack with all my camera gear. I wish Canon would give me a 1080p camera upgraded from the Canon Powershot TX1 style and with a bigger LCD screen. Currently, Caonon doesn't allow operating the optical zoom while recording in 1080p mode.PS: I did shoot with the camera. It does take nice shots and performs better in low light shooting compared to my TX1.

Reviews.Title: Can't charge
Reviews.Author: Arthur J Sutton
Reviews.Content: May seem like a minor detail to most, but the fact that you cannot plug in the camera in order to charge the battery is enough of a reason for us to return it.  Oh well.  Unfortunetly Amazon doesn't include this detail in the product descriptions.

ProductInfo.Features:
Shoot 720p HD video with stereo sound while using the optical zoom
High-powered 12x wide-angle optical zoom with Optical Image Stabilizer
Scene modes like Miniature Effect for Movie and Fisheye Effect; Advanced Smart AUTO
DIGIC 4 Image Processor, with 12.1 megapixels; 3.0-inch wide LCD
Capture images to SD/SDHC/SDXC memory cards (not included)
ProductInfo.Name: Canon PowerShot SX130IS 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 12x Wide Angle Optical Image Stabilized Zoom with 3.0-Inch LCD
